results.description:
A vegan meetup is where vegans (whatever their PHILOSOPHY about being vegan) and vegan-oriented persons (NOT "tire-kickers" who come "to gawk at the vegans") with similar interests get together and hang out.  If you TWEET, we instantly become a TWEETUP.

Because of our array of motives, some focus more on diet alone, while others are concerned with an integrated world-and-life view.  We're a diverse lot, so we'll meet LOTS of folks whose interests are somewhat different from our own, but who share the vegetarian and vegan interests with usm but we may NOT agree with everyone on how important each of the elements in another's vegan worldview and personality is.

A subset of our >6000 members attend any particular event.  Further, by networking with BVS, GBBCC, MARC, BVA, NEAVS, other veg groups, and other meetups, we get to know one another.

Grasshopper, My Thai, Veggie Planet, Veggie Galaxy, Clover Food Lab, True Bistro, Red Lentil, Organic Natural, Life Alive, and others vegan hangouts are our favorite meeting sites.

We're always "BECOMING a vegan group"; BRING SOMETHING VEGAN-ORIENTED TO SHARE (newspaper clipping, book or DVD, photos, etc.) with other attendees as a way for them to get to know you and you to know them. Sharing IS "becoming" for veg*ans.

What and how can we share? A news article, a story with a vegan interest, some information (old or new) with a vegan slant, a memento of traveling as a vegan, info on a great vegan website or resource or event, etc.  Be creative.  Pleasantly surprise us.

A Vegan Meetup is held on the 1st Saturday of each month - 11:30 am to 2 pm
at either
Clover Food Lab
Harvard Square, Dunster Street? of Mass Avenue
Downstairs
Cambridge, MA 02138

or Clover Food Lab or elsewhere (watch the announcements; Clover Food Lab is the default location)

Vegetarian Happy Hours [Happy Hour with Vegetarians] or monthly dining out group
Join us AND the other Vegetarians-Of-Boston Meetups for the regular Vegetarian Happy Hours - or monthly dining out group
2nd Thursday of the Month - http://Vegetarian.Meetup.com/27/ (site varies)
1st Saturday of the Month - 11:30 am-2:00 pm (site varies, often at Clover in Harvard Square)
3rd Sunday of the Month - 4:00 pm-6:30 pm - Grasshopper - www.BostonVeg.org

We hold other events at an all-vegetarian restaurant, often by following the events of local vegetarian and animal rights groups.

Dinner with Dharma is held monthly at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center (GBBCC) in Cambridge, MA - $10 for the all-vegan buffet.  March-October

We also tag along with BVS (BostonVeg.org), BVA (BostonVegan.org), Vegan Meetup events, and MARC.

results.description:
Boston PHP is the largest education-focused Meetup in New England.

We are a lot more than PHP!

We have been meeting since 2002. We have more than 3,600 members, and usually meet every month on a Wednesday. We have a wide range of topics all related to PHP, Web Development, and Open Source technology.

All meetings are free, and we encourage everyone to participate and get involved and help grow the PHP community. After each meeting we typically go to a nearby restaurant/bar/pub for more informal discussion.

Our 99 Percent Solution strategy offers services beyond monthly meetups.  For example, we have developed four virtual self-study groups that are run year-round: PHP Percolate!, jQuery jAM, HTML5 Brunch and Drupal Diner.  More than 175 members have been enshrined on our Self-Study Group | Wall of Accomplishment.

In addition, more than 100 members receive job postings from other members via our Boston PHP Job Board (beta).

We video all of our meetups. To access our videos, just  follow this link.

View our upcoming meetups:

http://events.bostonphp.org

Topics we cover:

We base all our meetings from attendee suggestions. If you have an idea for a topic that you would like to see (or present), please use our ideas section.

Calling all presenters:

We want to have a mix of events from beginner and advanced topics. We are looking for presenters for each of these topics. If you (or someone you know) are experienced in a topic and have some presentation skills - then please let us know. We are also looking for volunteers to help us with planning, logistics, and other odd jobs.
results.name: Boston PHP

The Boston Spanish Meetup Group:

Este es un grupo social en español. La gente es súper simpática y el grupo nos da chance de conocer a otras personas con intereses internacionales. La mayoria hablan español como primer idioma o avanzado pero siempre vienen algunos de todo nivel quienes se encuentran unos a otros.   Hablamos completamente en español.

Las reuniones son oportunidades informales para conocer y charlar con otros miembros del grupo.  Tenemos varios eventos para complacer a diferentes intereses.  Siempre estamos buscando nuevot organizadors, asi que si te animes, manda un mensaje a Kaela.

Ahora conectate con nosotros en Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/meetupdeboston

Nota sobre finanzas: Cobramos $10 por año o $1 por evento a cada miembro para apoyar en los gastos de nuestra pagina de meetup ($144/año) y de las etiquetas. De vez en cuando tambien negocios nos apatrocinan pagando los gastos de la pagina por un periodo de 6 meses, por ejemplo ahora con MasSpanish (es posible en el futuro que existen otras formas de patrocinio, pero por ahora esto es). Cuando tenemos patrocinio y tambien mucha gente asistiendo los eventos de Cambridge, recibo mas de lo que necesito para cubrir gastos. He decidido que cuando esto pasa, donare el dinero extra a Common Hope (www.commonhope.org), una ONG fantastico en Guatemala. Espero que les parezca este arreglo. Para mi resulta un "win-win" - es poca la contribucion de cada uno, pero siempre tengo lo necesario para cubrir gastos, y tambien hay otros beneficiarios en Guatemala.

¡Bienvenidos!

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Japanese and English Language Club!　（日本語はこちら）

We connect language learners with native speakers of Japanese or English. Practice speaking, find out about cultures, styles, history, current events, and meet new friends!

People who want to speak (or hear) Japanese or English can join. It is open to all ages, and all levels of skill. Generally speaking, all people are welcome to join this club, however it is expected that everyone abide by the following basic guidelines:

    Individuals must respect one another.

    Let's keep a positive attitude about things!

    Let's have a really great time!

Unlike a classroom setting, we meet in a casual environment such as a restaurant, and people just form natural conversations or practice groups. And if you are looking for a language exchange partner, you are likely to find one here.

Please fill your application/profile as much as possible. Because we want to know who you are, what you are looking for in our group. Write up your introduction in several lines. As for language skill set, you could say "English - Native, Japanese - Beginner" or vice versa. We may decline your application if it doesn't tell much about you...

We are not a Dating club. A lot of boys and girls come to our event, and we understand you may find someone very attractive. That's okay you get feeling to someone as long as it is appropriate and harmless. But please be careful what you say and what you do. We do ban people if leadership team decide he/she is not appropriate to be in our club. We mean it.

There is no membership cost to join this club. However, utilizing meetup website cost us $180/yr. So We would appreciate you to make a small donation, if you are attending our events frequently and enjoy being there. We setup 90 days as free trial period, and if you enjoy attending our event after the trial period, member due can be made from our home page, "Member Dues $5.00 yearly" link on left side bar. Member dues are mainly used for Meetup website cost. If member dues are funded more than enough to cover website cost, we might plan to do special event to appreciate your support. However, if we meet at a restaurant, people pay individually at the end. Some venues, such as a karaoke club, would have an equally shared cost.

Here in The Center we believe that photography is a powerful language for creating, interpreting and expressing . The Center provides: · Ongoing juried exhibitions of fine art photography by artists from around the world. · Educational programming and workshops taught by leading photographic artists and experienced industry professionals. · A facility where photographic artists can meet, learn and share ideas. Some of our members are experienced fine artists trained in traditional techniques of photography and printmaking. Other members want to become more familiar with the art itself. Boston Photography Center is where you wish to take your skills to the next level .We are united by our passion for using our lens to create works of fine art and by our love for the evolving, creative medium of photography.

results.description:
MA Korean Language & Culture Group is open to anybody in the greater Boston area who is interested in the Korean language and culture. While this group is intended for learning Korean, we have speakers of other Asian languages such as Chinese and Japanese too. Our meeting is truly multi-cultural, with conversation happening in Korean, English, Chinese and Japanese. If you speak one of these languages and if you are interested in the Korean language and culture, we are positive that you will have fun in this group. We are looking forward to seeing you soon!

IMPORTANT: PLEASE READ AND AGREE WITH THE RULES BELOW BEFORE YOU JOIN THIS GROUP

MA Korean Language & Culture Group mission statement, policies and rules

MA Korean Language & Culture Group is open to anybody who is interested in the Korean language and culture. The mission of this group is to provide members with fun and safe environment to meet people with the same interest. All activities in this group are done on a non-profit basis. We intend to keep this group as open and casual as possible. Therefore, we restrict our group policies and rules to the following very basic ones.

1.
To be a member, you will need to go to our Meetup® website http://korean.meetup.... and create a profile and introduce yourself. Any profile with no introduction will be deleted periodically. The reason why this is done is stated on http://korean.meetup....

2.
This group engages in non-profit meetings and activities with the intention solely to promote friendship and cultural/ linguistic exchange of participating members. Any commercial activities within the group are strictly prohibited. With the exceptions of collecting the actual cost of food/beverages incurred in the meetings and any voluntary contributions made to the management of the group, no fees shall be collected from the members.

3.
The regular meeting is generally held on the first Saturday of the month at a location announced only to the members registered on the Meetup® website. The monthly meeting is open to all members of the group. There are also additional sporadic spin-off BBQ parties, excursions, movie nights etc. The regular attendees of the group’s monthly meetings receive prioritized invitations for these spin-off meetings because of the space limitation.

4.
The mission of this group is to promote friendship and cultural/linguistic exchange of participating members regardless of their nationalities, linguistic, cultural, ethnic or religious backgrounds. With the mission of our group as such, it is expected that members refrain from making comments and discussions that are considered to be offensive to or attacking/criticizing any particular nationalities, people from particular linguistic, cultural, ethnic or religious backgrounds. What is considered offensive or attacking/criticizing can sometimes be a subjective matter. However, as a group, we have our own commonly shared unwritten standards. The group has the right to warn, suspend or disqualify any member if our group policies and rules are not observed.

5.
As this is a non-profit group managed and operated by a small number of volunteers, successful meetings depend largely on your participation and cooperation. Please make sure to RSVP for our meeting at least a couple of days in advance on our Meetup® website. Please try your best to come on time to the venue. This is especially important when the venue is a restaurant and a reservation has been made for the meeting. Please make sure to research on the transportation to the venue on your own. It is your responsibility to arrive at the venue on time safely.

As you can see above, the policies and rules in this group come from the common sense.

Simply put, the rules are;

1. Introduce yourself when you join the group.
2. Do not make money from the group.
3. Regular meeting is normally held on the first Saturday of the month.
4. Be nice to other members.
5. Plan and show up on time on your own.

Again, it is our intention to keep this group as open and casual as possible. We believe the common sense rules stated above are already practiced by most members. However, with the increasing number of new members joining the group, we took this opportunity to reiterate them formally. Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions.

MA Korean Language Group

results.description:
Mandarin Chinese conversation practice group, for all levels. The group is open and self-led. When we run out of vocabulary, we chat about China in English :) Welcome native speakers who would like to meet conversation partners, or lead activities.

Housekeeping:

Here are some guidelines to keep the group functioning smoothly, information on the site easy to find, and keep emails to a minimum. Thanks in advance for reading these and complying!

Meetups:

Members are welcome to suggest events and encouraged to host. Approval is at discretion of the lead Organizer. Events that consist of Mandarin conversation opportunities or are primarily in Mandarin are on-topic and will likely be approved. Events that relate to Chinese or Asian American culture may be permitted on a case by case basis. A Meetup is an event where group members meet each other to do something. Events hosted by outside agencies or other groups are NOT Meetups, unless there is a specific meeting time and location set for members to go together. If you'd like to share a Meetup from another group, please check first with the host and if they agree, you can post on our Discussion section for our members. Duplicate events from other Meetup groups will only be allowed at discretion of lead Organizer, and should only be rsvp'd to once by any member. Any cost must be clearly noted in the beginning of the description. Any event that is NOT primarily Mandarin language practice must be marked "OT" (off-topic) in the title line.

Resources:

If you'd like to share resources for language learning or other community notices or events, please post in the Discussion section. Anything OT for our group but related, may be a useful post. If it is too far OT it will be deleted. Commercial and business posts are not welcome here, sorry. Do not advertise your tutoring services. You are welcome to state in your member profile if you tutor or teach but no business information nor soliciting members, please. Free events at language schools, or open houses may be permitted. If a member wishes to post a review of a Mandarin language learning program or resource they have used, please do so in Discussion section.

Members:

Many of our members are in the US, or in MA, for brief time periods. Please delete your membership if you have left the group or the area- it helps keep the list up to date. Members inactive over six months are subject to deletion anytime. If you wish to stay in the group please remember to visit the page and reply occasionally in order to keep your profile active.

Language exchange partners:

Please do not post for conversation partners with any personal contact info on the site! You are welcome to post for members in your area, and to attend a Meetup to meet in person. Many language exchange partnerships have begun at Meetup events. Be sure to meet the person first before deciding to exchange any personal contact info and use your common sense, for example meeting at public places.

Photos:

Pictures of our members at Meetups are welcome, no more than 10 from each event please. Photos will be deleted at Organizer's discretion if inappropriate, irrelevant to the group's mission, or otherwise judged unsuitable to this group by the Organizer. A picture of the Meetup location or food, for future event planning, might be approved by the Organizer for posting. Or a snap or two of a cultural performance. Or they might not. Thanks in advance for keeping it relevant.

Wishing you the best in your studies, see you soon!

Reece
results.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

topics.name: Vegan Culture Building and Values Education

results.description:
Boston Thoughtful World-Transforming Abolitionist Vegan Movers and Shakers

Activist Vegan

If you are anything else, you should join the Boston Vegetarian Meetup

Vegan

If you are a vegan, activist or otherwise, you should join the Boston Vegan Meetup and  the Boston Vegetarian Meetup.


If you seek to transform the public world as a vegan mover and shaker, AND if you have a proven track record of engaging the public or doing serious research on any of a range of sociological, political, economic, or psychological topics related to such world transformation, and IF your concern is the ABOLITION of animal oppression by humans (whatever the timeframe) AND you believe that there are "intelligent evidence-based interventions" which can HELP to effect (bring about) that historical outcome, this is for you.

We don't serve alcohol, smoke, or listen to loud music at our social meetings.

We THINK together, we SHARE our research on social transformations that are EXPLICITLY RELATED TO vegan values (and not peripheral to them, such as mere 'social change' in itself or orthogonal values).

Our working projects will include local, regional, national, and international efforts on (a) World Vegetarian Day and (b) World/International Vegan Day AND (c) Vegetarian Awareness Month.  We will exchange with the IVU (International Vegetarian Union, which has a biennial World Vegetarian Congress), VUNA (Vegetarian Union of North America), NAVS (North American Vegetarian Society, which has an annual Vegetarian Summerfest), SERV (Society of Ethical and Religious Vegetarians), VRG (Vegetarian Resource Group), and VRC (Vegetarian Resource Center).

We will seek to engage vegetarian and vegan groups on vegan and abolitionist terms so that greater local, regional, national, continental, and international dialogue and effective abolitionist action can be achieved.

We will gather socially at educationally edifying all-vegan events AND for ad hoc work groups that engage any total or partial efforts to achieve our goals of a kinder, cruelty-free world in which all animal agriculture has been abolished voluntarily by our human species.

Additional topics for ad hoc working groups include:

  • Campus Vegan Group Support and Student/Graduate Professional Continuities
  • Copyright-Free PublicDomain VegMusic Project
  • Intentionality and Other Persons - Developing the Public Phenomenology Respecting All Persons
  • Nonanimal Research Methods Centers at Major Research Centers
  • Religious and Spiritual Group Involvements
  • Song Lyrics about Vegan Values
  • Survey and Analysis of the Vegetarian Restaurant Industry - Business Issues
  • Vegan Culinary Certificate Programs
  • Vegan Physicians' Website
  • Vegan Restaurants in Boston - Business Issues
  • Veganizing Standard Menus in non-vegetarian restaurants
  • Vegetarian Resource Library at U Mass Boston Healey Library
  • Veggie Parades (Boston, Worcester, and beyond - already one in New York City)
results.name: Boston Thoughtful World-Transforming Abolitionist Vegans

results.description: We are a group of multi-level people interested in the study of Philosophy. We sit around debating or discussing at length topics from metaphysics, epistemology, ethics, and logic. We meet every week, meetings on Skype and at a restaurant (addressing the same topic) are alternating every other week. To join the fist time to the skype calls please send a skype contact request to Andras (skype id: "andras.pap", and be logged into skype at the time of the call). New texts are always discussed first on Skype, attending both or either of the two types of meetings is encouraged. Probably the best way to learn about us is to check out our past events in the "Past" tab on our "Home" page and our "BPMU_ReadingList" and "NearFuturePlan" files on our "Files" page. Come and join the discussion. (Don't let the background image discourage you.)
results.name: The Boston Philosophy Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Wine Meetup Group!

This group is dedicated to all that is wine. Welcome. Whether you are just learning how to hold your glass, are a casual wine drinker, or a passionate expert, we are happy to have you on board.

Our events range from informal tastings at Boston-area restaurants and wine stores, to large formal events, movies, socials, food and wine pairings, dessert wines, reds, whites, rosés, Old World vs. New World wines, wine terroir vs. varietals, the language of the label, wine-related travel, lectures, history, cooking with wine...

BostonWine is a "big-tent" group, so we welcome anyone and everyone who enjoys the pleasures of table. Come and share a bottle with us.

the organizers

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BostonWine Group Policies and Disclaimer

You must agree to ALL of our policies to be a member of our group and attend our events.

LEGAL DRINKING AGE REQUIRED

You must be of legal drinking age to be a member of our group. By requesting and continuing membership, you swear and affirm that you are over the age of 21. Further, any guests you bring to our events must be 21+ as well. If you intentionally or unintentionally misrepresent your age, or the age of a guest in order to provide alcohol to a person under the age of 21, the organizers will ban you from the group and possibly notify the proper authorities. Please have a photo ID handy when you come to one of our events.

DRUNKEDNESS NOT TOLERATED

Drinking alcohol is a normal activity of this group, but getting drunk is NOT! We expect our members and their guests to know their limits and be responsible wine drinkers. Those who over-indulge to the extent that it disrupts an event, raises safety concerns about the member or others at an event, or potentially presents a liability to the group, will be banned from the group.

By being a member of BostonWine, you agree that you and your guests will follow the guidance of the organizers if told to stop drinking, need to leave, take a cab or ride from a fellow member, etc. Further, at the discretion of the organizers, the proper venue or legal authorities may be notified in cases of extreme safety concerns.

AUTHORTY OF ORGANIZERS

The organizers of BostonWine work hard to create and run great events. In some cases the organizers enter into financial understandings with a venue, supplier, or other third party as part of an event. By requesting membership with BostonWine you acknowledge and accept that the organizers are the only persons with the authority to speak for the group, decide who may or may not be a member of our group, decide what events to plan and how to run them. In particular, you agree that the organizer of an event has final authority on how the event is to proceed, what adjustments might have to be made during the event to ensure it is a success, what constitutes proper behavior and generally how to maintain order.   

PROPER BEHAVOR

BostonWine events generally are casual, educational and fun. We expect all members to behave as responsible adults and show respect for other members, their opinions, similarities as well as their differences. If an issue arises with another member, staff at a meetup venue, or on the group's web site, you agree to notify the organizers and let him/her handle the situation. Further, you agree under no circumstance to argue or otherwise get into a dispute with another person during an event.

The consumption of alcoholic beverages may impair one's judgments or actions to act responsibly. If a member participates in any action that the organizer deems is harmful or threatening to themselves, another person, animal or property, or whose behavior reflects poorly on BostonWine, that member will be banned from the group.

Our discussion boards, event comments, etc. are not forums for airing personal disputes, and doing will result in your removal from the group. Using our web site to distribute email virus or other malware is a crime and will be reported to proper legal authorities.

FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY

Members are responsible for paying their own way and settling their tab before leaving a meetup in a restaurant or other venue where a group tab was open. 

GOVERNMENT WARNING ON HEALTH CONSEQUENCES of CONSUMING ALCOHOL

The organizers and our members believe that moderate consumption of wine with food is part of a healthly lifestyle. However, alcohol consumption is ill advised for certain people in certain circumstances. By joining BostonWine, you acknowledge that there is a government warning concerning the health effects of consuming alcoholic beverages: (1) According to the Surgeon General, women should not drink alcoholic beverages during pregnancy because of the risk of birth defects. (2) Consumption of alcoholic beverages impairs your ability to drive a car or operate machinery, and may cause health problems.

MUST HAVE A PROFILE PHOTO

To join or remain in this group ALL Members are required to have a representative main profile photo at all times. A head shot is best, but not required. You will not be able to join without a photo and will be removed for lack thereof. We do this to ensure the safety of our members, but also to simplify the lives of the organizers.

PUBLIC IMAGES

From time to time, members take photographic, digital or video images of event participants and post these images to our web site. You hereby agree to allow the BostonWine group to display those images without expectation of privacy or remuneration. Members are free to request, however, that a particular image of themselves be removed by contacting one of the organizers; final determination of whether the image should be removed however is at the discretion of the organizer.

NO_SHOW POLICY

Most of our events have wait lists due to their popularity. Not showing up to an event that you have RSVP'd to is disrespectful to your fellow members, makes it difficult for the organizer to plan events and may incur financial penalties. As a result, after 3 "no-shows," the organizer may decide to remove you from the group.

DISCLAIMER

By being a member of the BostonWine group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any and all group events, interactions with our meetup web site and other members. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's organizers, members, companies, officers, or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to yourself, your guests or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity.

During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The organizers are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. Be aware of your limits and respect your fellow group members; DON'T DRINK AND DRIVE.

By joining the BostonWine meetup group and remaining a member, you acknowledge and accept these points.

Thanks,

the organizers

If you enjoy Karaoke and live in or near Boston, then this is the Meetup for you. We generally get everyone together once a month for a fun evening of Karaoke. We have met at the Limelight in Boston and the Karaoke Courtside in Cambridge. We'll probably try some new places as well.

No prior experience necessary. Just be ready to have a good time. We have a rather ecclectic group and the music will range from pop to rock to oldies to soul to alternative to rap to country. We welcome all types of music.

Some of our members are very good singers and they provide quality entertainment. Other members are just starting out we give them a supportive and encouraging environment to learn. So whether you are a professional or a novice, you would fit right in. I look forward to seeing you at an upcoming get together.

results.description:
Our purpose is to organize a fun, safe, and convenient place for Frenchies and Frenchie owners and lovers to get together to play in the Boston area. As long as you have a love for Frenchies, anyone is welcome to attend and join in on the fun!

People considering adding a Frenchie to their family should definitely stop by.  We're always willing to talk about how great our dogs are.

You and/or your Frenchie's picture are required for membership.

Please NO breeder/breeding solicitations, regardless of membership.

Meetup fees and dues:

Meetup.com charges $14.99/month to host individual groups on this site. The organizer is responsible for paying this fee every month. Additionally, some meetup venues charge $7-10 per Frenchie and/or a fee as much as $50 for venue use. At each meetup that the organizer attends will collect the suggested $3 donation that will go towards the monthly $14.99 fee. In addition you can donate anytime via the "Chip In" button on the home page. If at the end of the month, the organizer does not collect enough money through donations, the organizer will pay the difference. If the organizer receives more than enough, the extra money will be banked for use to cover shortages for future months and/or additional meetup expenses. At the end of the year if there are additional funds available a portion will be rolled over into the next year and a portion will be donated to a Frenchie in need at the French Bulldog Rescue Network.
results.name: The Boston French Bulldog Meetup Group

results.description:
Momtourage Moms Group is an established, successful community of women in Burlington and surrounding towns, who have come together to meet, support, and share in the joys and frustrations of daily child care. Our goal is to enrich the lives of our members by offering a variety of activities for families, provide a forum of topics of interest, and give back to our communities through charitable activities.

Caring for children shouldn't be isolating; Momtourage is proud to provide members opportunities to meet and connect with others in the area through home-based play dates, meetups at parks and play centers, and moms' nights out and in at members' homes. This is a group that will provide you opportunities to meet others and make bonds, both for yourself and for children, which can last a lifetime!

The annual fee is $21 and gives you access to our calendar of many events, message board, many clubs including Supper Club, Cooking Crew, Not Just Sushi Night, Motherless Mothers, and several Momtourage sponsored (free to members) events and activities.

Participation is key to success of the group; therefore, we encourage our members to share their ideas and suggestions and schedule play dates. Be sure to check our Message Board for daily updates and share some messages of your own!

 

PLEASE, before petitioning to join our group, be sure that your Meetup username is your name (last name not needed) and not initials or combination of letters and numbers. We like to "know" who our members are and find it difficult to do so if we're not on at least a first-name basis.

Also, be prepared to post a photo of YOU and not just your child(ren) so that we all feel comfortable seeing the face behind the name - it will also help members recognize each other at events.
results.name: Momtourage Moms Group

results.description:
!! YOU WILL NOT BE APPROVED UNLESS YOU ANSWER THE PROFILE QUESTIONS !!

Hey Boston Gay Couples! Are you looking to expand your social circle and meet other LGBTI couples? You are in the right place! We are a social group for gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender and intersex couples. 

We are focused on making new friends and having a great meal and conversation at our monthly meetups. The meetups (and people in the group) are very relaxed and laid back and a good time for all. 

This group is ALL-INCLUSIVE of men, women, FTM, MTF, intersex, and gender-queer individuals, in a committed couple (or triad etc). 

This is a SOCIAL group, NOT a sexual one. This group is not intended to facilitate hookups/swinging.

Yes, singles are allowed to join. If you are a single person, please fill out the profile questions to the best of your ability, and explain why you would like to join a couples' group.

!! YOU WILL NOT BE APPROVED UNLESS YOU ANSWER THE PROFILE QUESTIONS !!


***Group Policies***

1. Please treat all members with courtesy and respect - both online and in person
2. Membership is at the discretion of the organizers, and you can be removed from the group at any time.
3. For dining out events, please pay for that which you have ordered, and be sure to include tax and tip in your calculation. 
4. If you RSVP YES for an event, and then do not show up, you will be removed from the group.

results.description: Boston's grand, but let's go south! All those little (and big!) south of Boston Pugs are eager to open their fenced and shaded back yards for Puggie Sunday Socials. WE HAVE VIDEOS! Go to www.youtube.com and type "South of Boston Pug Meetup" into the search field to see them! We're a veritable South Shore (and beyond) melting pot! We have members from Abington, Assonet, Boston, Braintree, Bridgewater, Brockton, Carver, Duxbury, Easton, Halifax, Marion, Marshfield, Middleboro, Needham, New Bedford, North Easton, North Weymouth, Plainville, Pembroke, Plymouth, Portsmouth, South Weymouth, Southbridge, Taunton, Waltham, West Bridgewater, Weymouth, and even from Cranston, Lincoln, Pawtucket, and Tiverton, Rhode Island, and I'm only counting the folks that actually come to the meetups! This is not the time to be shy. Won't you join us? Your Pugs will thank you. Nobody parties like our Puggies! All Pugs are welcome, as are their well behaved non-Puggie canine family members, and of course all human family members are welcome as well. If you are already a member, have a fenced back yard, and want to host one of our Puggie Sunday Socials, just let one of the organizers know!

results.description:
The  Boston Hiking Group is here to help hikers share hiking ideas, get together on all manner of hikes and walks , and get to know some of the mountains of New England.   The vast majority of events are hikes, but we may share other  outdoor activities and activities related to the outdoors (such as the Banff Film Festival or AMC educational events).

Our meetup organizers are all volunteers who are willing to take time to share outdoor experiences.   Often we may want to try out something new and put out a call to see who is willing to join us.  Our trips may range from a 1 mile walk in the park, to a 35 mile day trek in the mountains, or a backpacking trip on the Appalachian Trail.

We expect our members to be thoughtful about which hikes they join, and to be sure they have the appropriate level of knowledge, gear and fitness to undertake the hikes they attempt. 

All are welcome to join the group from beginners to experts; locals to new transplants.    We welcome your participation, your energy and your ideas.    We do have a few questions for new members, which help other members and organizer to know more about you, and help us keep out spammers.
results.name: The Boston Hiking Meetup Group

results.description:
Join other local artists in working on all kinds of art.

We began as a group focused on Artist Trading Cards (ATCs), which are small (3.5- x 2.5-inch) works of original art. We're now an "ATCs+" group, meaning that our activities are open to people working on other art and craft projects, such as altered books, art journals, greeting cards, etc. (See "About Us" for much more detail.)

Our group is open to adult artists and craftspeople (you must be 18+ to join) at all experience levels. Our current members range from professional artists to near-newbies. We offer a variety of demos at our monthly Meetups in Natick, and we're looking to meet more frequently and in other locations. Everyone is welcome at our events--we just ask that you RSVP to let us know you're attending.

This group, which began in mid-2007, has quickly evolved into a lively, highly creative community. As one member puts it: "You feel like you're 'in the flow' from the moment you walk in the door." And yet it's not all about self-expression: Without exception, members have been extraordinarily generous about sharing ideas, techniques and tools.

Signing up for events in either Natick or Holliston is easy. Just join this Meetup group (membership is free). Then RSVP "yes" for the events that interest you.

Bottom line: We take art seriously, but we have a LOT of fun. And we welcome newcomers. Join us.
results.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

results.description:
WELCOME TO BOSTON'S LARGEST AND BEST GAY NETWORKING GROUP!

Meet other local gay professionals. Make new contacts. Find new clients & customers. Hire a new employee. Find a job. And.... make new friends! :oD

In other words:  MEET PEOPLE.  It's just that simple!

Meaningful Networking™

WHO WE ARE

We are an outgoing and friendly group of people--yes, it really exists in Boston!--of all ages and from all walks of life, occupations, and backgrounds. Our events are relaxed and have no attitude.  Many have remarked that we are the "un-Club Cafe." In other words, people will be happy to look you in the eye, walk over, and talk to you!  ;o) And we encourage you to do the same.

OUR NETWORKING EVENTS

We typically hold 2 networking/social events per month around Boston--usually on the third or fourth Tuesday of each month and on a Wednesday which "floats" around--sometimes more if there's a special event planned. Attendance ranges from 50 to about 75 people (and we limit attendance to no more than 100, which makes the events more enjoyable for everyone).  Come join us and make some new friends and professional contacts (like so many others in our group have)!

OUR RSVP POLICY

The only thing we ask is that if you RSVP that you're attending, please be sure to attend.  If your plans change and you can't go, kindly update your RSVP.  Our events sometimes generate waiting lists, so if you RSVP that you're going but then don't show, you're taking a spot away from someone who really wants to be there.  We simply ask that you be considerate of other members.  And the places where we hold events reserve space for us and often hire extra staff, so it's important to know how many people are actually attending.

Also, please do NOT announce our events on social media like Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. Feel free to talk about the group there, but we prefer that interested people actually join first given that attendance at the events is limited (and admittance at the door is not always possible).

PRICE

There is a $9.00 pre-paid fee to attend our regular Tuesday or Wednesday networking events (and we have free events too every so often).  However, if you're new to the group and have never been to an event before, YOUR FIRST EVENT IS FREE so you can check us out (but subject to availability and event type). You'll need to e-mail the organizer, Dan, separately though so he can put your name on the RSVP list as the Meetup system will not let you RSVP without paying.

Also, if it's your first free event and you RSVP and then don't show--and don't change your RSVP beforehand--that still counts as your first event. Sorry for this strict rule, but a number of folks have tried to take advantage and attend multiple free events by claiming that they never went to their first one.

MEET PEOPLE!

Keep in mind that this is a NETWORKING group.  By definition, people who come to our events are looking to meet other people and not stand around and simply "be seen."  (Again, this is not Club Cafe!)

While the organizers and event hosts do their best to facilitate introductions and to engage others, you're expected to go over and say "hi" to people--and vice versa.  After all, that's why people are there. If you do, we promise that you won't suddenly burst into flames . . . and that you WILL meet some friendly and approachable folks! ;o) It only takes a minimal amount of effort on your part to meet some great people and do some really Meaningful Networking.™

The group continues to grow through Meetup and by word-of-mouth, which is why we've been so successful and why people have been enjoying our events since 2006. Contrary to popular belief, there really are friendly and welcoming gay venues in Boston where people talk to each other!  Come by and let us show you....

Thanx for taking the time to read about us.  We hope you join and look forward to seeing you soon! :o)

results.description:
BOSTON SNOW DOGS

Boston Snow Dogs is a group of dog lovers focused on the care and nurturing of northern breed dogs in urban environments.  Members share information and ideas, support Siberian owners and partner with local rescues.  The group holds regular meet-ups throughout New England to hike, mush or just gather with good friends.

BSD members are friendly, fun, practical & informal.  We hold meet-ups often – weather depending - and we vary locations where members suggest we explore.  So whomever can come, whichever day of the week, whichever meet-up works for you!   You and your pup(s) will get quality playtime with fellow dogs and their owners.  Please visit our YouTube channel to experience the fun of our meet-ups: http://www.youtube.com/BOSTONSNOWDOGS/.

We have been enjoying urban mushing, hiking, camping and more with our beautiful dogs for more than 7 years.  We hope you’ll join us to share our love for dogs and serve as responsible dog-owner role models in our communities.

Some FAQs about BSD:

1) Does my dog have to be a Siberian Husky? No – we welcome all breeds, although most of our members own northern breeds and our activities focus on this type of dog.

2) Do I have to own a dog to join BSD? Yes – we require all members to have a dog as this allows everyone to participate.

3) Do I have to live in New England to join? Yes – we require all members to live in the general New England area, again to allow everyone to participate in the group.  We are all about the participation of our members!

4) Can children join? You must be 18 or older to join, but members are welcome to bring children to meet-ups.  We are a very family-oriented group!

5) Is there a membership fee? Yes, our dues are $24 per year.  Dues are used for our yearly website fees, liability insurance, state club filing fees, donations to help other husky organizations (like MUSH, Patriot's and the MSPCA) and to buy merchandise to sell at events at discounted rates (BSD shirts, stickers, etc.). Truly a great value considering the joy, camaraderie, events, learning and community service we all enjoy and share together with our pups!

6) Do I have to know how to mush to join BSD? No – we have many experienced mushers in our group and many beginners as well.  We also have members who choose to hike or walk with their dogs rather than mush.  We have extra harnesses and gear to share with new members at meet-ups and would love to help you learn!

7) Do you rescue dogs? No – we are a recreational group.  But we work with many local rescues and support them with events, donations and sharing of information on available dogs.

8) Does my dog have to be friendly? Yes – you are responsible for your own dog and your pup must be socialized enough to engage in activities with other dogs and people.  BSD does not accept any liability for accidents/injuries in connection with our activities.  If you become injured during an activity you assume all responsibility and liability.  If your dog injures a person or another dog during an activity you assume all responsibility and liability.

9) What does BSD’s liability insurance cover? Our liability insurance covers the GENERAL PUBLIC in the event that someone is injured at one of our meet-ups.   It does not cover member injuries or dog injuries of any kind.  You must be a BSD member in good standing with all membership dues current in order to be covered under our liability insurance.

Please click the “Join Us” button at the top right-hand side of this page if you would like to apply for membership!
results.name: BOSTON SNOW DOGS

results.description:
Socializing for Justice (SoJust) is a cross-cultural, cross-issue progressive community and network in Boston based on the Philosophy of Abundance and Philosophy of Radical Inclusion.

We're putting the SOCIAL back in SOCIAL JUSTICE. We host socials and professional development trainings to meet like-minded progressives and make connections. No Program. No Speaker. Just Us. Newcomers always welcomed! 

Scroll down to see our upcoming events.

Philosophy of Radical Inclusion means we focus on creating welcoming spaces that foster relationship-building across issue silos. The Philosophy of Abundance is at the root of SoJust's vision and we share several resources on our website including:

    list of 50+ places to post events on the web

    a calendar of cross-promoted social justice events

    SoJust's vendor referral list (for promotional materials)

    a "Craigslist-style" message board

SoJust is not a non-profit 501(c)(3), we are a volunteer-run, member-driven, grassroots organization.

Join us if you want to cross-promote your events and campaigns, are new to the area and looking for groups to get involved in, or you've been looking for like-minded progressives to hang with in Boston. Join us if you are ready to go beyond allies and build a cross-issue progressive movement.

YES, WE MEAN YOU. We've got members of all ages, races, genders, sexual orientations, levels of activism, and professions - born in Boston to just moved here. We hope you see someone like yourself and meet someone you otherwise wouldn't have.

*********************************************************************************
Want to know about PROGRESSIVE EVENTS in Boston? We cross-promote events we hear about on the SoJust Calendar - see what's going on this week.

HOW TO POST YOUR EVENTS (Job & Volunteer Opportunities, Housing, Actions, etc.): http://bit.ly/post2SoJust 

**You must be a member to RSVP or post an event , job, etc. on the message board. Not a member?  It's free to join - on your profile share as much or as little as you'd like about your social justice connections.

*********************************************************************************

On Twitter? Follow @SoJust and @RobbieSamuels #SoJust

Check out our: about page , FAQs and photos from past events.

Order your SoJust T-Shirt: www.bit.ly/sojust14shirts

Real Estate Investors are what is holding the fragile RE market together.  With almost 30% of the deals being transacted with cash we can see that Investors are at work, literally.  We will be seeing more and more discontinuity in the coming years, with good hard working people with solid credit being denied due to the overly tight underwriting.  Enter investors with creative financing techniques and seller financing alternatives.

Every Investor survives by the strength of his or her Power Team. As well, if you are not an investor, then you are probably part of somebody's Power Team. The beauty of this is that when we all partner together each party gets their share of the deal!

SNCR is dedicated to creating a bridge between the academic and theoretical pursuit of these topics and the pragmatic implementation of new media and communications tools and methodologies. results.description:
This Group is about Exploring Life in the Hemingway Tradition

with an emphasis on

Culture, Continuing Education and The Occasional Adventure.

:: :: ::

Life is not a spectator sport ... (and physical reality is infinitely more interesting than virtual reality).

"There is no life on the internet ... no sense of space in cyberspace."

:: :: ::

This group was created to encourage exploration of and participation in cultural and educational opportunities in the Greater Cambridge area and occasionally further afield. All events are open to attendance by anyone. Viewers of this site, whether they choose to join the CMF or not, may attend any of the events.  Members may RSVP or not, and still attend events. There are no requirements either for membership or attendance. Members do, however, receive event reminders - and members are encouraged to actually meet up!

CMF Meet-Ups are member-driven; that is, if you want to meet other members, it is up to you, as a member, to post your plans on the event message board. I am not able to attend every event, so if no one posts plans, then no one meets up. This aspect of the CMF can be somewhat empowering since anyone can become the ad-hoc organizer for any event. Just do it (as used to be said). 

Please note that "Featured Events" are not in chronological order ... (other events listed further down may be happening at an earlier date).  

:: :: ::

The Cambridge Moveable Feast is geared more toward Traditional Cultural and Educational opportunities rather than Pop, Abstract, Postmodernist or Techno-Culture.

:: :: ::

Note: If you have a question that doesn't affect the rest of the group, Please email me directly using the link to the left. Everyone else gets enough email as it is. Thanks. 

Further Note: Occasionally, events are cancelled by the event sponsor. Should an event be cancelled, it will be removed from the calendar. However, the CMF is not always notified of cancellations. Please confirm, prior to attending, the time and location of the event from the event sponsor. 

Also: Some events require pre-registration through the event sponsor. A "Yes" RSVP here is NOT pre-registration. Attendees must still pre-register individually through the event sponsor. Usually there will be a link to the event sponsor's website for pre-registration.

One more thing: CMF protocol suggests that members only wear official CMF sleeveless tee-shirts when it is appropriate to the venue and the event. The preferred method of fabrication is to cut the sleeves off of a regular tee-shirt and hand-print the CMF acronym , somewhat legibly, on either the front or back of the shirt (or both, as you wish) with an indelible marking pen. Members who submit selfies with CMF sleeveless tee-shirts will receive two complimentary CMF pin-on buttons ... (and will also qualify to learn the secret CMF handshake).

The Cambridge Moveable Feast has no political, commercial, academic or spiritual affiliations of any kind.

:: :: ::

If you care about the future of this planet, click here: http://www.meetup.com/Sequitoria/

:: :: ::

"Men (sic) have sought to make a world from their own conception and to draw from their own minds all the material which they employed, but if, instead of doing so, they had consulted experience and observation, they would have the facts and not opinions to reason about, and might have ultimately arrived at the knowledge of the laws which govern the material world." - Francis Bacon

:: :: ::

"The society which scorns excellence in plumbing as a humble activity and tolerates shoddiness in philosophy because it is an exalted activity will have neither good plumbing nor good philosophy ... neither its pipes nor its theories will hold water." - John W. Gardner

:: :: ::

“A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects.” - Robert Heinlein

:: :: ::

"I believe that the horrifying deterioration in the ethical conduct of people today stems from the mechanization and dehumanization of our lives, the disastrous byproduct of the scientific and technical mentality." - Albert Einstein ... (and that was almost a hundred years ago! - §)

:: :: ::

EH is simply a point of reference for this group, as well as the source of our name: "If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man, then wherever you go for the rest of your life, it stays with you, for Paris is a Moveable Feast" (EH) ... ... ... as is Cambridge - §.        For more on Hem, click HERE.

"It was wonderful to walk down the long flights of stairs knowing that I'd had good luck working. I always worked until I had something done and I always stopped when I knew what was going to happen next. That way I could be sure of going on the next day. But sometimes when I was started on a new story and I could not get going, I would sit in front of the fire and squeeze the peel of the little oranges into the edge of the flame and watch the sputter of blue that they made. I would stand and look out over the roofs of Paris and think, 'Do not worry. You have always written before and you will write now. All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence you know.' So finally I would write one true sentence, and then go on from there. It was easy then because there was always one true sentence that I knew or had seen or had heard someone say. If I started to write elaborately, or like someone introducing or presenting something, I found that I could cut the scrollwork or ornament out and throw it away and start with the first true simple declarative sentence I had written." - Ernest Hemingway: A Moveable Feast

The Cambridge Moveable Feast is a Sequitorian Enterprise ... § ... from the root to the fruit (SDO).

"Culture is a product of Nature" - Harvard Professor Emeritus Edward O. Wilson

We are all indigenous peoples. - § 

::  ::  ::

Afterthought: Life is interesting enough, Ernie, without having to make things up. - § 

I:: :: :: ::

And finally ... If you find that the internet, news and entertainment media, professional sports and other spectacles, in conjunction with everything else available via the global communications infrastructure, are more compelling than those things in your immediate surroundings which you can access directly through your five senses ... that’s a problem. - § 

:: :: ::

The Cambridge Moveable Feast accepts contributions in support of its mission HERE.
results.name: The Cambridge Moveable Feast

results.description:
Welcome to Twisted Touring, a subsidiary of the Greater Boston Scooter Clubs

"The Premiere Scooter Club of New England"



Twisted Touring is dedicated to the thrill of the ride with the destination while seldom boring, is still just an excuse. There will be many rides in 2013 ranging from 30 to well over 300 miles, from an afternoon ride to overnight trips to the fringes of New England and beyond crossing every border to the Bay State.

Twisted Touring is intended for scooters and riders who can take on the highway as well as the back road twisties, in rain or shine. We take our safety seriously, even when it might not be convenient.

Bottom line:

If you can't or don't want to ride on the highway..

This isn't the club for you.

By joining you are saying that you want to tour and support the club, supporting the club means an annual $20 membership fee payable by April fools day along with a membership form. The form is available in the files section.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Paul Shoemaker - Organizer

results.description:
This meetup is for people interested in sacred Tantra. Intention of this group is to support and promote the exploration of the sacred and spiritual expansion that practicing and teaching sacred Tantra, the Tantric Healing Arts, and Tantra Yoga can produce. All interested parties are welcome, whether you are a teacher, practitioner, beginner, single, or partnered.

Mission Statement of Tantra International:
* Our sole purpose is to support and promote sacred Tantra, Tantric paths and values, and the Tantric Healing Arts, to meet and share experiences for the benefit of everyone's growth and awareness, and to expand consciousness and unconditional love for all group members.
* Membership is open to all and does not discriminate regardless of legal age, race, gender, belief systems, or body types.
* We do not support strict dogma or belief systems, and no belief systems will be forced upon anyone by other members. We only ask that all members be kind to one another.

results.description:
Le Ciné Club est l' endroit idéal pour rencontrer des francophones sympa du coin qui aiment le cinéma et les bonnes conversations en langue française.

Les amis du ciné club se réunissent une fois par mois, généralement le premier lundi du mois,  dans une salle privée du Coolidge Corner Theatre pour voir une bonne toile. Avant le film, on décompresse avec un petit verre. N' hésitez donc pas à amener une bonne bouteille et des gobelets pour déguster sur place! C'est maintenant la tradition.

Après le film, on se retrouve entre amis dans un restau du coin pour manger un morceau et discuter entre francophones. Pour réserver votre place, vous devrez acheter votre billet sur le site Meetup (Amazon Payments).

results.description:
Climbing can be a mentally and physically challenging, exhilarating personal adventure, but it can also be about experiencing the awesomeness of community. Come meet other local climbers for outdoor and indoor climbing, and be a part of it!

Our purpose is provide additional social networking opportunities for Boston-area climbers of all levels, beginner to advanced, to meet, find more climbing partners, and share climbing-related information.  We don't teach novices, or generally offer instructional programs, but we can give advice how and where to get the training and equipment you need.  Once proficient at basic skills, we can all learn further from each other, sharing tips and ideas on advanced skills, techniques, and styles.  The Boston climbing community, including this Meetup group, has cool people from many different backgrounds, and from around the globe, so you can also learn a lot about the world while sharing your passion for the vertical domain!

Seasoned climbers know it well, but to those who are new: Keep it fun by climbing smart and safe. Climbing is inherently dangerous, and any bad fall (rock, ice, or human) can result in serious injury or death. Proper training and good common sense are important to minimize risks. Your participation in any climbing activity (and any activity with this Meetup group) is AT YOUR OWN RISK. Ward Smith summed it up nicely: "If you do get hurt, don't even think about blaming someone else. You made the decision to walk up to the cliff and get on a particular route . . . instead of staying home, watching football, and eating cheese doodles like the rest of the 'free' world. Have fun, but climb safely, and take responsibility for your own actions."
results.name: Rock and Ice Climbing Boston

results.description:
Welcome to the Working Mom’s Playgroup!

This playgroup was established on January 17, 2007 in the town of Walpole. The purpose was simple: to provide playgroups and activities scheduled during evening and weekend hours as well as an easy way for working moms to get together and offer one another support and friendship. We have  grown tremendously over the years! 

As of September 18, 2014, The Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. is a nonprofit business registered in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Along with organizing activities for the members in the geographical areas listed below, we have the ability to develop chapters in other communities. The nonprofit business currently has one chapter, in the Franklin, MA area, and hopes to provide support to many more mothers with the creation of additional chapters.

Geographic Region

The Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. (WMPlaygroup), is geared towards mothers residing in the towns of Norwood, Walpole, Sharon and the surrounding communities of Dedham, Westwood, Canton and Stoughton. We believe it is important for all mothers to foster relationships with fellow moms residing within their close community.  Mothers who live outside this catchment area will be encouraged to work with the Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. to develop a chapter in her local area. 

Membership Fees are $25.00, to be paid within 1 month of joining and renew annually.


Types of activates 

The Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. organizes a variety of activities for our members. The types of activates that can be found on our calendar are divided into the following 6 categories. 

Connections: The goal of this category is to provide opportunities for moms, children and families to meet and develop relationships. These activities are the ‘core’ of the WMPlaygroup.

·  Examples: Age-Based Playgroups, New Member Only events, Coffee Chat, Family events, Friday play dates, and additional age-based play dates, Mom’s Night In (MNI), Mom’s Night Out (MNO), Cooking Together.

Enrichment: The goal of this category is to provide opportunities which enrich the lives of mothers, families and children within our group as well as in the larger community.

·  Examples: Book Chat, Arts and Crafts, Moose Hill Discovery Program, Parenting Workshops, Discussion Groups, etc.

Health and Fitness: The goal of this category is to provide opportunities for members to engage in group activities based upon living a healthy lifestyle.

·  Examples: Biggest Loser Challenge, Weight Loss Support, Couch 2 5K running group, Hikes, charity and team walks/runs, group fitness classes, etc.

Community Outreach: The goal of this category is to provide opportunities for moms to support charitable, humanitarian and social welfare projects related to mothers, families and children and to teach children to think about the needs of others.

·  Examples: Gifts for Kids, No Kid Hungry Bake Sales, Collection Drives (coats, Halloween Costumes, Non-Perishable Foods, etc.)

Events: The goal of this category is to organize special and annual events.

·  Examples: Family Halloween Costume Party, Vendor Event, Mom’s Only Winter Party, Summer Family Picnic, Mani/Pedi Night, Mom’s Weekend Away, etc.

Development: The goal of this category is to focus on marketing, advertising and fundraising in support of our mission.


Communications

The Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. utilizes Meetup.com, private Facebook groups and personal email to communicate with Members as well as for Members to communicate with each other.

Get Involved

Because this is a "meetup" group, attendance is expected.  By joining our group you are making a commitment to yourself, your children, and our members to attend events.

There are many ways to get involved: whether it’s attending events that have been posted to the calendar, participating in social media discussions or joining the leadership team. You will find many opportunities for the WMPlaygroup to enrich your life.
results.name: The Working Mom's Playgroup (Norwood/Walpole metro area)

results.description:
We are a social club of people who just happen to be tall.
We meet up and do all sorts of fun stuff together, aside from compare notes on "where to buy tall clothing/shoes".... :)

In addition to hosting our local members at events, we also play host to other Tall Club members visiting the New England area.  

We host and participate in a wide range of activities, including:
Cocktail hour at the Newton Marriott the First Friday of each month at 6pm, 
Monthly "meet and greet" events at other local pubs, 
Dancing & more dancing (we hold several dances every year), 
Wine-tasting (we have a group of "wino's" that attend the Boston Wine Expo every year!), Walking outings,
Art exhibitions at the Museum of Fine Arts, and
House parties and weekends away throughout  New England - note that house parties and weekends are open to BBTC members and their guests; they are not public events.

Please see our official Club Web-site at http://www.hubtall.org/ for more information.
results.name: The Boston Beanstalks Tall Club

results.description:
We were formerly known as The JP Women's Group. Founded 1/26/07 by Chris (formerly Hansen) Juliani, Director, the group has been so successful that now Robin and Mairic are assisting her in managing the group.

Our purpose is to build community for women in the Boston Area. Our hope is to create more community for gay/queer women in the Boston Area, especially for women who have recently moved here, or who have recently come out. Also, to help change the story that it is so hard to meet people in Boston. We are an inclusive group for women of all ages and backgrounds who identify as gay or queer in any way, including transgender individuals who identify as women. Please respect our desire to maintain a "women's space" if you do not claim a woman's identity. 

One of the organizers tries to be at as many of the events as possible to help welcome everyone. Many women come to these events on their own, but we're available to meet up with anyone interested before an event so you don't have to go on your own. Feel free to contact one of us by email, or call Robin at 617-331-4116.

The more events we have the better, so please send any ideas you have for exciting events by email to the organizers. Please understand that we'll typically need at least a week's notice to post an event. If you have a last minute idea, you can always post it to the Message Board.

You can also send a message to the group if your are looking for resources or referrals. We are great resources to one another.
results.name: The Boston Gay Women's Meetup Group
