results.description: The Mosaic Outdoor Mountain Club of Massachusetts is a unique non-profit organization dedicated to bringing Jewish people together to enjoy and foster a greater appreciation of the outdoors. We are a volunteer-led, member-driven organization who invite you to partake in a variety of activities with other Jewish outdoor enthusiasts. We welcome singles, couples, and families with children, regardless of age, background, physical ability or religious denomination, but you must be 21 or older to join our Meetup group. For more information about our club, please visit our website, www.mosaicofmass.org.
results.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

results.description:
This group is for people of all ages (21+) who want to meet others to speak Italian together, share our knowledge and passion for this beautiful language, and the Italian culture.

Our group activities include:  Italian conversation events, enjoying delicious meals together at various Italian restaurants in the Metro-west areas of Boston, and the North End, seeing Italian films, pot luck dinners at members homes, Italian book discussion groups, Italian car shows, Italian music concerts, Italian festivals, as well as other Italian related events.

The group meets monthly to practice speaking Italian

Although Meetup lists the group in Wayland, our members are from many different Metro-west towns surrounding Boston, as well as Boston proper.

Member dues are $4 per year, which goes towards the $160 yearly fee that Meetup charges to organize a group on their site; as well as to pay for any facility rental fees, and other supplies if needed.  Any overage in the Member Dues Account, will be used solely for the purpose of this meetup group. The $4 fee can be paid through the Meetup website.

* In order to be approved for membership, you need to have: 

1)  A photo of yourself posted as your main photo on your profile page 

2)   Your first name on your profile page.

This is very important, as it enables me, and the assistant organizers, to be able to recognize you at events, just as you can recognize us.  Having your photo, and name, posted also helps the other members to become familiar with you, and to feel more comfortable when meeting you.

* Over the past 8 years, we have formed a wonderful group of Italophiles, and everyone is very welcoming and supportive.   In many ways it feels like we have formed our own "Famiglia Italiana".   I am looking forward to many more years of enjoying Italian conversation and Italian culture with our current, and future, members

.
results.name: MetroWest Italian Language and Social Group

results.description: Meet other CMS professionals, aficianados, and neophytes who want to learn about current and best practices, state of the art, and current quality practices for these CMS and related system used in business, government, and academia for collaboration, website development, eCommerce, and simpler things like family websites, web galleries, and other social networking applications. Come to see demos, profiles, and assessments of the latest systems. Hear independent evaluations of the most popular open source and commercial offerings. Learn skills for using them, their bugs, strengths and weaknesses, support available, and tons of other useful information. Learn how to select and apply CMS products to your favorite applications. We began in 2007 and have covered Joomla, Drupal, Plone, WordPress and their applications. So many other systems that we simply have not had time or resources to cover them all. If you are a user or developer and want to learn or present on your experiences, please attend our meetings. Most of all, come to have fun, network, make new friends, and learn from great people with a passion for software!!
results.name: The Web Content Management Systems Meetup Group

results.description: We marvel at music's magic when we hear it and even more when we can play it.  We aspire to play the guitar like the people whose music has filled our lives with joy and sadness and tears and laughter.  We dream of expressing ourselves similarly with the guitar tantalized and enchanted by sounds that spring out of our own imagination and experiences.  This group is meant to help guitarists get more out of their guitars and the music they like whatever their reasons for playing may be and whatever goals they may have as guitarists.  To be a member, you must be willing to hear other members play and share your knowledge and musical gifts and to help yourself and us be the guitarist we all dream of becoming.  Meetings are once every three weeks on Saturday afternoons from 2pm to 4pm whenever two or more members are available to meet.  In order to have the meetups manageable and helpful, the number of attendants will be limited to the first six respondents and a waiting list will be created and invitations extended on a first come first served basis if openings are available.
results.name: UNKNOWN AT THIS TIME

results.description:
Come Join Us for Fun & Friendship!


The Greater Boston Jewish Singles Meetup is a social group of outgoing, friendly, singles, (55+) who meet for coffee, conversation and friendship….oh yes, and laughter!

We promise that you’ll find a very warm welcome when you join us at one of our weekly get-togethers, held most Sunday mornings at 11:00 a.m., at Panera Bread in Dedham, (located on Route 1 in the Dedham Plaza). Just make sure to check the calendar first , as the location may change

This is an ongoing thing unless otherwise noted, so be sure to check the calendar weekly and PLEASE, rsvp so we'll be sure to have a seat for you!   We're usually in the back of the restaurant in the large banquette.

We ask that you NOT bring in drinks and food from other places and/or home.  Panera is very generous with the space and time they give to us and we want to support and give back to them.  Thank you.

The original Meet Up group started with about 10 - 12 people who met at Panera in Stoughton  and were from Dedham, Framingham, Canton, Stoughton, Sharon and Brockton. Since that time our membership has spread to Brookline, Newton, Needham, West Roxbury, but based on popular demand, we want to make it convenient for people who live in the city, Metrowest, and north to join us as well.

Some of us are divorced, others widowed and some single...and we all have the same desire to expand our social life...meet new people, make new friends, and be busy with all that life has to offer us here in Greater Boston. That's why we've grown so much in just 4 years and made incredible friendships!

Whether religious, observant, or not observant at all, we also share a common heritage that brings us close. Being 55+ means we have lots of shared experiences and special memories too.

Keep in mind that we are not a ‘dating site’, but if you do meet someone special (and several of our members have) we’ll celebrate right along with you!

We are a dues paying group - $12.00 annually every January, or prorated @ $1.00/month if you join during the year. Once your membership is approved by having answered the five questions, we ask that you come to Panera within the next 30 days to meet us and determine if you wish to become a dues paying member. If we do no see or hear from you in 30 days we'll assume you've decided otherwise.

 

We hope to see you very soon!
results.name: Jewish Singles 55+  of Greater Boston

results.description:
Fun, active, diverse events which include lunch, dinners, day trips, indoor & outdoor activities, cultural events and mixers. We've been very active this year and the fun events continue. The best part is many of our members have posted ideas for events themselves. And a number of these ideas have become official events. We hope you will join our group.

This Meetup group is created for local Asian and Asian Americans (professionals & college students) to interact and network in a fun, relaxing environment. We gather to share a unique perspective that belongs to people of Asian descent and to celebrate our diversity as well. Our members come from near and far (Boston to California to Asia).

Check out our calendar and photos to get an idea of what we are about. It's a great way to meet new people and have fun.

If you join our group - please:

1) include a current photo of yourself to help identify you at events.

2) include your actual first name in your profile (last name is not required)

3) fill out profile info (do not leave it blank)

4) please be considerate of the organizer(s) and other members by keeping your RSVPs up to date and attending events when you have RSVP'd. A little courtesy and consideration go a long way, so please update your RSVP if your plans change. (see no-show rules below)

5) Inappropriate and/or rude behavior will not be tolerated. Members will be subject to removal for these actions. And do not spam other members.

No show policy: No Shows are cause for removal.

    1 no-show = warning.

    2 no-shows = RSVP privileges suspended for 3 months

    3 no-shows = subject to removal.

Unfortunately we have had to remove some members because they have ignored these rules. Please be respectful to the organizers and other members.

We hope to see you soon.

Steve
Organizer
results.name: The Boston Asian Professionals Meetup Group

results.description:
Meet other local tennis players. Gather to play on scheduled weekend meetups or find a tennis partner.

Our regularly scheduled Meetups are on Saturday and Sunday mornings at courts in Somerville during the spring, summer, and fall. You are welcome to find partners in your area and playing level through our mailing list.

We encourage members to host their own Meetups at their preferred location and time as well.
results.name: The Somerville Tennis Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to the Boston Social Anxiety Meetup...

Social Anxiety (SA) has adversely affected our lives in one way or another and this group brings people with SA together. By joining our group we presume you are struggling with SA in some way, we are a peer only group and do not have any therapists, clinicians as members, .  SA affects people regardless of race, religion, gender, age, or sexual orientation. We are an inclusive group and welcome all who have SA. Most importantly, this group is about community. We all have something in common. We always strive to provide a welcoming envirnment. There are two types of activities that we organize: Discussion meetups and Social Activity events. At the discussion meetups , we gather and discuss SA-relevant topics, strategies, and experiences. For the activity events, we venture out into that imposing social world in the form of various fun activities, with the support of our environment at our meetings/events to help people feel more at ease. Participation at an event or meeting is always voluntary. Past events have included ethnic dining, walks, movies, game nights, brunches, museum visits, and hiking. Please note that any member with frequent no-shows or a last-minute cancellations is subject to being changed from the yes list to the waitlist at any event that has a waiting list. Boston Area Social Anxiety Organizers are not responsible for the well being of any person /member while attending an event. Every member must use their own best judgement and common sense and are wholly responsible for themselves. By joining the Boston Area Social Anxiety group each member agrees to these rules. Once you join please check out our activity calendar and message board too. Feel free to participate in anything we do! We try to have fun/interesting activities to do despite our SA. We hope to see you soon!
results.name: Boston Area Social Anxiety Meetup

results.description:
Our purpose is to build community for gay women riders in the Boston Area. This meetup is for women who may or may not belong to area clubs but are also looking to branch out and meet other riders along their way or perhaps try something other than the usual "club"...this will serve as an online space for organizing rides and meeting like-minded folks to hang with.

We are an inclusive group for all women who identify as queer or gay in any way.  Your participation is important to make this a good an active group.

Meet other local women riders! Gather to plan rides -- long and short. Discuss riding tips and more!
results.name: The Boston Area Gay Women Motorcyclists Meetup Group

results.description:
Boston has a great local music scene and this is a great way to enjoy it!

Are you a musician? In a band? Let us know when you're playing. Suggest a Meetup and I'll share it with the group. If you're going to see a show and want some friends, suggest a meetup for that too.

Check out other local music meetups!
Boston EDM + Greater Boston Live Music

Sponsors, don't be shy! We have a great group of music lovers eager to return your support. Contact the organizer for more information about sponsorship.
results.name: Boston Live Music

topics.name: Sport Bikes, Street Bikes, Motorcycle Meetups

results.description:
Welcome to the Boston Area Motorcycle Riders (or BAMR for short). If you're looking for a fun group of all ages, genders and cultures... , By membership vote we do not allow trikes or CAN AMs'.

BAMR has lots of planned rides on the calendar and plenty of pickup rides, in addition off season events... a group open to both recent and seasoned riders... then perhaps BAMR is the riding group for you.

BAMR gets around Take a look at our calendar and you'll see we average over 60 rides a year! From your backyard to Caribou ME, Quebec and Tail of Dragon

BAMR emphasizes safety. We schedule rides for all experience levels and we are the only group (that we know of) conducting monthly rides specifically for those who have never ridden in a group. We want our members to feel relaxed and safe and discourage any stunts or "trick" riding. As much as we love to avoid highways, some rides require us to use them. If your bike is not "highway compatible" you may want to skip any ride that's noted as such.

BAMR is not a club (no meetings, no elections) The dues help to cover fees that meetup.com charges. The group is run by volunteers and you are welcome to help out or simply come along for the rides.

THIS IS NOT A DATING SITE, it is purely for owners of bikes who like to ride

DISCLAIMER: By joining this group I acknowledge that motorcycle related activities are dangerous and that accidents causing death, bodily injury, disability and property damage, can, and do happen. I acknowledge that I have motorcycle insurance coverage as required by Massachusetts state laws. I acknowledge that I am responsible for my own actions and behaviors while riding a motorcycle within the group.

results.description:
Welcome!

Boston Python is one of the largest local Python user groups in the world.  Meet other local Python developers, learners, employers, and enthusiasts of all kinds.  All skill levels are welcome: if you are interested in Python, we are interested in you!

We have a number of great regular events:

    Monthly presentation series: these are longish presentations (about an hour) about topics of interest to the community.  Often we also have lightning talks (5-15 minutes) also.  If you have something you'd like to share with everyone, drop a line to the organizers!

    Monthly informal project nights: these are a chance to sit down with other Python developers of all experience levels to push your project forward, get help with a particular trouble spot, share expertise, or do whatever else you like.

    Occasional weekend workshops for beginners.  The first have been for women and their friends, but future events may broaden the audience.

In addition to meeting face-to-face, we're online:

• Twitter as @bostonpython

• #bostonpython IRC channel on freenode. Drop in any time to get questions answered!

• Boston@python.org mailing list: http://bit.ly/bospymail

Job postings are OK, as long as they meet the Job Posting Requirements.  A separate mailing list for discussion is at http://bit.ly/bospymail

If you'd like to help financially, you can make a tax-deductible contribution at donate.bostonpython.com.
results.name: The Boston Python User Group

results.description:
There are clearly many bicycling/fitness groups out there!.....So, what makes this group different?

Here's one members testimonial from our 2009 Nantucket Trip:

“ One of the best weekends of this summer. Words can't summarize my experience. Absolutely wonderful people with a great sense of humor. Time just flew by. Thanks, Rob for organizing this event and WE ( I take the liberty of every one that attended here) truly appreciate your time & thoughtfulness. Simply put it we had a BLAST; Thank you again and look forward few more meet ups before the season ends. ”

Karan: 2009 Nantucket Trip Participant

Organizer Rob Fox writes: "I've participated in so many other biking/fitness groups over the years where it seems like the main goal is to just get to the finish first. In our group, we are not only out to get a good fitness ride in (average pace 12-15 mph) but I like for people to leave our rides feeling like they just made a bunch of great new friends! Join us! We're a fun group and we love cycling!!"

If you join us, please bring your sense of humor and desire for adventure because, yes it's true, we even get lost sometimes :-) as we explore new routes together? It keeps things exciting!

We usually wrap up the ride with a bite to eat or an ice cream somewhere in the vicinity of the ride's end point.

Feel free at anytime to write me with any questions that you have!

Rob Fox, Organizer

results.description:
We are a group of friends with similar interests - the primary one being hiking. It doesn't matter if it's a one-day trip or a multi-day backpack; we like climbing up and down the tallest mountains throughout the Northeast (and beyond). Having other people come along with us makes things even more fun. Other activities on our calendar include biking (rail trail, road, & off-road), kayaking (rivers, lakes, & ocean), skiing (downhill & cross country), and various adventure races.

Our approach is simple - the strength of a cohesive group is greater than the sum of its individual parts. We start as a group, stay as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. We travel in small groups (10-15 people) to lessen our impact on the environment and the others who are also out there enjoying the peace and solitude of the outdoors.

Here some glimpses of what we do...

  • Random Pictures of Random Events
  • Random Videos of Random Events

Most of our hikes involve climbing to the highest summits in the Northeast. That means people have to get up early, drive a long distance, and then spend most of the day hiking. There aren’t many late starts, short day, or easy/moderate level hikes on our calendar. Instead of trying to do something that another group has already perfected, we have partnered with the Blue Hills Hiking Club out of Boston, MA to offer hikes to the members of the other group.

Don’t let their name fool you – while they spend a lot of time hiking in the Blue Hills they will also be planning trips to explore some of the other great places close to Boston. Don’t let the Blue Hills themselves fool you either – you can put together a route that includes similar distance (~10-14 miles) and elevation gain (~2,600 feet) to what you might find three hours away in the White Mountains.

If this sounds like fun then be sure to join our group and sign-up for an event.
results.name: Random Group of Hikers

Whether you are a practitioner looking for resources or connections within the community, an individual seeking healing for yourself or a loved one, a student looking for a teacher, a teacher looking for a student, or just plain curious - you are welcome here.

This group was formerly the Boston Energy Healers Group, but in late 2012 it expanded its definition to include a more diverse range of practices with the understanding that all healing work is based upon energy/spirit at its source.

  • ALL of the members of this group who are practitioners of a healing art are welcome to post events here and are encouraged to do so. Simply use the "suggest meetup" feature and once I review it to ascertain it is in line with the groups mission I will post it.
  • All members of this group who are practitioners of a healing are encouraged to seek out opportunities to network with other members and build stronger relationships for mutual support.
  • ALL of the members of this group who are learners are welcome to send out inquiries about where they can find a practitioner for healing or training.

results.description:
"Outside of a dog, a book is woman's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." — Groucho Marx

I'm sure I'm not the only one out there who gave many a classic book a pass while growing up. Yet our teachers were right: there is a literary currency that these works provide. Did they mention untold pleasure? I can't recall. However, my favorite reason for reading and re-reading classics is this: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say."(Thank you, Italo Calvino.)

This book club is your chance to sit down and finally read Anna Karenina, Don Quixote, Pride and Prejudice, and also those somewhat forgotten classics and even recent works of similar resonance. The books can span any time period or place, and our reading list is forever growing and expanding based on your suggestions.

For a list of books we have read, and books we wish to read, see here: http://www.meetup.com/classicbooks/about
results.name: Classic Books: A Book Club for Voracious Readers

results.description:
We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing board games -- specifically, the kind of board games that make you think.  We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.

This season, in addition to playing games, we will be raffling off a bunch of popular games!  There will be a raffle at each meetup.  Simply by showing up, you'll get a chance to win free games.  The more often you come, the more entries you'll receive.

We have a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm until the last people leave (usually quite a few hours).

Our group has been running since 2007, and at this point we have a pretty large crowd of regulars.  A lot of people come once every few weeks, and RSVPs are appreciated but not required, so the RSVP list is often smaller than our actual attendance.  We expect about 30-45 people at most of our meetups.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle

As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

People new to Euros are very welcome.  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); the heaviest strategy games (like 18xx or wargames); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan and Carcassonne.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.

Love to discover new music from everywhere? Want to connect with great musicians from around the globe and other (world) music lovers from around Boston? My goal is for this group to be the place where you can meet-up with other like-minded and go to the diverse and eclectic international live music scene happening in all of New England! This group is not more mine than yours. Anyone can organize a meet-up just email me and I'll have you as an assistant organizer or change a posted event to be a meet-up. I try to keep the calendar up to date but please keep me informed if you know about an event that I missed. I am a musician and I have a passion for traditional and contemporary North-African music. I also love all traditional dances and acoustic Indian and African music as well as salsa, samba, jazz...Anything that moves me! What is the music that moves and touches you?

Joining the group, policies, etc..

After a new member come to a meet-up, if he or she decide to stick with the group they will have to participate a mandatory $5 once a year contribution.

This is to help me pay for the site maintenance fees. You can always look at the group finances by going and clicking on the "tools" tag and then to the "money".

If you RSVP to an event but don't show up - without taking the time to let the event organizer know - there is a good chance that you will be expelled from the group. Please understand that, event organizers are not paid (no one is) but take some of their valuable time and sometime put quite a lot of effort to organize a meet-up. You have to let them know if you cannot make it at the last minute, it's only fair and polite.


That's about it! I hope that does not sound too harsh...really we are a bunch of nice and gentle music lovers people!

See you at a show!

Jacques Pardo

We welcome you into our circle: be you dancer, singer, or drummer. Come step into the rhythm together.

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Co-Ed Flag Football, which is a PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK group. We are not responsible for any medical cost due to a player being injured at one of our events.

    All games are played free of charge, however, this Meetup webpage costs $100 for every 6 months it remains active so donations will be collected each quarter.   I will send out a notice during the week prior to the Saturday game asking for a $2 dollar donation to cover the cost of the Meetup.com website fee.   All donations are done on a volunteer basis and are very much appreciated.

    Please remember this is a Free PICK-UP Football group so those who want to play as if you are in the Super Bowl... Continue looking for another group.   The intent of Boston Co-Ed Flag Football is to have fun, get exercise and socialize.   Those who play with disregard for others safety or display disruptive behavior will be removed from the group immediately. 

    We usually don't return interceptions or keep score until the last game of the day. 

    Feel free to contact me Donny or any of the assistant organizers if you have questions, comments, concerns or suggestions.

 

Please refer to our About Us page (http://flagfootball.meetup.com/49/abo...) for a full list of game rules, group policies and rule modifications.  Read some of the Boston Co-Ed Flag Football's reviews here: http://www.meetup.com/flagfootball-49/about...
results.name: Boston Co-Ed Flag Football

results.description:
Welcome  Singles Dance Party!  Woo hoo!  Like to dance?  Sick of being single and not knowing where to meet other singles?  You are in the RIGHT place!!!

 

Approximately every other month you'll have the opportunity to meet other singles in your area!  Online dating is tough -- meeting in person is where it's at.

Feel joyful and have fun!!  Enjoy the pulse pounding, heart throbbing passion and love of dancing -- this positive vibration attracts others to you!
results.name: Singles Dance Party

results.description: The Boston Green Business Networking Group realizes that not only do like minded businesses naturally tend help promote each other but we also have the potential to help the entire industry grow and spread here in the US and abroad. Boston historically has been the hub of innovation, growth and networking. Boston is, and always has been, a leader in the conventions and industry trade show industries that bring like minded people together for the sharing and growth of new ideas, technologies and businesses. Steeped in this tradition we set our goals. Please join us on this journey to the future!
results.name: The Boston Green Business Networking Group

results.description:
You like learning things, going to museums, science lectures, and you can't get your regular crew to go with you.

Perhaps you went to engineering school, but you use hair conditioner anyway.

You're intelligent and you have social skills, even tho you might have a video game or two on your hard drive.

If you're willing to let your geek flag fly, please join us. Event suggestions encouraged.

And, if there's something you want to go to that our organizers can't make, we can post the event anyway to rally the Nerd Herd to keep you company. Just let us know.

Welcome.

Hair conditioner optional.

The Nerd Fun Creed:

  • Nerds RSVP "yes" only when they're sure they can show - 'cuz Nerds are wicked smart and are able to plan ahead reliably - Nerds don't let their fellow nerds down.
  • Nerds also know how to set up email filters so they can handle the quantity of email that meetup produces. ;-)
  • Assistant organizers have the right to disallow you from coming to an event if they can't see a photo of you on your profile page.
  • The Nerd Fun organizers are not responsible for any personal risk anyone might take while attending an event. Use your common sense, be safe.

And while you're here, please donate to our favorite charities, click here to see .
results.name: Nerd Fun - Boston

results.description:
Sistah Circle is a group of Fabulous Black Women that enjoy reading and the company of other Sistahs. We read a variety of books written by authors of color and discuss over food and beverages. Be prepared for sometimes lengthy and engaging discussions!

This circle was created to foster genuine bonds with women who are interested in having intellectual and personal conversations. This is a safe space.

As a member, each Sistah is asked to pay a membership fee of $10 ($11 on Pay Pal) to cover the cost of the meet up.

To that end, we ask that you commit to attending at least 4 book club meetings a year and pay your membership dues within your second meetup.

Please keep these commitments in mind when applying for membership.

We hope you will choose to join in on the discussion!

Tiffany
Group Leader & Organizer
results.name: Sistah Circle - Bookclub & Circle of Friends

results.description:
Does this exchange sound familiar to you?

Friend/colleague: "So what are you up to tonight?"
You: "I'm headed over to [The Middle East/Brighton Music Hall/Great Scott] for a show tonight."
Friend/colleague: "Oh. One of those bands you listen to. Who is it, Nervous Squirrel again?"
You: "That was Frightened Rabbit. And no, I'm going to see [insert name of awesome indie band]."
Friend/colleague: Blank stare.

If so, you're in the right place.

This group is for people who don't have a lot of friends who frequent indie rock – as you'll see from the range of shows we attend, we use that term very loosely – shows, who are looking to meet some avid concert-goers, or just love live music and want to see some Boston venues. Meet up for food or drinks before and after shows.

Venues that will be the most frequented:

Middle East – Cambridge
Brighton Music Hall – Brighton
Great Scott – Allston
Paradise Rock Club (and Lounge) - Boston (near BU)
Royale – Boston
TT the Bears - Cambridge

This group will be an open forum for indie (and the like) shows. Rather than stick to the standard Meetup model of having a few organizers run all the events, we’d like to get everyone involved and have lots of options on the calendar. So if you’re planning on heading to a show, and you’re willing to be responsible for arranging a time and place to meet and making sure people can find you and the group when they arrive, send us a suggestion (use the big “Schedule a New Meetup” link on our page) and we’ll help you do the rest!
results.name: Indie Rock Boston

results.description:
A very warm welcome to our Southerners Meetup Group!  Being Southern is a state of mind, and we find ourselves longing for the charm of the old South, and our way of life back home.  Come join in to meet with other displaced Southerners, who love and miss the South, but are loving the charm of New England, too!  We will enjoy activities together such as brunch, football viewings, poker night, southern food, reminiscing about the South and our good ole Southern traditions.  Feel free to offer suggestions for activities for the group .... a fishing trip, a chili cook off, live music (Bluegrass at the Cantab?) ... whatever your little heart desires. We sincerely hope that you will join in, and that you will make new wonderful acquaintances and have some delightful memories from your participation in this group.

 

One of our members, Jeremy Fox, wrote an article about our group for Boston.com ... check it out!!

http://www.boston.com/yourtown/news/downtown/2012/07/shared_experiences_bring_trans.html
results.name: Ex-Southerners Meetup Group - Boston Region

results.description:
A FREE Meetup... And will always remain Free!

Do you enjoy Skiing, Snowboarding, Hiking, Kayaking and making new friends? The Wedeln Ski and Outdoors club offers an all season ski house for its members. We are a not for profit organization, organized for and run by our members. Our philosophy has always been about having fun and meeting new people!  we started as a ski club but we  now enjoy many outdoor activities.

Current members reside in MA, RI, CT, NH, and even Washington DC. We enjoy events in the Boston / Worcester area or weekends up North in the Mt. Washington area of NH. During the winter, we participate in snowboard races, ski races and social events with other groups in the area. During the summer, we hold organized weekends for paddlers, rock climbers, golfers, bikers, and hikers. Come check out our photos from past events as they tell our story best.

Join our meetup today to learn more about us, checkout our fun events and meet our awesome members. Please note, Wedeln is a physical house up in North Conway NH that sleeps 70+ people. Joining this meetup facilitates coming up as a guest to the house, information on social events, etc. It does not get you a "key" to the house. Should you be interested in more information on how to get a "key" or house membership, contact Tom for more information.

Don't wait for ski season, check out our club this fall.  We have hikes, biking and many other activities.

 

Guests and new memberships at The Wedeln Ski and Outdoors Club are 21+ single/unmarried only.
results.name: Wedeln Ski and Outdoors Club

results.description:
Are you ready for your total empowerment?

My name is Matthew, the organizer of Total Empowerment; are you a seeker of knowledge, unlimited confidence, power, energy, health and financial freedom? - you can have it all!

My personal story first...
I am a successful entrepreneur who has founded, built, and sold several companies starting at the age of 19. Now I own several million dollars of ocean & lake front, commercial, and residential property.
I was financially free at the age of 29 and a self made millionaire by age 30.

I would like to share with you my experinces & extensive studies of wealth psychology, real estate, business start-ups, personal development, NLP, belief & value systems, mind power, mastering influence, spiral dynamics, fitness & nutrition to name but a few.
The culmination of several hundred books, thousands of audios and certified graduate of more than 30 self development courses.

This group will tap into the cutting edge of the newest and most powerful techniques, processes and concepts leading to Total Empowerment.
results.name: The Boston Millionaire Total Empowerment Meetup Group

results.description:
This is an informal forum for architects, designers and other professionals to network and socialize and shape the future of the building industry!

We get together for all kinds of design-related events like tours, films, lectures, etc. Come and talk about mentoring, ethics, work/life balance, green design, the future of architecture as a profession, and more.

Our members include: architects; designers and other design industry professionals; engineers; contractors; planners; interior designers; landscape architects; developers; real estate professionals; building materials suppliers and other vendors; consultants; urban renewal, environmental and other community organizations and more!
results.name: Boston Architecture + Design

results.description: This group is for queer and queer friendly people to get together for fun adventures. What's an adventure? Whatever we want it to be. Bowling, camping, kayaking, paintball, laser tag, hiking, a fun restaurant experience, whatever. Just be queer or queer friendly, be laid back and up for adventures!
results.name: Boston Queer Adventurers

results.description:
We meet once a month, usually the 3rd Sunday of each month, at the Holliston Meadows, 140 Summer Street, Holliston, MA 01746, T: (508) 429 1500.

The Meadows is a beautiful multimillion dollar newly-built dog resort and spa with free parking. The area for the meetup is indoors, clean, elegant, cozy and personal, and has windows. The staff is angelic! And there is plenty of seating. Feel free to bring your own chair.  The meet is a casual play group for our small dogs and a chance to talk to each other about our dogs while they play and have fun.

Check out our photos from past meets. All small dogs (under 20 lbs) that have good doggy manners and are polite with other dogs of any breed or mix are invited. Please be sure your dog(s) are healthy and up-to-date with shots.  Come join our fun and friendly group!
results.name: Small Doggy PlayDates --for small breeds only

results.description:
Cape Ann Photography Excursion (CAPE) Group meets informally at locations on Cape Ann, and across the North Shore, utilizing some of the most beautiful scenery in New England as a backdrop for our photos. From lighthouses and quaint New England towns, to rocky coastline and foliage.

Digital and film photographers of any skill level are welcome to join. We'll have fun, and maybe even learn a new thing or two from each other while sharing favorite photography tips and tricks.
results.name: Cape Ann Photography Excursion (CAPE) Group

results.description: Meet people all levels raw-food Ⓥ & curious at potlucks, cafes, fests. FREE membership! Post at http://meetup.com/RawBoston/messages/boards  & http://facebook.com/bnerv . To keep account, log in every 6 months & update email settings. Donations appreciated.
results.name: Boston N. E. Raw

results.description:
Meet other local surfers to share stories, help out new people to the sport, talk waves, and plan outings and surf.

This is a group of local surfers looking to meet one another and be social. This is a very social group. It is very difficult to 'plan surf' here in New England, as the surf can be very sporadic. We plan surfing events when possible, but many of our events will be of the social nature including beach clean ups, surfrider fundraiser events, after work cocktail hours, and other events that members show an interest in.Through these social events, we can get to know one another, and when there is surf it will be much easier to find someone to hit the beach with.

This group is made up of, and for, its members. Have an idea for an event or looking for someone to go surf with? Please feel welcome to post it as a suggested meetup or to our discussion Board. I am sure you will find many people who would love to join you!

If you are not interested in participating in these other, more social events, you are still very welcome in the group, just be sure to adjust your account settings accordingly - to receive emails daily, weekly, or not at all if you would not like to hear about the events unless you visit the page.

I look forward to meeting you and seeing you at an upcoming event!
results.name: The Surfing Meetup Group

results.description:
Users of Alfresco Open Source Enterprise Content Management to exchange information, code, use cases, case studies, demos, ideas and friends.

Leverage the transparency (of code and conduct) and community of Open Source to deliver true value with ECM!
results.name: New England Alfresco Content Management User Group

results.description:
Merry Mutts Meet Up of the North Shore is for area dog owners who enjoy taking their dogs out to walk, romp, and sniff at local dog-friendly places. This group is designed for dogs and their parents who crave fresh air, exercise, and opportunities to socialize.

Your dog should be vaccinated, spayed/neutered, and friendly toward other dogs. And you should be diligent in picking up after your pooch. Let's keep our dog-friendly venues clean! And even though "Mutts" is in the group name, pure-breds are also welcome!

Please note that many of the places we visit have opportunities for off-leash activity. Your dog must be obedient when he/she is off-leash. If you or your dog is not comfortable around energetic dogs, this may not be the group for you. However, if this group does sound like a good match, Daisy and I hope to see you at our next event!
results.name: Merry Mutts Meet Up of the North Shore

results.description:
Boston New Technology is a forum for entrepreneurs, developers and technology enthusiasts to present and discover new technology products, get feedback from early adopters, form partnerships, share ideas and get inspiration to start new ventures. We facilitate and promote networking and collaboration among innovators, investors and supporters from all around New England and beyond.

We showcase what's new and cool with startups and technology from the Boston area at free events. Our presenters demonstrate their technology and then take questions from the audience. Network with the Boston startup community, including executives, designers, developers, marketers, investors and other technology enthusiasts!

See local startups and associated hacker types in action! Marvel at the latest in cool technology! Watch some slide decks and pass around a mic to ask questions!

We mostly showcase early stage companies as presenters, but sometimes have more established companies with new tech products. We help startups build buzz and connect with the tech-savvy public, as well as potential clients, employees, partners and investors. We encourage community-building among local tech practitioners and provide inspiration and networking opportunities in fun and informal settings.

Join us and come on out!

More about BNT:

Boston New Technology is a 9,000+ member community of primarily Boston area professionals of all ages, with most between 21 and 50 years old. Most members are tech entrepreneurs, tech startup employees and others who work in technology companies.

BNT is well-known for its monthly tech startup product showcase, where we give 6 to 7 New England-based technology startups an opportunity to present live in front of an audience of 150-200 members from various industries. Presenters each have 10 minutes to give a brief overview of their tech product, demonstrate it live, and answer questions from the attendees. The presentations are preceded by an hour of networking and followed by another half hour of networking. Membership and attendance is growing steadily and every event sells out.

BNT is a Massachusetts 501(c)3 not-for-profit organization. BNT is sponsor supported and run by volunteers. All sponsorship revenue is used grow our community and run free events (dinner & beverages for attendees, Meetup fees, venue fees, signs, program handouts, name tags, etc.). Contact the organizers here to become a sponsor and engage our 9,000+ members!

Presenters needed! Do you have a new technology product to demonstrate live, or are you interested in speaking on an educational topic? Please view more info here and consider applying to present at an upcoming Meetup.

Like Boston New Tech on facebook, Follow @BostonNewTech and subscribe to our YouTube channel.
results.name: Boston New Technology Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome!

A new organizer has stepped up to run this meetup group.  Joining the group is free.  We will have events to help you meet a significant other.

Welcome to an innovative, high integrity online introduction service. It is our belief that using online methods alone makes it very difficult to find a life partner. However, when you can use the synergistic collaboration of online with personal introductions, this saves you time and money. Nowadays, 20% of all marriages are initiated online. This benefit will still be maintained to contact singles, but a socialization process helps increase the possibility that you will be introduced to the person you selected online to determine if chemistry is present.

Please don't prejudge.

Parties are sponsored in someone's home or public place.

Boston Singles ~40 Plus is an alternative to strictly online services such as Match.com, eHarmony, etc.

 

PROFILE REQUIRED - Written profile must be complete & honest

PHOTOS REQUIRED - Photo must be a RECENT (6 months), clear, close-up shot of you

EMAIL REQUIRED - Email address must be available AT ALL TIMES on the MeetUp site - if you block emails, you will be removed from the site

 


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

APPROVAL FOR MEMBERSHIP is based on providing a recent photo and honest description of yourself in the following 5 key areas:

 

1. BASIC INFO – Gender, age, status, height, body type, hair color

2. PERSONAL - Education, job, smoke, drink, diet, exercise/activity level

3. KID STUFF - Have kids, want kids, kids at home, etc.

4. FAVORITE PLACES, ACTIVITIES/THINGS - Hobbies, and passions - Please be explicit

5. ABOUT ME & WHAT I SEEK - In your own words, thanks!
results.name: Boston Singles ~40 Plus

results.description:
Body Mind Systems® specializes in training men and women to have the extra mental edge they need in life.

Students training towards their black belt are looking for maximum success with their career, investments, finances, health, community, relationships and family.

Who is right for the training? The entrepreneur, business owner, manager, consultant or professional who values a strong mind and body to ensure success in business, at home and in the community. Everyone wants a martial arts lifestyle because it’s about being a healthy, strong, harmonious human being.

Learn Ai Ki Do (Aikido), Tai Chi (Tai Chi Chuan), Tae Kwon Do (Taekwondo), Kung Fu (Gung Fu), Bagwa Chung (Bagua Zhang or Pa Kua Chang), Judo (Jujitsu or Udo), samurai sword, and traditional martial arts weapons!

Each martial arts requires different skills and offers particular benefits based on how your body has to move to match the style. We utilize all of these styles over the course of your training so you will gain more a balanced physical and mental development.

Start today! Contact us at:

Body Mind Systems
263 Main Street
Stoneham, MA 02180
781-279-1400
 http://www.bodymindsystems.com
bob.lee@bodymindsystems.com
results.name: Boston/North Shore Martial Arts Meetup Group

results.description:
Thank you for your interest in Landry's Triathlon Club! 

We are triathlon club based in the Western suburbs. We have a diverse membership with a wide range of ages and abilities, as well as levels of competitiveness, who live in towns from Wellesley to Millbury. A large number of us live in the Framingham, Hopkinton, Ashland and Southborough areas. 

Training:

Our open water trainings take place primarily in the Ashland Reservoir, on Mon, Wed and Fri mornings. Distances range from ½ mi to 2 mi or more, depending on who’s up for what. We also coordinate run and bike training at other times during the week, including early morning track workouts and the 11.3 mi Pat Bell Time Trial on Tue evenings at 6:30p, leaving from the Southborough Library. You can learn more about the Pat Bell TT on Facebook. 

Membership Dues:

Our annual membership fee is currently $25. The link to pay dues is: https://www.bikereg.com/27665. 

Most years we offer our members club-logo'd shwag (a hat, hoodie, bike shirt, etc.) This year we’re designing a windbreaker. The club will subsidize about 50% and members will pitch in about $20, so that we break even.

Team Races:

This year we have designated the Ashland Lions Olympic Tri on June 21, the Mass State Championships Olympic Tri on July 12 and Cranberry Trifest on Aug 23rd as team races. We will have the Landry's Bike 12'x12' canopy at these races for members and their guests to congregate under. Members will be at many other races throughout the season, including sprints, Olympics, ½ irons, and ironman races (2 at Mont Tremblant and 1 at Lake Placid), as well as at road (running) races and certain biking events such as reach the beach and the Harpoon brewer ride. Although we did not do so this year, we typically enter one or two teams at TriMania in the beginning of the season (at MIT), and regardless of whether we do this, many of us attended TriMania. 

Social:

We have pre-season and post-season BBQs, and we have been known to meet for a drink on a random week night as well. We also tend to share a good deal of information on training, nutrition, race expectations, fitness, recovery, etc.

Other:

Some members are also into Cyclocross, Aquabike, and trail running. Also, we get discounts at Landry’s and other sponsors.

Off-Season: 

We have begun to make arrangements with Landry’s to host off-season bike training in the stores, open only to Tri club members where we’ll bring our own bikes and hook them up to trainers.

Feel free to message me if you wish to learn more. Happy training and racing!

Craig Slater

President, LTC
results.name: Landry's Triathlon Group

results.description:
This meetup is for people interested in sacred Tantra. Intention of this group is to support and promote the exploration of the sacred and spiritual expansion that practicing and teaching sacred Tantra, the Tantric Healing Arts, and Tantra Yoga can produce. All interested parties are welcome, whether you are a teacher, practitioner, beginner, single, or partnered.

Mission Statement of the New England Tantric Meetup:
* Our sole purpose is to support and promote sacred Tantra, Tantric paths and values, and the Tantric Healing Arts, to meet and share experiences for the benefit of everyone's growth and awareness, and to expand consciousness and unconditional love for all group members.
* Membership is open to all and does not discriminate regardless of legal age, race, gender, belief systems, or body types.
* We do not support strict dogma or belief systems, and no belief systems will be forced upon anyone by other members. We only ask that all members be kind to one another.
results.name: New England Tantric Meetup

results.description: We are looking to capture beautiful light paths that fall on human forms. We will explore and share what we learn. We look forward to work with photographers, models and makeup artists who have the same interests.

results.description:

results.description: This is a group focused on fun for grown ups! We focus on combining fun with experience and culture. If you like arts, culture, music, travel, performing arts, literature and so much more, then this is the group for you. All ages welcome.
results.name: Boston Fun for Grown Ups

results.description:
Ambient + Breakbeat + Downtempo + Drum and Bass + Electro + Hardcore + Hi-NRG + House + Industrial + IDM + Jungle + Techno +Trance + Uptempo + everything in between, as long as it makes you want to dance!

Events will be listed, not all of them will have a host - this group is to both share upcoming events and get together like-minded music lovers.

results.description: Do you enjoy walking? Would you enjoy getting some fresh air after work? Then this group is for you! We will avoid walking down busy main streets. Instead we will walk on sidewalks along beautiful side streets, pedestrian pathways or better yet (once sunset is later) on trails through parks and nature preserves!
results.name: Evening Walkers

results.description: Meet other local fans of the card game, Hearts! Gather to play games, discuss strategy, and socialize.
results.name: The Framingham Hearts Meetup Group

results.description:
This meetup was originally to promote Ron Paul for President. Given the disappointing activity in 2012 by the official campaign of Ron Paul for President and the choice between voting for Romney or Obama I changed it to 'Blank the Ballot' in recognition that there was no candidate worth voting for.

Along with I think many others I have also been disappointed with the foreign policy statements of Rand Paul and so this group is decidedly NOT set up to support any effort he makes to become a candidate for President and will remain for the foreseeable future a proponent of 'blanking the ballot' (blank ballots are counted in Mass.) as the only reasonable option in the upcoming presidential election..
results.name: Election 2016-Blank The Ballot!

results.description:
Are you an Onyxbird? "What's that?", you ask. That's my term for people of african heritage (i.e., african, african-american, afro-caribbean, afro-latino, afro-european) who love to spread their wings and travel to unusual, unexpected and interesting places. The Onyxbird also thrives on cultural exploration and tends to be socially conscious. Unfortunately, Onyxbirds tend to fly solo or as a pair. Very rarely are "flocks" of Onyxbirds spotted in China or Argentina or Finland or New Zealand.

The purpose of this group is to form a Boston flock of Onyxbirds. We share travel tales, photos, food, music, recommendations, horror stories and more from our travels. We even schedule some "migrations"!!

Please note that this group is not meant to be exclusionary. It is simply meant as a way to encourage people from the african diaspora to travel together and experience destinations other than the usual ones (e.g., Caribbean islands, Cancun, USA, etc.). We will always welcome birds from other flocks into the nest with open wings.

Come get blown away by travel with the ONYXBIRDS!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W-RABR4FCAc
results.name: Boston "Onyxbirds" Travel Group

results.description:
A monthly celebration and exploration of the JavaScript programming language. If you are interested in speaking or sponsoring please contact one of the organizers!

All proceeds go to Science Club for Girls.

Keep in touch with us on twitter, @bos_js!

-/-

We believe that everyone deserves a thoroughly pleasant meetup experience, regardless of who they are. Therefore, we adhere to the Bocoup Code of Conduct and expect that all of our speakers, attendees, and volunteers will do the same. Please take the time to read it before attending your first meetup!

Additionally, please refrain from posting job listings or unsolicited proprietary resources. Any posts or communication that violate this will be flagged as inappropriate and deleted.
results.name: BostonJS

results.description:
Meet other local Hand-Drummers who are interested creating community through the rich history of Africa and its people. Drum Circles are a great way to stay connected to our inner rhythms. Please join us with any drum you have or with your dancing feet! We would also welcome singers and griots! Stringed instruments and flutes. Come ALL to help create a healing African village here in Boston! With respect...

“Great fun! Good rhythms. Very accommodating leader and group for this beginner. Will be back!”Adrienne S 10/14

results.description:
Welcome to Social Fun. Glad you found our fun + friendly group of members with a 21 to 55+ age range. We welcome you to our group of diverse members (singles, married + divorced).  We enjoy local social activities like: dining, movies, talks, parties, wine tasting, hikes, Art & Culture, music, happy hours, game & trivia nights, dancing, adventures, social networking, etc.  Enjoying the good life in the New England and Boston Areas.

We’re the most active Meetup group, running 60+ events monthly. With over 8200 members we’re a huge group with a friendly close knit family feel since there are 50+ Organizers to run events locally. The average event size is 20 members, thus providing you a pleasant real life experience to make lifelong friendships and possible more (like marriage).

We want everyone to feel welcome, and that means we are committed to having everyone feel comfortable, as well as safe.  If it's your first time to one of our events, please don't be afraid that you won't know anyone.  We will make sure you are welcome.

Together we’ll have new experiences, explore new places, try new things and enjoy all that the Boston area has to offer. Whatever your interests, we’ll have an event for you in this group.

We look forward to meeting you so please sign up for an event today and have fun.  It will be one of the best choices you have ever made. Now get out and enjoy some Social Fun.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------PLEASE NOTE: This is NOT a dating group, although 90% of the members are single that is not the focus of the group. This group is about making friendships. Dating does evolve and we’ve had over 25 members that have either gotten married, engaged or are in a comment long lasting relationships. This is directly attributed to the relaxed, no pressure group setting we have created and it is nice to know we have brought so many couples together too.

Costs: To join the group and attend most events is basically FREE, but we ask if you enjoy the group, help us keep it going by making a $10 annual donation to help cover the costs associated with running such a large group like paying off the Meetup fees of $144/year.

Sorry, but to join/stay in this group ALL Members are required to have a recent real clear main profile photo of themselves or they will not be allowed to join this group or removed for lacking this photo. Please reapply to join with a conforming photo. Thanks.

Photo help can be found here:

http://www.meetup.com/help/How-do-I-add-and-manage-my-photos/

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Only members can change their e-mail settings. Please follow details in this link below:

http://www.meetup.com/help/How-do-I-edit-my-group-email-settings/ 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Social Fun Credo:

Social Fun Members Credo

1. Participate in Social Fun to have fun and make new friends. Please do not create drama.

2. Must have a completed profile with a clear, recent photo and profile information.

3. RSVP "YES" only when you’re 100% sure you can attend.

4. Arrive on time and never "No Show." Members who "No Show" take away RSVP slots from other Members and negatively impact Social Fun events.

5. Understand that after 3 'No Shows' over 3 months any AO WILL remove you from Social Fun

6. You are the ONLY ones capable of changing your Meetup Announcement e-mail settings. Social Fun Organizers cannot set these.

Social Fun Organizers Credo

7. Take attendance at events.

8. May disallow members with 2 or more "No Show" marks from attending their events.

9. Post events on a first come, first served basis.

10. May contact Biagio or other Organizers for help.

==================================================

DISCLAIMER: During all events, Members are  responsible for themselves. The Organizer and Assistant Organizers are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. By joining the group, you acknowledge this. Thanks

You are accountable for your own success.   As such, it's your responsibility to discover your special gifts, attributes and capabilities that can give you a competitive edge and the greatest probability to have a flourishing career.

Career management requires quality networking, being in the right place at the right time, earning a voice at the table, knowing your unique value proposition and how to use it, managing your personal brand, being influential – to name a few essentials.

But in the end, all of these factors require one important thing: a personal commitment to manage and invest in your career the right way.

As a member of Interactive Marketing and Advertising you have an opportunity to invest in your career.

Interactive Marketing has proven to be one of the most disruptive and powerful marketing approaches of the past few decades, managing to turn centuries-old and established media and agency models obsolete.

 Interactive Marketing Will Focus on Relationships Instead of Media 

The future of interactive marketing relies mostly on building and nurturing collaborative relationships with customers instead of relying solely on online campaigns. This differentiates Interactive marketing from online marketing, despite the fact that they both depend heavily on the Internet as a means of building connections.

Interactive Marketing Will Impact Your Career

Interactive marketing as a disruptive force has the potential to alter the ways in which we communicate and make purchase decisions.

results.description:
Our purpose:

1. to discover and identify the plants and animals living among us

2. to learn their habits and survival requirements

3. to implement landscaping and other wildlife accommodations, such as nest boxes, feeders, brush piles, rock piles, tree snags, ponds and other water features.

 

Meetings will alternate between trips to public greenspace and private homes.  We'll search for plants and animals and learn how they function in our ecosystem.  We'll visit meetup members' homes and neighborhoods to evaluate their habitat potential and discuss improvements. 

A knowledge of plants--their identification, nutritional value to wildlife, and cultural requirements--will serve a major role in our endeavor, since they are an ecosystem's foundation.  All animals require plants--specific plants--for their survival.  Even carnivores rely on plants to nourish their prey.  We'll learn and share many techniques for creating habitat, but landscaping is key. 

This meetup is chiefly intended for nature lovers who are upset to see wilderness vanish and want to become actively involved in making a difference--starting with their own backyard (and frontyard). Many of you have enough greenspace around your homes to make an impact.  There are also many who haven't got much more than a couple windowboxes or a single tree beside your apartment.  Yet, you shouldn't feel limited to your immediate surroundings; there are opportunities to volunteer in your neighborhood's public parks/public spaces, or chances to guerrilla garden in vacant lots.

Many of you are interested in ethnobotany--medicinal plants, foraging wild edibles, etc.  While that hasn't been the central focus of this group, it is certainly a welcome supplement, and engages people in their natural world in a way that helps them best identify with the experience of wildlife: gathering and using plants for survival.  We neglect our environment when we fail to recognize this common interest and the value it provides.

All suburban properties are landscaped to some extent; owners recognize the improved appearance and property value.  Yet, the plants chosen are too often non-native, invasive, produce sterile blossoms, inedible fruit, often situated in monocultures, and are a limited selection of tedious repetition (on average, the same 40 plants--in various arrangements--comprise 90% of our suburban landscapes).  Some of the problem lies with limited availability from nurseries and garden centers; the rest with uninformed consumers.  So let's get informed.  With a little insight, plants offering beauty and greater wildlife benefit can be substituted.



ps.  

We love dogs, but many of our members prefer not to walk with them during our nature hikes--they can sometimes be a distraction when we are trying to observe wildlife.
results.name: Suburban Naturalists

results.description:
The Vocal Revolution at vocalrevolution.org (formerly Sounds of Concord) is one of New England's top performing men's a cappella choruses that loves to perform for the love of music. Chartered in the Barbershop Harmony Society (BHS), Vocal Revolution (VR for short) has been entertaining audiences for over 40 years, most recently as one of New England's top-ranked male vocal ensembles, specifically the 2012 Northeastern District (NED) Chorus Champion of the BHS. Our singing is primarily in the barbershop style: four-part close harmony with rich emotional melodies designed to captivate our audiences. Our current repertoire includes gorgeous ballads, toe-tapping swing songs, and vivacious up-tunes geared at energizing our listeners. While we specialize in traditional barbershop tunes, we enjoy all forms of a cappella music from stage and screen, spirituals, folk tunes, and patriotic songs.

The singers of Vocal Revolution come from all walks of life, joining together to share the
joy of singing and fellowship. From the risers, you'll find lawyers, software programmers,
students, salesmen, handymen, retired men, and the list goes on. We join together to create music that has the ability to affect people's lives, if only for a moment.

Our philosophy is that if you want to do something, it's worth doing at the best of your ability!

Our culture consists of a diverse group of guys who bond together by one fervent passion: we love to sing and we believe that changing lives through music is worth the hard work and determination asked of us in Vocal Revolution. We work hard individually outside of rehearsal to learn the notes and words to our songs, so that rehearsal time can be spent molding our individual abilities into a holistic art form. Our consistent goal is to better ourselves, as well as the chorus, as we work together to make our sound a true item of beauty. We hope you will love the VR culture of warmth and encouragement; each member has his own unique qualities and we love that! We are thrilled to have you experience it for yourself.
results.name: Vocal Revolution Men's Chorus

Making a 1 year and a 5 year plan

Speakers on economy/taxes that effect small business

Expanding your business

Hiring

Time management

The importance of personal health, sleep, diet on Productivity

Learning basic accounting/P&L statements

Using the internet to advertise & promote your business

Making websites

Create business 'partners' who keep each other Accountable for implementing your own business goals

results.description:
I love movies. You love movies. Let's go together! We'll try to make the movies we see diverse (mix comedy, romance, action, etc.) so that there will always be some members interested in each movie. (I hope!) Some movies may even be appropriate for kids. Guests are always welcome.

We'll meet at the Framingham theater (near the Natick Collection mall) and then go out for drinks/snacks somewhere nearby to discuss it.

Occasionally we'll hit another theater with "offbeat" movies.
results.name: MetroWest Movie Meetup

results.description:
Looking to get in shape? Want to be a part of a team sport? Interested in meeting a diverse and fun group of new friends? Join Living Root Dragon Boat. We are always looking for new members. 

We are a competitive Boston-based dragon boat team. We're made up of about 60 to 80 people from all genders, races, age groups, and smartness levels. We get together several times a week to practice dragon boating. We compete all over the region and traveled to Canada, China, Puerto Rico, Philadelphia, Florida and San Francisco.  

Off the water, we are a close group of friends and we like to do stuff! All kinds of stuff!! Teamwork is really important to us and we try really hard to integrate new paddlers into the team. If you're new to the area, dragon boat is a great way to meet people and make friends. If you've been in Boston for years and you're tired of your old friends, we can help freshen up your social life. 

What to Expect When you Show Up 
We practice three times a week, and we're always looking for new people to come paddle with us. No experience necessary! Our excellent coaches will teach you everything you need to know. If you are in good shape, we will work you out! If you are still trying to get in shape, don’t worry, many of our current team members started where you are. We will make you bad ass.

Attendance is not mandatory. Come as often as you like. If you love it (We know you will) and want to compete with us, we race 6-7 times a year. Come to one race or come to all the races! The more the merrier.

Additional location and parking details can be found here.

Come check us out on Facebook and see our website at www.livingroot.org!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=At-JoQ_7VFg
results.name: Living Root Dragon Boat - Boston

results.description:
Want to practice and improve your Arabic? This group is for native and secondary users of all forms of Arabic, literary or spoken of all levels and ages. Anyone who is interested in Arabic, from beginner to native-speaker is welcome! Our goal is to schedule as many events as possible to accomodate the range of proficiencies as well as provide a variety of cultural/linguistic events for our members. New event organizers are always welcome, so if you have an idea for an upcoming event and would like to organize it, please do no hesitate to contact the organizer at sarabeth1342@yahoo.com.
Also please submit an answer to the poll so that the organizers can better schedule meetups that work for as many people as possible. Thanks, and welcome to the Boston Arabic Meetup!

Un Meet-Up pour tous les gens qui parlent francais.

We welcome all levels of French speakers!

Our meetups are free flowing French conversation and we find we are best suited for those wishing to practice or keep their existing French skills. While we do help each other find the right words to use, this is not an instructional setting. True beginners are welcome to come but may find they do more listening than talking.

results.description:
Come join the Newton Hip Mamas and meet other moms in the neighborhood and be active with your little ones.

This group is run by moms. All playdates are organized by parents from our group.

If there is an event you would like to host (playdate, movie night, book club, museum visit, etc...) we are always open to new ideas and looking for moms who take the initiative. We are able to keep most events free or at cost because it is all run by members.

This is a sister group to the Newton Mamas Big Tent Group, our online community for advice and to share information.

In order to join this group you will need to:

- include your first and last name (or first letter of your last name) on your Meet Up ID

- have your photo on your Meet Up ID

- be a current member of the Newton Mamas Big Tent Group.

To apply go to https://www.bigtent.c... and follow the instructions. After your Big Tent membership is approved, mention that you are a Newton Mamas member in your Meet Up application. When your Meet Up membership is approved, you will receive an email confirmation and will be able to view the events on the calendar.

The moderators reserve the right to cancel membership of anyone who behaves inappropriately, spams or doesn't play nice. We can't wait to meet you!

The heart of this group includes practitioners who integrate the body and touch with some sort of emotional work or counseling.  However, we welcome others with complementary and related modalities.

We meet the second Friday of each month for a potluck lunch from 11:30 am - 1:30 pm in Newton, MA.  Meetings include time for networking, colleagial conversation and a presentation by one of members.

Boston's City Girls consist of Boston's finest Socialites who want to get out into the city, meet new people, and try new things. We have a mix of events, from trying new restaurants and going out for drinks to checking out museums and beaches. We are a very friendly group, so please come ready to talk!!

If you are ready to "see and be seen”, enjoy yourself while getting to know your fellow City Girls and create an astonishing bond, The Boston City Girls welcome you with open arms.

results.description:
The NSL group is a social network of diverse women who are exciting, adventurous, friendly,and fun!!  Everyone will be included and encouraged to hang out with us.

We have ongoing events for you to meet other women which include: Tea Dances, theatre, museum outings, cocktail socials, brunches, dinners, game nights, sporting activities, outdoor fun and much, much more..

Check out the calendar for upcoming events, RSVP... and then you are on your way to building new friendships!

There's a $5 fee for joining this group that I do ask that you make to help cover the costs. (For those that don't know how it works, Meetup charges me $144 or so/year for use of this website).  We also use those monies to cover deposits on events, decorations for events etc.

It would also be extremely helpful if you would please fill out the profile questions and take a minute to RSVP to all events offered. This gives us a better idea of what type of events to plan for the future and let's us know that you're an active member of this group!

Speaking of future events, we're always open to more ideas so please feel free to contact us with your suggestions!

We are also looking for assistant organizers and event managers so please let me know if you'd like to get involved no matter how little!

See you at a meetup!

Mel & Teri

Welcome to the Meetup site of Integral Hypnosis, a Boston Area hypnotherapy and philosophical counseling practice. This meetup group has been created for the exclusive use of existing clients and potential clients of Integral Hypnosis.

Subjects for discussion focus on a variety of self-improvement and other issues including: Stress reduction. Anxiety. Motivation. Peak performance in work and sports. Health and wellness. Weight loss. Smoking cessation. Past life regression. Philosophical counseling and how it relates to hypnotherapy. And more! Learn how to overcome subconscious fears, mental blocks and bad habits that can stand in the way of personal achievement and your realization of greater happiness and success, all while meeting new people and making friends in a fun and friendly atmosphere.
