results.description:
I have formed this community of amazing women who happen to be Single Mothers primarily, but not exclusively, from Boston, Cambridge, Somerville, Medford and Malden.  This group is also open to non-single parents who appreciate & support our situation (relatives, mentors, teachers, adult children of single moms, babysitters, etc.).
This meetup is unique from most because it is a chance for families to not only get together at least once a month, but to really be a supportive resource to single mothers.  If your sitter bailed at the last minute, you would call another mother within our community to help you out & she, in return, could count on you to reciprocate, without $$$.  Or if you are without a vehicle, but need to go food shopping, another mom would be able to support you as well.
This group is definitely lots of fun.  We have Moms' Nite Out/In, cool outings with the kids, pampering days, themed playdates & so much more!  I have enrolled business associates, qualified sitters & male mentors, just to name a few, who have offered their support as well.
You will have love, support, a voice that will be heard and friendships that will last a lifetime!
results.name: Single Mothers United

results.description: Come out and explore Boston's history, architecture and culture with a group of knowledgeable and passionate guides. Boston By Foot is a non-profit organization that promotes the architecture and history of Boston and has been offering guided walking tours of Boston since 1976. Our meetup group is made up of Boston By Foot volunteers, Boston explorers, history buffs, and architecture aficionados who like the "off the beaten trail" walking tours offered by Boston By Foot. Learn more about Boston By Foot at www.bostonbyfoot.org. Boston By Foot charges a price for their tours to keep the organization going but once in a while we get a freebie. A "card holder" price is also posted which applies to card-carrying Boston By Foot members. Joining this meetup group doesn't make you a Boston By Foot member, you need to do that through the Boston By Foot web site. The membership fees for an individual are about $50 per year (less if you are a student) . If you plan on attending more than a few, the membership is worth it. You can also arrange to sample one and apply your ticket fee to a membership following a tour.
results.name: Boston By Foot Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Sportbike Riders (BSR)! We are an active and passionate community of sportbike riders. If you are serious about riding and would like to learn something new each time you are on a group ride, then look no further! You'll find everything here...touring, day/weekend rides, short rides, adventure rides and even track days.

The following motorcycle classes are welcome into BSR:
a. Superbikes / Supersports / Hypersports
b. Naked street bikes >250cc
c. Dual Sports
d. Sport/Adventure Tourers

Please post a recent portrait-type photograph of yourself so that we know what you look like and can identify you when you are meeting up for a group ride.

BSR is a 100% free, non-profit community. Member donations are appreciated and can be electronically sent via Meetup. You can click below to make a donation securely.

We recommend that you join us for a relaxed ride at least once, before you sign up for any advanced rides. This would help you understand the group's dynamics and decide if we are a good fit for you. Thanks for visiting and ride safe!

-BSR team

DISCLAIMER: By being a member of this group you acknowledge that motorcycle related activities are dangerous and that accidents causing death, bodily injury, disability and property damage, can, and do happen.You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold the group's Organizers or event hosts liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or property arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity. You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis. See terms of service 6,6.1,6.2

Terms and conditions: http://www.meetup.com/terms/
results.name: Boston Sportbike Riders

results.description:
¡Hola a todos!

Want to meet local Spanish speakers who appreciate Hispanic culture?  Join our meetup and make new friends as you practice Spanish, improve your conversation skills, and/or help others learn the Spanish language!

Bonus points for native Spanish speakers who join!  This a nice opportunity to make friends, and like an intercambio, it's a good place to improve your English.  Plus, we'll treat you like a rock star!

Pass the word around and encourage others to join! All ages and levels welcome.

We are open to new ideas for meetup locations, help with organizing or hosting.

Gracias & nos vemos pronto,

Don

results.description:
"Sex And the City", "Friends", "Seinfeld"-- Something fundamental about these shows made them cult like hits. I think it recognizes a reality that young 20s, 30 somethings desire-- a good network of reliable friends. Ever get a flat tire, need a ride to the airport, and wonder which buddy you can call. And overall, what maeks this group different is that sometimes we don't want to go hiking- we just want to go out the house, go for coffee, the movies, or shopping with a bud to have someone tell us how we look at that shirt.

I believe the diversity of interests of friends can make it fun. So this is the Seinfeld of Meetup groups, about nothing, ...about everything. The meet-ups will be laid back and I will make sure people get introduced. I was an RA in college so maybe I'm good at that.

results.description:
Welcome to the North Star SoulCollage Meetup. We're an evolving group based near Boston

SoulCollage® is a creative practice, much like keeping an art journal. The card-making process itself is simple, satisfying, and especially enjoyable when done in groups. We express and explore ourselves by creating a unique deck of cards that will grow and change over time.

Our group, led by a long-time Meetup organizer and a certified SoulCollage facilitator, is open to adults (18+). Absolutely no artistic experience is required. We'll be holding events in MetroWest (probably Natick), on the South Shore (probably Braintree or Milton), and possibly in other areas as well. Stay tuned.
results.name: North Star SoulCollage Meetup

results.description: There are groups and social clubs for singles, and groups and social clubs for tall folks in the Boston area - but this is the only social group that specifically caters for TALL, SINGLE and SOCIALLY ACTIVE adults in the greater Boston area!! So: If you are TALL (Female at least 5ft 8in in height, Male at least 6'0"ft in height), 21+ years in age, SINGLE (You have never been Married, or you are Divorced, or you are Widowed) and looking to meet, interact, socialize and experience the wonders of BOSTON and its surrounding areas, with other BOSTON TALL SINGLES, Then this is a group you need to join! We are looking for enthusiastic folks who will actively participate in events, contribute ideas and suggestions, and - most importantly - promote fun and friendship in everything that we do (regardless of the weather or how well/badly the Red Sox/Patriots are doing!). PLEASE NOTE OUR GROUP POLICIES AND GROUND RULES AT: http://www.meetup.com/bostontallsingles/about/ including our requirements for ALL members to: (1) Complete ALL sections of the profile; (2) Post a clear head & shoulders photo from which they can be recognized; (3) Provide at least a first name as part of their user title or in the text of their profile.

results.description:

The Singles Dinner Party Meetup group opens up the possibilities for adults to begin, or continue dating, by meeting people in a non-threatening, warm environment where it's easy to relax, feel "at home" and share your best self.  You will meet other single adults in a similar situation - create friendships, allies for support, practice flirting and relating to new people and -- most of all, have fun doing it!

results.description:
Hello Everyone,

My name is Reverend Christine. I am a priest in the Center of Light, a mystical center. I want to share with others the joy and gift of meditation and connection with God. Personally, daily meditation continues to help me to be centered in my life. I have been meditating for many years using different techniques. My path through yoga and contemplative Hinduism brought me to mystical Christianity. 
I will offer meet ups, classes, events and seminars that will focus on experiencing inner peace, stillness of mind, learning how to connect with God inside. Meditation is a tool to learn more about ourselves and others, and to have a deeper relationship with the Great Source of love, God (or what ever name you want to call It.) Practice is the key, It is totally doable even for the most unruly mind!

results.description:
Tuesdays from 6:30 - 8:30 pm, Crossroads Community Church, 1341 Edgell Road in Framingham, MA (once in the parking lot, look for our DivorceCare sign)

DivorceCare is both a seminar and a support group. We are here to help those who have experienced separation or divorce. Our facilitators have personally experienced a divorce and through attending a DivorceCare ministry have healed and want to help you start your healing.

Whether you have been separated 1 day, or divorced for more than 25 years, this is a safe place to start your healing.
Please come in on any week. The sessions are designed for you to start up whenever you need us. There is no need to wait until the beginning of a new season. Start now, you'll be glad that you did.

Come and discover help and healing with others who understand what you are experiencing.

The DivorceCare material is based on a Christian perspective, though people of all faiths and no faith participate in this program.

DivorceCare is NOT a dating environment.

Call or e-mail with any questions: David or Debbie Hartman: (508)-881-8171 // Email David or Debbie at divorcecare@crosscommchurch.org

If Framingham, MA is too far for you to drive, please visit http://www.divorcecare.com for a group closer to your home.

This group is sponsored by Crossroads Community Church.

To see faq, list of topics, and videos about the group go to http://www.crossroadsframingham.com/heal/divorce-care/
results.name: DivorceCare in Framingham MA

results.description:
Professionals of Color Networking Group (PCNG) is an informal professional and social group, where you can get to know people and build high impact and lasting relationships.

We aim to create a positive, relaxed atmosphere, where professionals of color can meet new friends and business contacts. Our meetups run the gamut from fun activities such as movies, bowling, and dining out to formal business meetings and personal development workshops. We have several meetups per month to keep members engaged.

Please note that as of September 2013 all prospective members must have a real individual profile photo to join in the group. Couples' photos are accepted for those joining as a pair. Paintings, landscapes, back-of-the-head shots, multi-person photos, etc. will not be accepted as a profile photo. If you wish to be anonymous then this is not the group for you.

Sponsorship and Advertising Opportunities are Available. Contact the Organizer for more information.
results.name: Professionals of Color Networking Group

results.description:
Come join the "Boston Meditates" meetup group. Initiated by Boston-based young professionals and students from MIT and Harvard, Boston Meditates is a new movement to spread awareness about the benefits of meditation. We organize and host meditation and breathing workshops, meditation mixers, free meditation experience sessions and more fun activities in the area.

Bostonians are known to lead hectic professional and personal lives. The busier one is, the more one has to meditate. Meditation helps one dive inward to the source of joy, energy and creativity, and come out into activity with that stillness. It is a daily practice to center oneself and allows one to stay in the game at their best. Increasingly, corporations and other institutions are offering mediation workshops. CEOs and executives at top companies, including Google, Salesforce and Tupperware, state in recent magazine articles that meditation restores balance in their lives, improves sleep and provides them with a competitive edge.

Boston Meditates is supported by The Art of Living Foundation. Founded in 1981, the Art of Living Foundation is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) educational and humanitarian organization working in consultative status with the United Nations’ Economic and Social Council on initiatives related to health, meditation, education, sustainable development, conflict resolution and disaster relief.  Connect with Boston Meditates on Facebook and Twitter.
results.name: "Boston Meditates" Meditation Group

results.description:
Welcome to BAPOM!  (Great acronym, right?) 

This Meetup aims to bring people together who have an interest or experience in astral projection, out-of-body experiences, lucid dreaming, shamanic journeying, remote viewing, and more.  These could all be considered expanded or mystical states of consciousness.  Anyone interested in these topics or other psychic or mystical phenomena is welcome to join us.  Our group meets so like-minded souls can connect, offer support, and exchange ideas and techniques.


Please note, this group used to be run by the International Academy for Consciousness, but they are no longer our sponsor.  This Meetup had a Near Death Experience of it's own, as it no longer had a sponsor and was about to shut down!  I very much wanted to meet with others having OBE's and other mystical experiences, and I really wanted to keep this group going.  Hence, I am now the moderator, the group continues, and I am making some changes.


See you on the astral!


Anne
results.name: The Boston Astral Projection & OBE Meetup

results.description:
ABOUT THE ORGANIZER

The organizer has been in the community for over 12+ years and has volunteered in various events, such as, Boston Pride and the Human Rights Campaign.

She has a BA from Wellesley College and a MA from Emerson College. She currently works in the biotech industry in the Business Development and Global Marketing Departments. She is also a freelance writer/reporter.   

ABOUT FW4FW

"Femme Women4Femme Women (FW4FW)" is a group that is:

  • Sophisticated
  • Respectful
  • Open-minded
  • Positive
  • DRAMA-FREE
  • FEMME ONLY
  • Private  
  • Safe

It's for femme lesbians/bisexual women only who are:

  • Age 40+
  • Intelligent
  • EMOTIONALLY MATURE
  • Professional  

Please Note: Definition of Emotionally Mature - An adult who takes full responsibility for one's life, i.e, feelings, words, deeds, behaviors, and accepts the consequences, if any. The adult also does not blame, make excuses, or project onto others one's issues, problems, and/or behaviors.

This group is about attracting and maintaining quality femme women (lesbian and/or bi-sexual) who are interested in meeting other femme women (lesbian and/or bi-sexual) in the community. 

It is a subgroup of the community that identifies as "femme" as it is defined by that particular person. Although I realize that people do not like to label themselves which I respect, it is used only as a common denominator for this group.

GOAL OF GROUP

To make friends, network, socialize, and have fun with other femme women in the community. This social group is NOT:   

  • a swinger's group/club;
  • a hook-up site;
  • a dating service; or
  • a therapy group.

There are other groups and community centers that would be better suited to meet those particular needs.

MEMBERS

Members range in age from 40s to 60s and work in various fields, such as, insurance, medical, legal, communications, health, travel, just to name a few. Friendships have been made and couples have been formed as a result of being a part of this group.

EVENTS

Events are unique, upscale, and engaging while drinking is more an art than its own activity. The group is geared around events and works best under this structure.

These events are meant to help meet each other and what occurs between consenting members offline or after events are private and between them.

The calendar - which lists the events - can only be viewed if you are a member. There are two types of activities: scheduled meetup events (gray / pink or orange colored dates) vs. events that are for your information only (yellow post-it dates). Meetup's are scheduled anywhere from one to four per month.

The group is organized on a volunteer basis and events are scheduled in between other priorities, such as, careers, jobs, relationships, vacations, family obligations, etc.

GUIDELINES

Like other successful groups, there are guidelines which are similar to meetup.com's. In a nutshell, it's the basic golden rule of life: be respectful of one another in word and deed. If alcohol is involved, then know your limits so that the guidelines can still be followed and adhered; in other words, please drink responsibly.

DONATION/MEMBERSHIP DUES

Donation/Membership dues is $26.98 which covers meetup fees and any costs associated with setting up events. Please note: Yearly online payment is made before being admitted into the group.


JOINING

It's easy to become a member, so feel free to join if:

  • You are 40 and above; and
  • You identify as "femme" however "femme" is defined for you.

And remember...you get as much as you put in...this meetup is about and for you!

*Please note that membership acceptances are done bi-monthly.
results.name: (40+) Femme Woman4Femme Women - Femme Only Group (FW4FW)

results.description:
Welcome to Wakefield Weeknights! Not JUST for Wakefield people, but from surrounding areas as well. And not JUST for weeknights.  We'll schedule some weekend activities as well!  We may even schedule some day trips, overnight trips, etc.  All ideas are welcome!

If you're looking for fun and friends without the need to travel too far or figure out how to park in the city, this is the group for you! We'll plan various social activities in Wakefield and the surrounding areas, targeting the 20 and 30 and 40 something crowd.  This is an active group with a wide variety of members. 

PLEASE try not to NO SHOW.  We often wait for people, especially new members, who never show.  You can change your RSVP right up until the meetup time online.  The event organizer will post what they will be wearing and a phone # in case you arrive late and want to find the group.  Be sure to check the meetup page often for updates. 

This has been a GREAT group so far and we want to keep it that way.  So... the disclaimers...

1. Please note that many of our events are in locations where alcohol is available.  All members of the group are responsible for their own conduct, responsible behavior, etc.  The organizers, event hosts and www.meetup.com shall not be held liable for anyone's actions at any time.

2. This is a PUBLIC group on www.meetup.com.  If you do not wish to have your photo published, please let any picture takers know this at the events.

3.  This is a fun and laid back group.  We are not looking for drama!  We just want to share some good times!  :)

How many times have you asked yourself: "What should I do tonight? Where should I go for New Years Eve? Is there anything exciting going on this weekend?"

Well, look no further! "Things To Do® BOSTON: Experiences For Young Professionals" is the premiere organization for socializing and networking with fellow young professionals. With over 75,000 active members, Things To Do® (TTD) produces original events that enrich your social and cultural experiences while enabling you to meet other young professionals in a friendly environment. From black tie galas to embassy affairs, informational seminars to outdoor adventure, nightclub parties to exotic weekend getaways, TTD combines 30 years of event planning experience with dynamic imagination to provide something for every young professional.

So, whether you're looking for new friends, new business contacts, or a potential soul mate, TTD brings together the best people and places Boston has to offer.

Feeling good is the point of being, afterall!  We'll do processes, exercises, and guided meditations to help you connect to your Source Energy and to feel good!

We hope to have a variety of options for you to choose from and participate in: looser meetings, focused workshops, more intensive focus groups, social events, meditation evenings, calls, and movie nights! Got an idea or request? Please let us know!

We want to have a strong community, so we hope you'll participate regularly and stay in touch by participating in our community's message board discussions and receiving our e-mails (which will include our "Good Vibrations" tips and news). To be able to do so, go to your account, and under "Your Groups", each one has an "Edit email settings". Set your preferences there. Hope to hear from you!

Please also go to our Files section (under "More" at top of page) and read more about the intentions of our group and the beliefs and principles it is based on.

Joy to you!

results.description:
Boston Startup Pitch Night focuses on providing monthly opportunities for you to practice, refine, and perfect your startup pitches.  We also provide targeted networking and learning opportunities in the Boston, Massachusetts region to meet, form partnerships, and launch or formulate new start-ups.

Boston Startup Pitch Night's events are run by a leadership team that works to find the meeting venues and plan out and execute all the Meetup events.  Our mission is to be known as the place to practice your pitch, to receive feedback on your pitch from peers, and most importantly, to be a supportive and fun way to practice your pitch and meet other like-minded startup and technology people. We look forward to meeting all of you and hearing your startup pitches!

THE WEBSITE:  http://www.StartupPitchNight.com
VIDEO CLIPS:  http://www.PitchNight.TV
Contact Us:  http://www.StartupPitchNight.com/contact/


The people that typically join and attend are:

* Startup Founders and Co-Founders
* Entrepreneurs
* Developers and Programmers
* Mentors and Advisers
* Investors and Service Providers (legal, finance, marketing, etc.)

What are your needs?

* Would you like a co-founder to join your start-up?
* Do you have an idea for a new start-up?
* Do you want to become a co-founder at an existing start-up?
* Would you like to find or be a mentor?
* Do you want to find or be an adviser?
* Would you like to find or become a board member?
* Are you passionate about tech and start-ups?

If you answered "Yes!" to some of those questions, then the next Boston Startup Pitch Night could provide you with the exact types of targeted and relevant contacts that you need to launch, build, and/or grow your start-up!

If you are interested in attending Startup Pitch Night events in New York City, feel free to take a look at New York Startup Pitch Night - http://www.meetup.com/New-York-Startup-Pitch-Night/.
results.name: Boston Startup Pitch Night

results.description:
With approximately 200 members, the MetroWest Boston chapter of Mothers & More is one of the largest in the country. Our members come from towns all over MetroWest, including (but not limited to) Framingham, Natick, Ashland, Hopkinton, Southboro, Sudbury, Wayland, and Wellesley. Our children range in age from newborns to teenagers, and we have a good mix of members who are caring for children full time, working full-time for pay, and everywhere in between.

In addition to this large network of mothers, we offer a wide range of activities including monthly discussion meetings, moms’ nights out, children's activities, a book group, community service projects, playgroups, and much more. There is something for everyone!

About Mothers & More:
Mothers & More is a national non-profit organization dedicated to improving the lives of mothers through support, education and advocacy. We address mothers’ needs as individuals and members of society, and promote the value of all the work mothers do. Our mission is based on the following core beliefs:

    A mother is more than any single role she plays at any given point in her lifetime. She is entitled to fully explore and develop her identity as she chooses: as a woman, a citizen, a parent or an employee.

    All the work mothers do – whether paid or unpaid - has social and economic value.

    All women deserve recognition and support for their right to choose if and how to combine parenting and paid employment.

    All mothers, all children and all families are unique. We respect the wisdom of each mother to decide how to care for her children, her family and herself.

    Mothers have the right to fulfill their caregiving responsibilities without incurring social and economic penalties.

    The transitions women make into and through motherhood are challenging and can be difficult.

    Together, mothers are powerful.

    Check out our local site for even more information and consider coming to our next scheduled meetup! http://www.metrowestmothersandmore.org
results.name: Mothers & More MetroWest Boston

As featured in Guide Magazine

How to update your Meetup privacy settings

Before joining you may wish to update the privacy settings on your Meetup account.

This is a private group. The group is set up so that content is not available to non-members   Depending on your personal privacy settings others may be able to see that you are a member of the group.

Here's how:

1.Hide the list of Meetup groups you belong to

Here's how

2. If desired, remove your last name from your Meetup account:

When logged into Meetup, Click "Account Settings" (upper left of screen)

Click "General" in the dropdown menu

Click the "edit" link by your name

Update and click submit

More detailed directions here

This is a private group.  You can review more detailed information about Meetup privacy here

Regardless of your privacy settings people in other Meetup groups you join can see all your photos.

Photo Policy

In the spirit of creating community, we encourage but do not require members to share a headshot (face) photo on your group profile. If you adjust your privacy settings as above this should not be a problem.

While we're a sex positive group, we do follow the Meetup.com Community Standards and Terms of Service, which forbids nude photos or images of 'unclothed persons' in member profiles. The guideline applies whether the image might be considered artistic or not. This means you must be wearing at least a speedo in all photos. Members with inappropriate photos risk being removed from the group without notice.

Male Healthy Touch Club
www.MaleHealthyTouchClub.com

Gay Massage Network
www.GayMassageNetwork.com

results.description:
Goddess Bless!

The Boston Goddess Circle is here to be a valuable resource for all members. 

The Circle honors the Goddess in the diverse ancient wisdom traditions of Native American, African, Wiccan, Hindu, Buddhist and other healing traditions. It is non-denominational but aligned to Light. 

The Circle recognizes that while the collective consciousness of humanity is at the current level and the resultant changes are occurring on Earth, aligning to the Goddess is essential for clarity, intuition, serenity, empowerment, protection, happiness, light, love, prosperity, renewal, healing, magic, purification, rejuvenation, hope, power and more.

The following are planned and proposed activities for the next few months, please let me know as soon as possible if you are interested in attending:

1. Sabbath Celebrations - Formal (structured) celebrations celebrating the Goddess in accordance with seasonal, moon and sun cycles. We gather in Brookline Village in an indoor sacred space of a big circle of branches and rose petals. The dimly lit sanctuary smells of lavender, myrrh and frankincense. We celebrate with candles, chant/song, prayer, self blessings, meditation, affirmations, a manifestation ritual, a toast and more. A Goddess Ritual Booklet is provided for you to keep. Limited to 20 members. Must RSVP and pay $15 for supplies and space fee.

* Imbolc Celebration - Sunday, February 1. See the Boston Goddess Meetup Homepage for details.

* Spring Equinox Celebration - Sunday, March 22

2. Living Wiccan Group - A free, small and informal monthly grouping of Boston Goddess Circle members who are interested in learning about Wicca through discussion, reading literature and perhaps performing basic rituals. Meet in Brookline area or near the T. Anticipated to start in February depending on interest.

3. New/Full Moon Celebrations - Informal bi-monthly celebrations coordinated by Boston Goddess Circle members. Join in the celebration! Limited to 10 members. Must RSVP and bring or contribute to supplies. A small space fee may apply. Anticipated to start in February depending on interest.

4. Goddess Social Circles - Meet occasionally with a few Boston Goddess Circle members for a scrumptious dinner or brunch. Suggest a restaurant or host a potluck!

Please let me know if you are interested in any of the activities and I'll connect you to the organizer! Or, suggest a program you wish to lead.

Blessed Be!
results.name: Boston Goddess Circle

results.description:
The Boston Japanese Films, Anime, & Social Group is dedicated to the sharing of and learning about Japanese culture, Japanese language, Japanese Films, and Japanese Anime. The Boston Japanese Films, Anime, & Social Group is open to the public and all are welcome! You must be 18 or older to join following the meetup.com guidelines. The organizers host a variety of Japanese culture appreciation events and we are always open to ideas from our members! Our organizers hold a weekly dinner meetup to provide new members and existing members alike to meet one another and socialize while enjoying a Japanese meal. Once a month an organizer will host a Movie Night for members to watch Japanese Films and Japanese Anime Movies. Once a month an organizer will host an Anime Night for members to watch a random selection  of Japanese Anime Series episodes. Periodically an organizer will host an Anime Series Night in which a group of members get together to watch all episodes of a full Anime series.  When a local theater is showing a Japanese Film or a Japanese Anime Movie an organizer will schedule a meetup so that the members can attend the film together as a group. A post discussion meetup is held at the close of the film at a nearby Japanese restaurant. Our members attend Japanese Anime conventions and Japanese concerts, and cosplay together as well!

 

If you are interested in Japanese culture, Japanese language, Japanese Films, and Japanese Anime and meeting like-minded people, this group is for you! Joining The Boston Japanese Films, Anime, & Cultural Group you will meet people that are just as enthusiastic as you about Japanese culture, Japanese language, Japanese Films, and Japanese Anime in a safe public setting. Our members are  friendly and welcoming! We hope to se you at the next event!

 

-The Leadership Team of The Boston Japanese Anime & Films Cultural Group
results.name: The Boston Japanese Anime & Films Social Group

results.description:
We are a group of Deaf, hard of hearing, and hearing people who meet every week to chat in ASL. This group is open to ANYONE with an interest in American Sign Language and Deaf culture, from beginning ASL students to those who are fluent. We especially encourage people to come to our group who want to HAVE FUN while socializing with all sorts of different people! This is not a study group! It's a great group for practicing having real conversations in ASL.

We welcome ANYONE with an interest in ASL and Deaf culture.

We are a bunch of people who love ASL and Deaf culture, and who want to get better and better at signing. Some of us want to become interpreters or are in interpreting programs. Others work with Deaf people or have Deaf family members. We have beginner ASL students, pros, and everything in between. Some of us are Deaf and just want to hang out with other fun Deaf, hard-of-hearing, or hearing people who sign. Essentially, we are a social group brought together because we love ASL and we want to have a place where we can socialize, get to know one another, and practice our ASL skills.

Boston ASL welcomes and celebrates diversity in our membership! We do not tolerate audism, racism, sexism, homophobia, or any other type of discriminatory behavior at our meetings.

Group rules:

1. Please treat all members with courtesy and respect--both online and in person.

2. Membership is at the discretion of the organizers, and you can be removed from the group at any time.

We hope to see you at a Meetup soon!

Erika and Sean

Note for absolute beginners: If you want to join our group and haven't taken any ASL classes, or learned the manual alphabet (ABC's), we recommend you take a class with a qualified Deaf ASL teacher. If you can't fit a class in your schedule, we recommend www.westwoodasl.com. This website provides introductory classes in ASL and is run by an excellent Deaf ASL teacher who is fully qualified. Fingerspelling lessons (ABC's) are FREE when you register on his website.
results.name: Boston ASL

results.description:
Breathwork clears and purifies your body on a cellular level from past traumas, blocks and damage, declutters your mind, opens your heart, strenghtens your physical and spiritual core, allows you to love yourself and to love others. Breathwork is conductive in healing physical and psychological issues, it's indispensable for permanent healing of anxiety, mood swings and depression.

Breathwork is an excellent adjunct to every holisitc and spiritual practice, and to therapy.

Breathwork brings about profound and lasting experience of connecting with your own self and with the Source. It takes you on the deep inner journey, beginning with your recent experiences -- to the realms of your higher Self ,  from your recent to your more distant past. Breathwork is a conduit that connects you with your essence and life purpose.

Ruach HaKodesh, prana, lifeforce. Every ancient spiritual tradition refers to the healing power of Breath in the highest spiritual terms. Power that heals, force that connects us to our authentic selves and to Creator, conduit, Divine Inspiration that enlivens and envigorates our existence, and gives it meaning.

Personally, I know no better way to enhance meditative states, to heighten spiritual experiences and to foster own advancement. Breathwork is essential tool for personal growth and transformation, self-healing, physical and psychological alignment with the higher levels of our soul. As such, breathwork is immensely potent in changing our lives.

Breahtwork is conductive in physical, emotional and psychological healing. It renews your body, supports your healthy intentions and life habits, and empowers your life resolutions. It leads you towards completion and fulfillment in your life.

Breathwork liberates you from internal and external dependencies, and sets you free.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

Rebirthing, Conscious breathwork, Connected breathwork, Energy breathwork all are  contemporary names for the ancient breathing technique  -- an amazing gift that humans used for self-healing, elevation, for achieving expanded states of consciousness and enlightement since times immemorial.
results.name: Breathwork

results.description:
http://www.meetup.com/AfricaTravel/ca...

Trip To Africa!
January 18 ~ February 5, 2015

DrumConnection is taking a TRIP TO AFRICA! Come join us and make your reservations soon. http://www.triptoafrica.org

WELCOME TO The Gambia!
Study djembe and dunun drumming in Africa with masters of the craft in a true cultural and musical immersion. DrumConnection of Boston, MA is hosting an unforgettable journey to the birthplace of the djembe. In this three week trip (1 and 2 week options available) you will study drum and dance, attend festivals and celebrations, learn about the country and its people, and discover the magic that is Africa. We will be based in The Gambia. We will be guests an African compound, where we will enjoy comfortable accommodations, exquisite African and European food, and the hospitality of the Gambian people.

See below for more detailed information.

About DrumConnection
DrumConnection, New England's premier hand drumming school, has served the rhythmic community for over 25 years. We offer excellent djembe and dunun instruction for everyone, from private and group classes to workshops and performances. We treasure our close ties to Guinea, West Africa, and honor the teachers who have shared their music and traditions with us. In association with Famoudou Konate, Mamady Keita, "Wadaba", Sayon Camara, Fode Konate, Nansady Keita, Bolokada Conde, we are pleased to bring you the rich musical heritage of Africa, the birthplace of the drum. Join us!

More information is at: http://www.triptoafrica.org

"Thank you Alan! This trip was the most exciting thing I've ever done in my life. I can't believe how life-changing it really was and I have you to thank for that. Everything was run so perfectly even though it was in Africa. The people there are amazing with so much love and giving both ways. I really can't thank you enough. I hope everybody has a chance to do what I did. I could've never done this on my own that's for sure. Thom, Boston
results.name: Africa Travel Group! Learn Drumming & Dance in Guinea!

results.description:
Love writing? Looking for an opportunity to creep inside your mind, find the little demon inside fast asleep at an old writing desk, and tickle him awake with a quill pen? Or perhaps you think electro shock therapy would work better? Perchance this is the meetup for you! Meet other local writers and let creativity bloom!

We meet every week, alternating a workshop meetup with a writing exercise meetup. All pieces for the workshop meetup will be uploaded under the Files section, so be sure to check them out and be ready to offer constructive criticism (and of course praise) for our writers.  If you are interested in posting something for an upcoming workshop meetup, please send me an email so we can let everyone know what they should be looking for to read.

We are always looking for fun ideas for the writing exercise meetup, so anyone is welcome to bring along ideas or post them on the message board!

For more information about both types of meetups, check out the "Pages" section.

results.description: Good Day, A group organizer for Artists + Artisans has stepped down and I've volunteered to take the reins. I'm a first-time Meetup Organizer, so we'll have to learn as we go. Number one, this group is for anyone who likes to make something out of anything, make something from nothing, make art from trash and turn trash to treasure. If your project is portable, then bring it. What projects could people possibly have? Sewing, painting, sketching, crocheting, knitting, pottery, paper making, carving, metal working, jewelry making and book binding just came to mind. With winter weather coming, wouldn't be cool to meet somewhere and work on our projects while it snows outside? The scheduled Meetups are still a go as planned, if you want to attend! . If you have ideas about what to do and where to go, please speak up. I'm looking into other venues, where we could possibly meet to work and our stuff would be safe from food crumbs and coffee stains. Public libraries have meeting rooms where we could talk above a whisper, right? In conclusion, I'm Melissa and the Coast Guard just transferred me to Boston a few months ago. I live in South End and love to walk, bike and take the T anywhere. I'll use a Zipcar when I have to. Currently, I'm dedicated to sewing quilt blocks from fabric scraps. I can knit, but need to practice more. I want to learn crochet, tatting, and how to make clothes. I love drawing, but am still stuck in the beginner stages. If you teach me to draw, I'll teach you to sew, deal? Ideas? See you there, Melissa
results.name: Artists + Artisans

Through the practical application of timeless wisdom, our approach encourages a better understanding of ourselves, and a great appreciation for others and the world we live in.

results.description:
For All Ages:

Learn swordsmanship, fencing, Kendo, German Longsword and many other styles of sword arts at Guard Up! Family Swordsmanship in Burlington, MA.

Sick of treadmills and aerobics? Burn calories, beat stress and have fun doing something active that is also intellectually stimulating (fencing is often referred to as "Physical Chess"). Weekly classes as well as monthly events open to the public. Birthday parties, corporate retreats and summer camps are also offered.

Most necessary equipment provided. Classes and events for adults, teen and kids ages 4+. Conveniently located next to the Burlington Mall.

Want to try a free lesson and see how you like it?  Visit www.guardup.com and fill out the Free Lesson Request.

For directions or more information, visit www.guardup.com or call (781) 270-4800.

 

For Adults without kids:  Most of our meetup events are aimed at families (ages 6 and up) and adults who enjoy a family environment.  If you are an adult and wish to attend an adult oriented event, please visit our website www.guardup.com for a free adult-only lesson.

 

For Parents:

Guard Up! Youth and Teen Adventure Programs have curriculum and methods based on 3 important questions:   Why, How and What

WHY

Our goal is to help children and teens:

1)   Become well rounded and well balanced individuals

2)   Embrace learning as an exciting and lifelong endeavor

3)   Become self confident, responsible, and optimistic through creative play

 

HOW

We accomplish this by:

1)   “Unplugging” kids from the computer and motivating them to exercise and make friends in person

2)   Educating children in a manner that is exciting and imaginative… where exploration and possibilities are endless

3)   Providing an environment where a teen’s actions have consequences and where their decisions can make a difference

 

WHAT

We inspire your child by providing the following:

1)   A dynamic game filled with physical interaction and constant scenarios that require teamwork, communication and compromise

2)   Characters and creatures from real world mythology, literature and history which encourage kids to learn more in order to succeed at their quest

3)   An ongoing, interactive storyline in which children’s decisions change the direction and outcome of the story

We’ll talk about how to: - Build equity in your home - Save money on a mortgage - Assess the value of a property (singles, multis, and condos) - Successfully navigate your way through the buying process - Understand the local real estate market We provide comprehensive, detailed, market-specific information (including case studies and examples, where relevant) along with extensive resources for further learning. The club is centrally located in the heart of the White Mountain Valley in Glen, NH where there are countless number of ways to enjoy the outdoors year-round. Joining this meetup will allow you to learn more about event filled weekends at the club, along with various activities planned in the Boston area. Club membership information is also available by contacting Gina. Membership to the club is 21+. Many members live in the surrounding Boston area and gather throughout the year for various activities all over New England. Whether you are interested in heading north for Ski & other outdoor activities or getting out in the Boston area for some live music events, sporting events, local boat cruises, and so much more, we invite you to join this meetup to learn more. We hope to meet you soon!

results.description:
Hello Everyone...

I'm changing the name because I'm changing the focus. Through my own experience in singledom that past few years I've learned that both hosting and attending singles events can be an exercise in frustration and disappointment.

I have since learned what I've known all along. the best way to meet someone and develop a healthy relationship is to get to know them the old fashioned way. You hang out with them for a little while, become friends and take it from there. So without drabbing on about the perils of dating in the new millennium, I just wanted to let you know that I am changing the focus of the group to mimic what I have been doing on the South Shore for a few years.

You see the new name above. The focus will be on hosting varied events in the Boston Metro area and beyond, with the sole purpose of having fun and making friends. You don't have to be single to be a member of the group but most of us will be and if romance happens then it's a bonus !

But let me be clear, this is not a dating site and I ask everyone to please be respectful and polite of the other members.

I am always looking for help hosting events and Ideas so please don't be shy. This is just as much your group as it is mine. So let's have some fun.
results.name: Boston Metro Hike Bike & Social Club

Joining the group is free! Sending emails to others and receiving emails from other members is also free. When emailing others please use common sense about revealing personal information. We do not screen members in any way. We feel that meeting other members at a social function is one of the safest and best ways to communicate and form a connection. We look forward to seeing you at our events.

(If you discover that a member is married OR if you have problems with any member, please let us know ASAP.)

People can not use this site for commercial purposes!

Stan and Barry

results.description:
Purpose?  A joint effort to learn, discuss and tackle the fundamental problems and theorems of Theoretical Computer Science, including Program Synthesis, Theory of Computation (Turing 1937), Recursion Theory (Kleene), Incompleteness in Logic (Godel 1931, Rosser 1936), Paradoxes (Liar and Russell's) and any other problem related to the topics discussed on Googe Groups sci.logic

If Godel, Turing and paradoxes (and even Rosser and Smullyan) turn you on, if you spend time reading about, thinking about, and even developing answers to the important unsolved problems of Theoretical Computer Science, then please join us to show that two or more heads ARE better than one (in humans even if not in Turing Machines.)

Interested in applying formal methods - Mathematics - to problems at work or at play?  Bring them along and we'll all have fun being the first to solve your puzzles for you.

Five new members this week - we're now the biggest Computer Science Meet-Up on earth - tied with Wolfram!  http://computer-science.meetup.com/all/

results.description:
The Brettl-Hupfers Ski Club is a not for profit organization that has been run by its members since being founded in 1956. Our members are mainly single professional adults in our 20's and 30's from the greater Boston area who love winter sports, the outdoors and especially having fun. We are always interested in meeting new people.

We are part of the Eastern Interclub Ski League with over 1000 members throughout the Mount Washington Valley. We participate in skiing and snowboarding in the winter, hiking in the White Mountains in the spring and fall and we organize a summer tubing trip on the Saco River every summer.

The Brettl-Hupfers maintain a lodge that sleeps over 50 people in Bartlett, NH within minutes of several ski areas. We also organize events throughout the winter and during the rest of the year with our members, guests and friends. This meetup group is a way to stay in touch and participate in the events we’ll organize throughout the season. If you’re over 21, come on up as a guest to one of our events.

*Members of the meetup are not necessarily members of the Brettl-Hupfers.  Please email any of the organizers to find out about club membership.*

results.description: You like to sing, and you wish could do it more. You want to sing, and want a supportive environment to give it a try. You’ve always wanted to try karaoke. That wedding, party, business event, or trip to Asia is coming up and you need to get up there and sing one. But you say, “My voice stinks! I can’t sing! I can’t get up in front of a group and do that!” In Nigeria they say, “If you can talk, you can sing.” Karaoke is not about being Sinatra, Streisand, Springsteen, or Stefani. Karaoke is about letting go and enjoying expressing yourself. Karaoke-Do™ (“‘empty orchestra’-Way”) is a path to enlightenment and growth, with no complicated body positions. Join Founding Grand Master Shihan Scott A. for the practice and insight (inspired by Carolyn Sloan's "Finding Your Voice") that will get you to take the mike. We aspire to the values of metta (fellowship) and mudita (joy in another's success). Have fun as you: • Learn to use your breath the right way. • Find, exercise, and use your voice. Yes, even yours. • Pick a song to sing. • Become one with the music and the applause! The only pre-requisite is a desire to sing. Every session is the “first session”. We meet in a private karaoke room, so your first performances are in front of a small, like-minded group. About Founding Grand Master Shihan Scott A.: • Master of Education from Harvard (and he has the ring to prove it.) • Sang 8 years with a prominent Boston chorus. • Appeared with the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra under Zubin Mehta. • Sang with opera legends Robert Merrill and Jan Peerce, and rock pianist Jef Labes ("Moondance"). • Spiritual leader. • Ordained Minister, Church of Spiritual Humanism. • Student of karate-do, tai chi chu’an, and Kabbalah. • Karaoke devotee since 1993. • Has sung karaoke from California to Kuala Lumpur (traveling east). • Taught computer consciousness as a software trainer. • Non-judgmental, supportive, encouraging. To pre-register, or if you have questions, contact Founding Grand Master Shihan Scott A. at Step1Ventures@GMail.com. Sessions can be arranged for private groups and corporate events. Looking forward to seeing and hearing you! Karaoke-Do: Personal Growth through Public Exposure™ is a trademark of Step 1 Ventures.
results.name: Karaoke-Do: Personal Growth through Public Exposure™

results.description:
SWIMMING AGAINST THE STREAM: THE BOSTON VOLUNTEERS

 

They said it was impossible. They said it couldn't be done. Create a way to organize and empowers thousands of caring people to help fellow Bostonians in need? And do it in a no-hassle, no commitment way where folks can easily choose where and how they want to help?

 

When we started the Boston Volunteers, we bucked all the trends. No mandatory training sessions for new people. No large corporate structures or high costs. Simply a bunch of good-natured and hard working people wanting to make our little corner of the world a better place. Why?

Because we believe in better.

 

With nothing more than word-of-mouth reputation, Meetup.com as a springboard, and a knack for gathering some of the coolest people around, the Boston Volunteers have experienced exponential and geometric growth. Who would have imagined that in three years we'd have more than forty seven hundred good-hearted Boston Volunteers standing up and fighting for better? Not us, for sure! 

While we are so incredibly grateful for all the volunteers who are already part of our community, there are still countless people in our neighbourhood who find themselves in need. That's why we need you. All you need is a caring heart and a willingness to share a little bit of your valuable time.

 

Join us and spend an evening in a Boston soup kitchen; help tutor a single, local mom so she can earn her GED; rebuild your neighborhood playground so kids can play safely; kayak and clean the Charles to better our environment; build a home for a local family; spend time with the elderly. The variety is endless and refreshing. You choose where and when. There will be a convenient volunteer celebration for you. Don't miss this easy opportunity to build community.

 

While the Boston Volunteers have a well-earned reputation for having hard working and dependable folks, we're also known to have a pretty good time doing so. Beyound having fun while helping others, we also celebrate a variety of social events in your neighbourhood where we simply spend a little time relaxing and getting to know each other.

 

Volunteer enough and you will make some meaningful and lasting friendships with some truly great people. I've build a growing and meaningful community. We often see each other at community volunteer events and frequently go to museums together. Please know that since day one, we have been an open and inclusive nonprofit community, where every volunteer- regardless of superficial differences is valued, respected and needed. Not only can you choose where and when you would like to volunteer, but also you are encouraged to bring new ideas and new volunteer opportunities to our attention. And if you have a passion and there's a need, we'll get you set up to lead your own volunteer event. We revere the can-do spirit. 

Can you think of how we can better help people? Please share.
We are determinedly pursuing perfection.

 

Are you ready to partner with a community our like-minded folks as we help our neighbors in need? Set-out to make our city a better place for us all?
Learn more about our popular nonprofit, take a peek at upcoming celebrations, sign up when there's a space, and start making a difference! If you ever have questions, feel free to email any of the assistant organizers. We are here for you.

Welcome to THE BOSTON VOLUNTEER FAMILY! We anticipate volunteering with you!
Josh
Entrepreneur of The Boston Volunteers

Learn more about the Boston Volunteers: www.BostonVolunteer.org

P.S. Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers: http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers

 

The Boston Volunteers
Big enough to deliver, small enough to care
Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org
results.name: Boston Volunteers

results.description:
We seek to reduce procrastination and/or clutter to a maintainable level that no longer impedes us.

We meet to help each other overcome procrastination and cluttering. We encourage use of a buddy system where we mostly work with each other one-on-one. Buddies connect by phone or email, and sometimes in person. Buddies can help us stay on track and help us make necessary changes in behaviors that we see are not in our best interests.

We'll help pairs of buddies get started with a few simple guidelines, and our meetings will provide a way to meet new buddies, discuss techniques and resources, exchange success and failure stories, and have a few laughs at what we are finding out about ourselves and each other.

Meetings will mostly take place in Marlborough MA.

Please note, I'll also be advertising events for the group I run that helps people who have problems with hoarding. Just in case there are some people in this group that might want a little more intense support in the "stuff" category. But overall, MWPC is NOT JUST for people who might struggle with hoarding behaviors.

results.description:
Meet others interested in all aspects of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Gather to discuss Development, Standards, Networks, Marketing, Promotion and Business opportunities using AWS. Open to anyone interested in learning more about Amazon Web Services!

And now for some details...

Upcoming Scheduled Meetups: In general we meet on once a month, from 6:30-9pm, with 6:30-7pm for networking and food.

Attendance: We usually have in attendance approx. 30-60+ depending on location and topic - and we normally hold these Meetups in the Boston area - however, we are branching out to other areas/facilities. Our attendees are generally in the middle ground between novice and expert, with many in the dev/ops space.

Presentations: If you wish to present, contact the moderator at awsmeetup@extrmereach.com. Suggest a topic and an upcoming meeting(s) you would be available to present, then provide an abstract of the presentation (title and descriptive info) and a bit about the presenter (brief bio, just a few words). We generally have 2-3 presentations/presenters per Meetup without repetition from recent past meetups - there is flexibility here. Also, our attendees are looking for technical depth and NOT a sales pitch - so please keep this in mind when proposing and creating your presentation. It’s important that speakers speak loud and clear, in the event a PA system is not available. Also, when questions are asked, the presenter should repeat the question so that all can hear and understand the context of the answer.

Presentation - Slides: Usually there are requests for slides after a presentation. Your best bet is to post a link to slides as a comment to the applicable Meetup page. Any comments go to the entire group.

Sponsorship: A sponsor has their logo posted on our Meetup site with promotional statements, and is provided time during the Meetup to address attendees. Please see this link for examples: http://www.meetup.com/The-Boston-Amazon-Web-Services- Meetup-Group/sponsors/

Sponsorship - Food/Drink: We really appreciate our food sponsors and provide them extra time in self-promotion. Food and drink selection is up to the sponsor. Usually a mixed assortment of pizza and salad works well - but this is up to the sponsor. Pretty simple fare for this crowd - and usually no alcohol (but optional if the venue allows). Food is consumed as people arrive and mingle, and we usually get started with the presentations by 7pm.

Sponsorship - Location: We are open to a variety of locations. Minimum requirements include a facility that can host approx. 60 attendees, with projector and screen available. The only time we have needed amplification is when the meeting area has significant background noise (like certain climate control systems, or open environments where sound does not carry well). The facility should support groups who allow food and drink on premise. Please specify if alcohol is Not permitted, and/or if there are drinks/snacks or benefits that the facility supplies beyond the space hosting. Usually, attendance requires RSVP for security check-in (if required). The host location should post signage to make it very clear where attendees need to go for the meetup. Please supply any special instructions with regard to directions, parking, security check-in, etc. - these will be posted on the Meetup site.

Sponsorship - Other Items: There are other forms of sponsorship available, including supplying swag, offering door prizes for info cards being filled out, and covering the Meetup site hosting fees. Please reach out to the moderator for further details and arrangements.

Promotion of Other Events: We receive many requests to post outside events, functions, positions, and other items to the Meetup group. Members have provided direct feedback that they do Not want any sales presentations or unrelated solicitations. So, we keep it simple, stay focused on the purpose of this Meetup, and provide opportunities for companies to sponsor or present, and make announcements during the Meetup. In addition, comments can be posted to any of the scheduled Meetup pages on the Meetup site. These comments go out to the entire membership.

Attendee List: We are often asked about providing presenters and sponsors the attendee list. Unfortunately, most Meetup registrants use nicknames, and emails are not supplied to presenters/sponsors. However, presenters/sponsors can post to the Meetup site, commenting on the particular meeting page, which goes out to the entire group. In the comments you can indicate positive follow-up comments, offer slides, and drive response to another web link where more info can be gathered from attendees.

Reaching Mark Annati, the group moderator: Emails to Mark should contain the word ‘meetup’. Contact: Mark Annati, VP of IT, Extreme Reach, Inc., awsmeetup@extremereach.com
results.name: The Boston Amazon Web Services Meetup Group

results.description:
Greetings and welcome!

This is different from your typical networking event where people walk around with a fist full of cards handing them out. It's more of a "networking laboratory."

It is organized and hosted Diane Darling. I am an author, entrepreneur, blogger, columnist, speaker, and more.

It's called "Drinks Above Tiffanys" because we started meeting at a restaurant literally above Tiffanys. We now meet at a variety of restauants. If you know of place that is interested in hosting us, please let me know - Diane@EffectiveNetworking.com.

The spirit behind this group is for low-key, casual networking. Each month I share a few networking tips and we do an exercise where you introduce someone you've recently met.

Why introduce someone you've met vs. yourself? GREAT question!

You are just one person - you can only be in one place at a time. If you have "ambassadors" who can be your eyes and ears, then there are many others who can help you.

It's pretty low-key so if you want to add something to the introduction yourself, that's fine too. It's a great way to learn what people hear you say ... or interpret what you say.

We gather ~ 6:00 pm and have casual networking. Then we have a networking exercise. More details are available in the description.

I look forward to seeing you and enjoy!

Cheers ~ Diane Darling
results.name: Drinks Above Tiffanys

results.description:
Are you a parent looking...

      For ways to teach your child a strong sense of Asian heritage?

      To connect with other Boston area families with similar interest?

      For more opportunities to expose you child to different Asian cultures?

      To attend story time and play dates held in English and different Asian languages?
      (i.e. Chinese Mandarin/Cantonese, Korean, and others)

If you are, we'd love for you to join our group!


Asian-American Families of Greater Boston is an online community of Boston area families committed to giving our children a strong sense of Asian heritage, while having lots of fun doing it! We have several play dates and activities scheduled throughout each month. Our group IS NOT FOR PROFIT and is truly made up of community members such as you, who are simply looking for ways to connect with other families with similar interest. All events are hosted by volunteer members either in their private homes and/or public spaces such as parks, playgrounds, and more. All members are encouraged to take turns hosting, otherwise we would not have any events.

Members take turn hosting:

      - Monthly family meal get-together.

      - Story time and play dates.

      - Outings to zoos, parks, museums, festivals and more!

Our biggest event each month is the Family Meal get-together. It's when our members' get-together for a big pot-luck lunch play date! Family meals are great meet-and-greet events, especially for new members. You know what they say, "Come as strangers, leave as friends!"

If this sounds like something you and your family can benefit from,
please check us out online and join us!
We are open to all families with an interest in Asian culture!

 


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For more info, check out our Frequently Asked Questions page.

For security reasons all our members information and event locations are private and shown to members only. When signing up for an account profile, please include a self portrait, picture of your child, or you and your child. Keep in mind you do have the ability to have a different profile picture and information to be use only for THIS Meetup group. It will be shown separately from your MAIN Meetup profile and accessible only by members of this group for added privacy.

Many events are held in volunteered private homes/spaces. Having a self photo on file is part of our safety measure. This lets our event host recognize valid attendees before allowing them in.
results.name: Asian-American Families of Greater Boston

results.description: Welcome to the hottest Boston Meet Up Group! My name is Inna Dancarina and I am the founder Moves & Vibes Dance and Entertainment Company. Together with Lee El gringuito, founder of BachataMeetUp.com the World's largest Bachata Meet Up Group we bring you this exciting meetup! results.description:
Fear and anxiety are in the way of doing many things in our life and it isn’t a pleasant experience for anyone. Join us through series of ongoing events and workshops to learn pioneering systems and self-help tools based on Energy Psychology and Energy Medicine that have consistently led many all over the world to true recovery, from fear, anxiety and trauma, not just coping for the rest of one's life. And do it in a way that is fast, safe and lasting, by following universal principles and understanding structures of our bodies and the fact that we live in a state of energetic displacement and misalignment.

Plato and most non-western traditions viewed anxiety and trauma not merely as something being “wrong” with a person, or an illness, but as a loss of balance between the psyche and body (soma), hence the origin of the term psychosomatic symptom.

You may find what is going on with you particularly scary because no one can explain your symptoms, and you feel a loss of control. But, from energy psychology, we learn that the disconnection of the psyche and the body happens in a particular order, according to certain rules and structures, which leads directly to the symptoms you experience.

But it's not your fault that energetic misalignment is holding you back. There is nothing "wrong" with you or how you feel. Your fears are not irrational. Your symptoms are not un-explainable. When you reintegrate back as you heal your trauma, you become whole and you will find that all the symptoms disappear along with the anxiety and fears.
(to learn more about structures and symptoms listen to a FREE interview with Victor Vinkus on http://www.healingwithouteffort.com)

We deserve to be comfortable in our body and with things around us. This meetup could be an invaluable support tool for all the work that you are doing in your life or other systems and tools you are already using.

Learn the most effective self-help techniques for clearing worried mind, stopping persistent thoughts and most importantly, being comfortable in the body. It will work in cases of acute and chronic trauma, but it is an amazing tool in everyday life. Many unexplainable symptoms and pains that we have is a result particular displacement and misalignment of your energy as a result of trauma and stress.

This meetup is for individuals who want to learn how to heal themselves (and others) from a wide range of emotional trauma that may hold you back in your life – fears, anxiety, depression, panic disorders, and fears/phobias. (All types of emotional trauma will be covered depending on the needs of the group, including childhood emotional trauma, PTSD, abuse, rape, alcoholism and drug abuse)

This meetup is not about just coping with these conditions, but about reversing them, even when other methods have failed.

( Also please see the About page for more info)

Do you dream, do you hope to be free one day from the grips of fears, panic, anxiety, depression, PTSD or any other emotional trauma? You've invested so much time and energy in getting to where you are now but, so often like the end of a rainbow, it moves away from you the closer you get to it.

All that is about to change though!

Come and join this group if you are looking for a friend
who is on your side,
who can meet you exactly where you are,
who can go with you to where you want to go,
who can offer some helpful advice and explanations
who knows that your stories are not baseless, and knows it better then you could ever imagine.

Let us make this meetup 'the light at the end of the tunnel'! One last door that needs to be opened before you can step into a place of wholeness and freedom from all that holds you back. Come and join in us to heal together.

We do not support strict dogma or belief systems. All the exercises are experiential and based on principles that are universally grounded in a wide range of spiritual traditions. An effective system has to make sense and produce tangible results.


Yuliya Cohen is an internationally known expert in the area of anxiety and trauma. Over the last 25 years, she have developed a pioneering system presented at the International Energy Psychology conference in USA and Canada. She has enabled thousands of people to heal from most severe fears, anxiety and trauma in a way that is safe, lasting and with a sense of ease using her groundbreaking method for correcting energetic displacement. Formerly a computer scientist and an engineer, she is the founder of the Energy Restructuring Institute where she carries out research in the emerging fields of Energy Medicine and Energy Psychology.

She is an author of a book "Energetic Boundaries: The New Paradigm in Effortless Healing"
and an upcoming paradigm shifting book "The Four Gateways to Recovery - The Forgotten Path of Returning to Wholeness from Anxiety, Panic and PTSD"
More info about Yuliya is at www.healingwithouteffort.com

The New Boston Tea Party of 2009 and Tea Parties all across America will reinvigorate that American and Patriotic spirit; one that demands respect for individual rights and property. As the bailouts spiral out of control, we are forced to fund failed banks. With foreclosures on the rise, we are made the collateral of reckless spending. And, when the bills come due, the IRS knocks on the door of “self-responsibility”. ENOUGH! America is the land of opportunity. To succeed AND to Fail. Without consequences, what is our incentive to learn? What is our incentive to produce? Meet others who are interested in the Enneagram and other personality systems like the Myers-Briggs and Astrology. Herb Pearce, who is an expert on the Enneagram, offers beginning and advanced workshops on the Enneagram, Myers-Briggs, Personal Thinking Patterns and Astrology. Herb also leads Eckhart Tolle spiritual evenings, The Law of Attraction, Relationship Communication workshops, bird/plant walks and many other workshops. See his Singles events also posted on www.meetup.com/The-Arlington-Singles-Events

The star-shaped Enneagram (Greek for "nine" and "drawing") groups human emotions and behavior— positive and negative – into nine personality types. According to the Enneagram theory, personality develops as a result of genetics, cultural influence, family and childhood experience, and spiritual growth inclination. The Enneagram is an amazing tool to understand personality differences, to increase self-understanding and communicate to the world of each personality type and many unique subtypes. It's an excellent system to develop all the 9 types in yourself and to help you grow psychologically and spiritually. "Nothing I know helps improve relationships more and helps in getting unstuck from the limits of your ego and personality."

Herb Pearce, 77 Tanager St. #2, Arlington, MA 02476, 781 648 3737, herb@herbpearce.com, www.herbpearce.com, Author of The Idiot's Guide to the Power of the Enneagram and also Herb's Tips for Living at www.herbstipsforliving.com.

"The self-image is the key to human personality and human behavior.  Change the self-image and you change the personality and the behavior."    -  Maxwell Maltz

 

People recommend hypnosis as the quickest and fastest way to create change.

Hypnosis is a powerful tool that reprograms your subconscious mind with positive suggestions and beliefs that can move you easily toward your goals. Once these beliefs have been changed or revised, new behaviors begin to appear. Everything you have in your life is the result of your subconscious patterns of behavior. If you want to change your life, change the patterns!

These unique healing seminars generally meet in Hingham, MA and begin with a discussion group. We then move into a group hypnosis session.


Many topics are covered, including : 

- habit control: weight management, cluttering issues, procrastination    

- metaphysical hypnosis:  Past Life Regression (this ongoing seminar is held once a month)  

- life improvement:  stress management, memory improvement, sports enhancement

Kathryn, certified through the National Guild of Hypnotists, has been in private practice since 1996. She also works in the corporate sector, delivering hypnosis seminars for large area health insurers.

 

Please note: These are paid events and space limits the group to 15 attendees. In order to secure a slot, you must pay in advance. You can pay securely through PayPal by visiting Kathryn's webpage : http://www.hypnosis.ws or through Meetup.com. Your check or cash are also welcome.
