results.description:
We DARE to DO what others only DREAM about!

 

Please note: Our organizer has moved out of state, but she will continue to create a few big events a year! And local Event Organizers will create smaller events throughout the year. :) Membership requests are still being handled regularly.

 

Stay tuned, and keep the requests coming!

 

Follow us on Twitter! https://twitter.com/#!/LipstickLesSoc

Follow our blog! http://lipsticklesbiansociety.blog.com/

Follow us on Facebook! http://www.facebook.com/groups/143144919033508/

 

We are a small, selective group of very attractive, feminine, sexually progressive, queer/bisexual/bi-curious/lesbian women/womyn in their twenties and early thirties who enjoy meeting other women with similar qualities. We enjoy our beauty, wearing make up, dresses, and heels, gettin' girly in general, and most importantly, being proud femmes! Obviously, however, that is not all we do - nor does it describe us entirely. Please read the end of this description for important political context.

We are currently based in Boston, Massachusetts, but are working on developing chapters across the US and internationally!


Membership Requirements

1) You should be in your 20's/early 30's

2) Your profile should contain at least two *recent* photos which show both your face and body clearly (put your best foot forward, ladies!). Your photos should show that you are real and qualified to be in the group. Photos that obscure your face or body (pictures with sunglasses, cut-off pictures, digitally touched up pictures, or shots where you are in the distance) are not useful for evaluating your profile.

3) The answers in your request for membership should show a genuine and specific interest in our group.

4) You should understand, or commit to understanding, the trappings of heterosexual presentation, and work on figuring out what it means for you.

5) You must be ready to embrace yourself, however you are, and have FUN! Because we WILL do both!


Our Story: On Exclusivity, and How We Came To Be

Sometimes we have mixed feelings about running a group with a somewhat superficial agenda.

We created the group with a hope to provide the sort of platform we felt was always missing in our lives: one where pretty girls who like other pretty girls can meet -- and not be judged for it.

It sounds horrific, in a way, and goes against everything that many of us normally stand for: total inclusivity and love for everyone. (And, truth be told, I, the founder, have been accused of being "polymorphously attracted," as one friend put it -- meaning, I like many different shapes and sizes of people.)

For a few years, I studied feminism and queer theory very carefully, trying to figure out where my story fits, and in the process, I felt forced to identify with only the established categories (read: stereotypes) of women who like women. At some point, however -- and thankfully so -- I realized that none of them truly spoke to me — although many of them spoke to parts of me.

It took longer still for me to truly embrace my own vision of which women I like -- and to be okay with it. But, after many years of struggling with the dissonance between the established reality and my own reality, and once I had finally embraced my feminine self, I decided to form this group. Read More....

No one should feel restricted in finding fulfillment because they fear judgment from their community.

I'd like to thank all of you for the tremendous and continued support in fulfilling our dreams. We look forward to making more dreams come true and filling more hearts with happiness!

We welcome:

  • single women
  • married women
  • women with boyfriends
  • women with girlfriends
  • women with one of each
  • women with multiples of either

 

*** If your request is rejected or is taking a long time to be approved, it is most likely becauseeither:

  • your profile does not meet one of the requirements, OR
  • we are not looking to increase the size of our membership at the moment

We review membership roughly once a month, but approvals may be slower some months than others due to overall volume. Please note that we are not a general-interest lesbian/bisexual/queer group. For more resources, please check out 'Other nearby Meetup Groups' in the navigation bar on the left.


Copyright notice and warning

Any institutions or individuals using this site, group name, or any of its associated sites for studies or projects: this profile is the copyright of its author. Permission is not granted to use any of this profile or images in whole or in part, in any form, extracted or not, for any purpose or forum whatsoever, either now or in the future. If you have or do, it will be considered a violation of privacy and copyright, and is subject to legal ramifications.

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Political Context

Although the terms 'lesbian' and 'bi' are hardly descriptive enough of the kinds of people we want this group to encompass (a great number of people in our group are not confined to a binary sexuality paradigm),** they are the popularly known terms which we hope will at least catch the eyes of those who kinda-sorta-maybe identify in this way!

Some of us are politically radical, but embrace our feminine presentation nonetheless - and realize that it is just that: presentation. It could change today or tomorrow. (And that's why we love it.) Others of us are more moderate, a-okay with being feminine, and have no qualms about it!!

We hope to create support, community, and a social outlet for all us poor LL's and femme girls starved for attractive, girly female company. :)

** A note on this group being for 'very femme' girls: Our presentation as very feminine may or may not be our permanent style. We realize the trappings of heterosexism that sometimes force women into 'femmehood.' There will be members of this group who don't give a hoot about social theory on this topic, and that is their right. Other members will be aware of the implications and history of their gender presentation, but nonetheless (or in spite of it) will be happy to embrace their presentation as femmes. There will also be a range of members in between, and outside of, those two opinions. It should all make for interesting debate and discussion. We ask that you respect our right to associate, whatever your beliefs.

** A further note on the use of the words 'lesbian' and 'bisexual:' Some of us, for example, aren't crazy about the gender binary created by the two poles of 'lesbian' and 'straight,' with the only in-between or both-encompassing category being 'bi.' We question gender as a concept, and see it as a social construct. This only begins to scratch the surface of why the words 'lesbian' or 'bi' may be insufficient descriptors for some (though not all!) of us, but we are simply using these popular terms for the sake of easy recognition by those seeking this type of community.
results.name: Lipstick Lesbian Society (TM) of Boston

results.description:
Welcome to Inquisitive Minds. We are a multi-faceted group of people with diverse interests. We are always willing to explore ideas and learn something new, always open to sharing different points of view, participating in fun events, and making new friends. Our goal will be to get together regularly, to have meaningful and intellectual conversations on various topics, to learn something new together and to take part in fun activities and events.


Is Inquisitive Minds for me?
Do you like discussing interesting topics in depth? Do you enjoy fun and intellectually fulfilling activities? Do you enjoy trying new and diverse activities to satisfy your inquisitiveness? Do you like the company of diverse and friendly people? If you answered yes to any of these questions, this is the group for you!


Inquisitive Minds' Group Vision:
Foster strong friendship by bringing people together with diverse interests and perspectives and share some enjoyable time together through meaningful discussions and fun-filled activities.


Please email us your suggestions, comments and concerns at feedback@inquisitiveminds.org
results.name: Inquisitive Minds

results.description:
Meet fellow White Wine Enthusiasts near you! Come to a local Wine Meetup to taste new wines; learn about noses and legs; and discuss great vintages and estates. Everyone's welcome, from new bouquet-sniffers to educated connoisseurs.

I've also Organized http://www.meetup.com/Wine-HudsonMA. This group is mostly a red-wine group but a few people expressed interest in white wine tasting.

Through the meetup.com polling mechanism, members select wines via region or grape or any criteria.

Typically a group of 10-20 people meeting at a members house, once per month.

Here's a successful agenda example which can also be modified:
o Greeting wine
o Educational topic
o Taste about 5-7 wines with Appetizers supplied by guests or host
o Calculate the wine cost among those attending.
o Guess the Mystery wine
o Socialize and discuss wine.

The question to be answered is ... Are enough people interested in starting a White Wine Tasting group in the MetroWest Boston area? Join the group, send me email and let me know.
results.name: The MetroWest White Wine Meetup Group

The possibilities are endless...

results.description: USAFit Boston is an award-winning marathon & half marathon training program for all ability levels. This 24 week program will help you prepare for a fall half or full marathon. There is a membership fee ($100 for the standard training program; $120 for the advanced training program), which includes Saturday morning workouts and coaching, weekly seminars, weekly training schedules, a t-shirt, online discussion boards, discounts at sports apparel stores, and great camaraderie. You can register either on our website, www.bostonfit.net, or via check/cash the morning of the season kickoff, May 2. If this is right for you, then we look forward to seeing you!

results.description:
Meet other serious business professionals from a variety of industries to discuss your Business and what type of referrals you are looking to garner from the group. Furthermore, you will educate the group on your expertise and they will do the same for you, so you build the confidence in one another to recommend your business to your personal and professional contacts.

Gold Star Club networkers develop long-lasting reciprocal relationships based on the basic principle of give and receive and the law of reciprocity.

The best lead referrals come from those that understand your business value proposition and have built a trusting, business relationship with you, so they know you will take care of their other precious business contacts.
You may find that the best time and the most profitable time of your day was at your Gold Star meeting.

A good referral is not a TIP. The difference between a "tip" and a "referral" is that the person giving the referral has spoken to the customer about you and the customer is expecting your call. We pass REFERRALS!

A good referral is when you give someone you care about to someone you know, like and trust.
A good referral paves the way and gives the business person third-party credibility. Your Gold Star Club can be a reliable source of referrals for you.
results.name: Gold Star Referral Clubs - Boston

results.description:
The Boston Business Opportunity Group is comprised of a group of visionaries providing a system to help individuals develop economic freedom. Our mission is to create 500 millionaires and to empower individuals to create generational wealth in their families. We believe that time is your most important asset, and the only way get your time back is to get money as an issue out of the way.

We are committed to providing a system and an environment to empower you to achieve all of your goals and dreams. There's nothing like being in an environment with other like minded individuals, who are simply sick and tired of our lives being dictated by how much linear income(trading time for money) we make. Wealthy people live their lifestyles because they generate Passive and Residual incomes.

If you want to know what others are doing in this area to create passive and residual income, come and join us. Find out how to help yourself as well as your loved ones. This group is open to people looking for an opportunity and also seasoned network marketers who want to work with me directly

We have representation in Boston, New York City, Providence RI, Westport CT, Los Angeles and Malibu CA, Austin TX, Miami FL, Cabo San Lucas and Mexico City DF MEX, Melbourne AUS, London and Manchester UK, Canada, Buenos Aires ARG, and Tel Aviv IS.

Remember, you won't become wealthy by just joining this group. You need to do something about your situation, and I will give you the vehicle to do that.

results.description:
We meet regularly to hike various trails in the Middlesex Fells Reservations and other local hiking areas, indoor rock climb, kayak on Spot Pond, snow shoe in the winter, and take part in random out door and social events.

The Fells is a bit of woods, with rocky uneven ground, surrounding several reservoirs that cross through Winchester, Medford, Melrose, Stoneham and Malden.  Click here for a printable hiking map of the Fells.

Hikes levels vary form beginner hikes - easy pace of 2 to 3 miles lasting 1.5 to 2 hours, to advanced hikes of 5+ miles at an aggressive workout pace that might go 2.5+ hours.  It's important to read hike descriptions so you understand what is expected of you on the hike.

[center]Note: Individuals who wish to sigh up this group with the intention of marketing products and/or services need not join. You are not welcome.[/center]
results.name: Hike the Middlesex Fells

results.description:
"You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation."

- Plato

 

WHO WE ARE

C&C (Boston Cards and Conversation) is a social networking community in Greater Boston. Founded in 2009, our goal is to get together to do different types of fun activities as a way to socialize and meet new people. We have an active membership that is amazingly diverse, composed of men and women of all ages.

 

 

WHAT WE DO

Most events allow members to mingle while playing card games, board games and party games.  However, we also play outdoor games and sports too -- like miniature golf, laser tag, pool, bocce, geocaching and more! No matter the event, our members benefit by making connections on a personal and professional level while doing fun activities.  Nothing like a game of Apples to Apples to get the conversation rolling!


WHERE WE MEET

We hold about a dozen events a month at locations in the Greater Boston area.  We try to make most of our events T-accessible. Some our most common locations are in Boston, Somerville, Medford and Waltham.  Outdoor or non-board game events are usually held north of the city.

 

 

 

WHAT MAKES US SPECIAL

Our members say that we provide some of the best events on Meetup.  Our events tend to be well organized into order to provide our members a unique experience.  Because of social networking focus, we require that all of our members participate in our community. Membership requires approval, and all members agree to follow our group membership policy before joining.


As of July 1, 2012 -- For security reasons, all new member applications must include a face photo of the member (no logos, designs or pictures of cats please!). Incomplete applications will not be accepted.

-
results.name: C&C (Boston Cards and Conversation)

Rowing and Paddling meet-up for women on Boston's North Shore.  Meet other women for rowing and paddling fun and fitness. Novice and experienced rowers and paddlers of all levels are welcome!

I’m sure there are lots of women like me who are revel in being on, in and around the water for all it’s fitness, health & wellness benefits.

Little Harbor Boathouse in Marblehead is North Shore Boston's premiere Community Rowing and Paddling Center. Our mission is to encourage, support and grow human powered water sports of all kinds for fun, fitness and competition. Rowing, Stand-up Paddle-boarding and kayaking programs and rentals. Year-round private small boat rack storage. Indoor small group rowing classes in the off-season.

With our spectacular location on a protected harbor with two beautiful islands including the Trustees of Reservations Brown's Island, Little Harbor Boathouse gives direct access to unlimited miles of rowing & paddling on Salem Sound. Come join us in-season for on-the-water programs and off-season for small indoor rowing classes and private small boat storage!

Contact: Maryellen@rowingforall.com | 781-990-3552 | rowingforall.com

Little Harbor Boathouse Community Rowing & Paddling ... cultivating fun, fitness and well-being for life!

results.description:
Digital 360 is a premium media channel for the most current updates, insights, research and events focused on "Technology | Life Science | mHealth"  

here was a time when science or healthcare could be broken down into neat-and-tidy disciplines — straightforward things like biology, chemistry, physics, and astronomy. 

But as technology advances, these fields are becoming increasingly specialized and interdisciplinary, leading to entirely new avenues of inquiry. 

The emerging fields of precision medicine, quantum and synthetic biology and recombinant Memetics, supports information as the currency of healthcare and life science.

Healthcare and life science professionals look to Digital 360 to stay current with the help of our career blogs, streaming updates on current trends and issues, forums and corporate sponsored events.

Registration is currently free for one year for professional members.

Members will have access to free content, plus the ability to purchase premium content including industry research reports and forecasts, webinars, podcasts and more.

Digital 360 develops sponsored content with industry leaders and promotes this content to our network of registered members who are from pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, diagnostics and clinical research and manufacturing sectors.

In addition to creating sponsored content, Digital 360 organizes events in keeping with our mhealth and life science focus.  Our events are ideal for industry professionals to learn network and grow in their careers and advance their business interests.
results.name: Digital 360

topics.name: Life Mastery - The power we posses to master life.

results.description:
“Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.”

― Joseph Campbell

This meetup is about everything that brings health, balance, joy and happiness into life. We help you see doors where you see only walls!

Our Holistic Lifestyle Club is a group of energetic women who are on their journey to a more fulfilling and abundant life.  We all have our dreams, small and big, and we all have some challenges, also small and big. But we are optimistic and persistent in following our own bliss. :)

We get together for interesting discussions and fun workshops. We believe in the power of the mind and holistic healing. We practice, teach and offer others Qi-Gong, yoga classes, Reiki, nutrition advice or deep breathing detox.

Our meetings evolve around body-brain-mind-spirit topics and usually end with a special healing tea time.
If you are a young lady who has many questions about life and is not sure where to start her journey, or a mid-age woman seeking her own authentic voice, or an older woman who is looking for a female group to support her late dreams, or to get into a better, healthier lifestyle, you are so welcome to our group!

Women are multi-tasking beings and like to see the details as well as the whole picture. They are programmed by Mother Nature to jump from one thing to another just to "taste"/ to sense if that method, tool or direction is right for them. If you want to try a little bit of everything to move forward while searching for who you are, this meetup is for you. It will offer you these opportunities and maybe much more.

I hope to see you soon in our group for learning and having good time!

Costs: To join the group is FREE, but if you have enjoyed at least two workshops during a year, please help to keep it going by making a $5.00 annual donation to  cover the costs associated with running the website and pay the Meetup fees of $144/year.

Attendance policy:

1. RSVP "YES" only when your intention to come is 100%.

2. Arrive on time and never "No Show." Members who don't show up deprive the members on the waiting list.

3. If you can't  attend for some reasons, change your RSVP and notify the organizer.

4. If you paid on-line in advance, refund is offered only if you cancel your attendance in 24 -hours.

Thanks.

~ Angela, The Club Organizer
results.name: Holistic Lifestyle  Women's Club

results.description:
I love food. Cooking it, eating it, talking about it, reading about it, watching shows about it. But it seems rare that people in their 20s actually want to try out new restaurants and cook/bake at home.

This is a group for those who want to explore all forms of food Boston has to offer (restaurants, specialty stores, etc.), cook and bake for others, and meet new people in their 20s-30s who want to do the same!

We can go on themed food tours (cupcakes, French fries, tacos, ice cream, etc.), attempt to try as many things as possible on a menu, have a chili competition, food festivals, factory tours (Ben & Jerry's and Cabot's, anyone?) and more.

Feel free to suggest a meetup! Check out the recipe or cooking advice section under the discussions section. Food is a phenomena that brings people together and through that venue we can broaden our horizons, meet new people and have fun. That's what it's all about.
results.name: Cooking and Eating in Our 20s - 30s

results.description:
Looking for a casual group of down to earth runners who enjoy hitting the trails just as much as pounding the pavement? Looking for a competitive group of runners who enjoy running races varying from 5K’s to full marathons? Then look no further than a running group that offers the best of both worlds, Waltham Trail Runners! Whether you’re seeking leisurely runs around the Boston area, or crave a more competitive speed or hill workout, Waltham Trail Runners doles out a little bit of everything!

Our weekly run takes place on Tuesday evenings at 6:30 pm where we meet up in front of the Skellig in Waltham. We run between 4 and 6 miles, and finish it all off with beers and munchies at the Skellig post-run. On the weekends, we schedule more trail running opportunities. We also enjoy coordinating group races, and participate in the Race Around Waltham Series (RAW Series)- http://rawseries.weebly.com/

Waltham Trail Runners welcomes runners of all abilities and aspirations. We hope you join us soon! With Waltham Trail Runners, let’s just put it this way, it’s always a wild trail ride!!!
results.name: Waltham Trail Runners

results.description:
Dance Days Boston - Arlington feature a one hour cardio dance workout at your level to help you enjoy life a bit more. Using Guinea and other African dance as well as HipHop and Jerk, Fanta will weave an hour of shear delight.

Dance Days are on Mondays  at 6PM at The DrumRoom, 50 Tufts Street, (Gibbs School), Arlington, MA 02474 Lost Call 617.686.6080 Easy to get to and easier to park!

Come join at whatever level of fitness you are at. Fanta is great at making it work for all. 4 - 84!

If you want to spend your lunchtime losing pounds, getting your heart in shape, lowering cholesterol WHILE learning some African dance steps as well as more modern street forms, this is for you.

$10 a session. Drop-ins okay. Just come! Wear loose fitting clothes, bring water. Plan on a really fun and rewarding time!
results.name: Dance Days Boston

results.description:
The Cambridge Book Club is based in Cambridge MA and is unique in alternating fiction and non-fiction reads. Reading selections are based on member suggestions and final member vote. We've been going strong for 6 years and we look forward to reading together and discussing the books we read in engaging ways! All readers, all ages are welcome!

As of May 2015 CBC has adopted the Literature and Libations (L&L) group / thread. Please read the discussion board to learn more about L&L and feel free to come to those meetings as well!
results.name: Cambridge Book Club

topics.name: Massachusetts South Shore Womens Motorcycle Club

results.description:
New England Thunder-Taking Womens Motorcycling by Storm.... Come join an awesome group of women who love discovering new places and can make riding for an ice cream an adventure. Build new friendships with women who love to motorcycle as much as you do. Now that you have found our meetup group...............you can also VISIT THE CLUB WEBSITE at www.newenglandthunder.com. There you will find lots more info.  Check out the pictures in our gallery showing the great rides we have done.

We are based out of Weymouth, Massachusetts. Our members come from the South Shore, North Shore, Boston, Worcester area and RI as well. We ride almost every weekend during the summer months and for as long as we can stand it in the cooler weather!

Come to a meeting to meet the women of New England Thunder or join us on a ride......we will provide you with all the necessary information about our rides, group riding, safety procedures that we follow and annual membership dues. There is an annual dues required in order to become a full member of New England Thunder.

We meet monthly on the second Wednesday of each month (except Dec and Jan) at the Peppercornz on Main restaurant in Weymouth. Social Hour is 530 -630 pm and the meeting begins at 630 Pm. During those meetings we socialize and plan our upcoming events and riding schedule.

Remember it is not just the ride or the destination but the company you keep and the new friends you make along the way.

So, if you’re ready for a truly THUNDEROUS adventure… come check us out. Our riders are posted on the meetup calendar but there are lots of pictures and more info on our club website at www.newenglandthunder.com.   Also feel free to contact us at info@newenglandthunder.com or through this meetup website.
results.name: New England Thunder / South Shore, MA

results.description:
This is the home of "Packers Boston", we meet on the 2nd floor for every regular season game, we have over 160 members and get great crowds each week, join the group and stop by to make new friends.

Go pack
results.name: The Boston Green Bay Packers Meetup Group

results.description: The First Spiritualist Church of Quincy is a regional Spiritualist Church serving the Greater Boston Metropolitan Area. Spiritualism is a religion of personal responsibility for the creation of our lives, combined with the belief that life continues after we shed our physical form and pass to the Higher Side. We welcome those that are exploring metaphysics, spirit communication, mediumship, and hands on healing. Our Services are Sundays at 11 AM (Sept-May) and Wednesday at 7:30 PM (June-August). More infomation maybe found on our website: www.quincyspiritualists.org
results.name: The First Spiritualist Church of Quincy

results.description:
I am a young mom of 4 who would love to meet other Jewish moms and dads.The goal of this group is to give each of us a chance to interact and socialize with other parents who have the same interests and goals. this program will incorporate,songs, art,dance,movement,play time,exercise,mommy yoga,baby massage,parenting tips, stories and various sensory stimulations, the goal of our program is to deepen our relationships with our babies and toddlers and simultaneously instill a love and pride for Torah and Mitzvot within our children’s hearts. A healthy snack is also included.
Commitment for the entire session is preferable, but you are welcome to attend according to the week if that is what your schedule allows.
We will meet each Monday afternoon at 1:30-3:00pm @ 83 Pine st unit #E . The Exact schedule will be posted soon. The first mommy and me will be September 14th.Looking forward to meeting you!
results.name: mommy and me with a Jewish twist

results.description:
Are you a young professional living or working in the Waltham area?

Then join us in taking advantage of all the fun places to meet on Moody St and beyond!

The meetups generally focus on places within Waltham, but we are always open to suggestions in the surrounding towns or for a day trip further away.

Ideas for meetups include Lizzy's Ice Cream; a Movie at Embassy Cinema; Coffee at the Commons; Drinks at The Skellig or Watch City; an event at Back Pages Books; Dinner at Solea, Elephant Walk, or Taqueria Mexico; going Bowling at Lanes & Games; or even taking a Day Trip to Rockport - You get the idea!

By the way, The Gaff on Moody Street is a group favorite. We are there for trivia at least once a month.

Meetups are always being planned, so after you join the group keep checking the Calendar. If you have an idea for a meetup please suggest it as a meet up. SPEAK YOUR MIND! We are ALWAYS welcoming to new ideas.

 Cheers!
The Organizers
results.name: Waltham Area Social Group

results.description: The purpose of this group is to provide an easy place to meet fellow rock climbers and also for people who are interested in learning how to rock climb. Anyone and everyone should join!
results.name: South Shore Rock Climbers

topics.name: Dance & Dancing Lessons: Salsa, Latin, Swing

results.description:
Do you LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Dancing With The Stars? ...well here's your chance to learn the same steps they do while you have a blast AND get in the best shape of your life!

We offer dance-fitness classes that include: the Rockstar Rumba, the Hottie Hustle, the Jumpin' Jive, the Sultry Salsa, the Diva Disco, the Cutie-Pie Quick Step, the Miami Mambo, the Crazy Cha-Cha, the Tasty Tango and the Spicy Samba!

Classes are structured like a traditional group fitness/aerobics class so NO PARTNER OR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED AND DROP-INS WELCOME!

Be prepared to lose weight AND have FUN!

Please check out all of our wonderful classes and social events on our website: http://amyfournier.com/calendar/

Please LIKE our page on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Amy-Fournier/339973018022

What are you waiting for?
Come make some new friends, feel like a star, get in shape and have fun!

See you soon

xo, Amy
results.name: Cardio Ballroom & Dance Fitness

results.description:
I have been picking tree mushrooms for the past 50 years. My parents would take us out for a family day searching the maple-treed back roads of New England for Oyster Mushrooms. Over the years I've expanded my search to Clustered Coral, Hen of the Woods and Chicken Mushrooms.

This Meetup group is for the mushroom lover that wants to expand their edible fungi repertoire, go out for a mushroom hunt or two, exchange photos of prized catches, and maybe cook up a tasty dish for a group gathering.

I would like learn how to grow mushrooms from spores so I wouldn't have to travel hundreds of miles, tracking down these hard to find morsels.

If any or all of this gets your mouth watering...join our group and lets start the mushroom rolling!
results.name: Mushroom Lovers USA

results.description:
This meetup is currently accepting new members!!

 

In this group you will be able to meet, network and socialize with women who have natural hair, are transitioning, and women who are THINKING about becoming natural. We will share hair ideas, product suggestions, maintaining natural hair and much more!

When joining the group please post a photo of yourself so that we can identify you at meet ups. This group is private which means only members that are logged in to the group can see your photo.

This group will only tolerate positivity and in the event of negativity you will be removed from the group.

 

*The meet up background can be purchased from http://www.etsy.com/shop/thepairabirds
results.name: Natural Hair Meet Up!

results.description:
We are a pretty casual group of ladies who find enjoyment in a good discussion, but as far as book clubs go, we typically do not send out questions in advance or have a concrete schedule as to how each meetup will play out.  Often times, our gatherings are split between talking about the book and talking about life in general.  We respect each others' opinions and encourage open and honest dialogue at our gatherings.

We have a wonderful group of regulars, but always welcome new members!  We do not discriminate against age, but for informational purposes the ladies in this group are generally in their 20's and 30's.  There are several meetups each month so that everyone has an opportunity to find a book and date that they like.  Please feel free to RSVP to any that you want to attend.

The Fine Print...

    Please update your profile picture with a clear photo of your face.  It will make it easier for me to identify people looking for our meetups in crowded places. 

    RSVPs close 24 hours prior to the scheduled event.  If you do not show up to an event, or change your RSVP to "No" on the day of the event, you will be marked as a no show.  Please be considerate as our organizers spend a lot of time preparing for each meetup.

    The annual membership dues are $2.50 a year. You will be asked to pay this after being part of the group for three months

    (If you do not feel comfortable paying online, just bring $2 to any of the Meetup events (with any leader) and we can add it to your account.

    After 3 months of site inactivity (not visiting our site), you will be removed from our member roster.  This does not limit you from joining again, it just keeps our numbers accurate for active members only.
results.name: Boston Page Turners Book Club

results.description:
This group was established for cyclists of all levels and disciplines (road and mountain). You'll see that we're pretty focused on road for the time being but perhaps enough interest will actually form a group to tackle some local trails!

Some folks get a little confused by the title "Grind & Grub" - not terribly creative I'm afraid. "Grind" because of the bikes. "Grub" because I like to think most people work best on the reward-system. You break a sweat, burn your quads a bit and then enjoy some food/drinks, and in the process become friends.

We will try to schedule our rides with a social element to follow. A 20 to 40 mile ride with a drink or two at a local pub - what could be better?

Nervous about your ability to keep up with the group? Look, we all come in different shapes and sizes and that goes for our bikes too. More often than not we'll have a 'sweeper' (someone who purposefully rides last to ensure that no one is left behind) on these rides. We also try to make route maps for everyone. But it's completely natural for the group to organically divide itself up depending on speed. Just know thyself and your own threshold :-)

We just ask that you come with a good attitude and an open-mind. And a helmet, a spare tube and and water.

Just use your good judgement !
results.name: The Foxboro Grind & Grub Group

results.description: You’ve always wanted to get up and sing in public. But you say, “My voice stinks! I can’t sing! I can’t get up in front of a group and do that!” In Nigeria they say, “If you can talk, you can sing.” Singing in public -- is not about being Sinatra, Streisand, Springsteen, or Stefani. -- is not about “going to Hollywood/Vegas/the next round” so that you can be exploited or disappointed. Singing in public is about letting go and enjoying expressing yourself. SingFree Sessions™ are a path to that growth that will push your envelope in a completely fun way. It is practice and insight on all levels (based on Carolyn Sloan's "Finding Your Voice") that encourage you to shatter the barriers to public self-presentation. We uphold the values of metta (fellowship) and mudita (joy in another's success). No contests! Have fun as you: • Learn to use your breath the right way. • Find, exercise, and use your voice. (Yes, even yours.) • Pick a song to sing. • Sing out and express yourself! There are no pre-requisites, except a desire to sing. Every session is the “first session”. About Scott: • Ed. M., Harvard Graduate School of Education. • Sang 8 years with a prominent Boston chorus, including performances with the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra. • Religious Leader, United Brothers Synagogue, Bristol, RI • Teacher of leaders of Jewish prayer • Ordained Minister, Church of Spiritual Humanism. • Student of karate-do, tai chi chu’an, and Kabbalah. • Taught hundreds of new technology users as a software trainer. • Non-judgmental, supportive, and encouraging instructor and coach. Join the group, and you'll easily find out about upcoming public SingFree Sessions. You can also arrange SingFree Sessions for private groups and corporate events. We look forward to seeing and hearing YOU! SingFree and SingFree Sessions are trademarks of Step 1 Ventures. All content ©2009 Step 1 Ventures
results.name: SingFree™ Sessions

topics.name: Czechs and Slovaks in Boston and NE Area

results.description: Czech and Slovak group.  For people that miss their homeland and want to stay in touch with the culture, food, beer etc.
results.name: Czech and Slovak North East Group

results.description:
This is your chance to prototype your ideas before going to VCs or for seed funding.

We all have dream applications that need machine learning and predictive analytics. We can hack those app. using available machine learning APIs (from Microsoft, Google, BigML, BPA EyeQ, and so on). No need to learn those complicated math or gymnastics of matrices.

 

This is also your way to find a co-founder, good developers, and some good feedback. By the way, investors are also welcome; coding is good for our brain, and it keeps Alzheimer away!

We are the Big-data web, data driven web, and Web^n!

About the Meet-ups :: We meet on Mondays or some Saturdays. We usually meet up in the evening on Mondays, start with a little merry-making and chatting, then coding, and hang out some more. Venues vary, so stay tuned.
results.name: Boston Hacking Predictive Analytics App

results.description:
The Boston Internet Marketing Meetup, (@bostimm) is a rapidly growing local Internet marketing Meetup focused on the Cambridge and Boston locales. True to a Meetup format, we always have a presentation or learning session and a Q&A which is preceded and followed by general networking opportunities with both experienced and relatively new professionals interested in the Internet and its use in successful marketing programs.  We feel peer learning and networking with an educational component is the best way to get introduced to Internet Marketing as well as building your knowledge base and contacts for the experienced online marketer. We like to hang out after a presentation, get some food or a drink, talk internet, answer questions and really get to know all you folks that are both passionate about or just learning of  the opportunities online for the first time.

Topics regularly include Websites: buying/selling/optimizing; Search: optimization, tools; Social media: real time, video, tools (twitter/facebook/youtube, etc); Analytics: free and paid programs. 

Our educational series that started in 2011 has been well attended and pulls from our talented membership to create a regular learning track for Internet marketing topics.  We also have our eyes open for cool events that may be a little bit different, but hopefully bring a level of take-home value you do not find elsewhere.  Our goal with each meetup is to give our attendees at least one thing they can go home with and make a difference in their business, website or internet marketing plan.

We invite anyone interested in these topics to join us anytime. We welcome new members including recent or soon to be college graduates, veteran internet marketers, independent business owners who need a jumpstart, and those folks just venturing into the world of online marketing for the first time.

Please join us!
results.name: Boston Internet Marketing Meetup

topics.name: Vespa Aprilia Piaggio Yamaha Suzuki Kymco Scooters

results.description: We are motor scooter enthusiasts interested in riding together along scenic roads of Boston's Metro, North and South Shore areas. We welcome all people with all types of scooters and small engine motorcycles to ride with us. Our intent is to enjoy rides together to fun destinations for social connections. We organize rides both night and day, any day of the week. We hope to continue growing our group and serving our community and each other with various charity rides to benefit local causes. Come join us on the road!
results.name: Boston Scoots

results.description:
WE ARE FUNNY OLD BROADS  LOOKING FOR FRIENDSHIP,

FUN AND A REASON TO GET OUT OF THE HOUSE. 

WE KNOW YOU'RE OUT THERE AND TIRED OF SITTING AT HOME. 

COME JOIN US AND MAKE NEW FRIE

WE GET TOGETHER EACH MONTH FOR A LUNCH 

BUT DO OTHER ACTIVITIES DURING THE MONTH.

(PLAY CARDS, BOARDGAMES, BOWL, MOVIES & PLAYS,

OUT TO EAT, WALK OR BIKE RIDE, FOXWOODS)

JOIN US IN THESE ACTIVITIES.

US FUNNY OLD BROADS HAVE TO STICK TOGETHER

CONTACT US AT   funnyoldbroads@aol.com
results.name: FUNNY OLD BROADS

results.description:
The MOMS Club® of Franklin, MA is a local chapter of a national support group for stay-at-home mothers interested in a variety of activities for themselves and their children.

You need a support group that understands your special needs as a stay-at-home mother and we're it! The International MOMS Club® is the first, largest, and fastest growing support group specifically for at-home mothers. Nationally, there are over 2,000 chapters with more than 100,000 members across the US and International chapters starting, too!

The MOMS Club of Franklin, MA invites you to visit our next Monthly Meeting!  Our chapter is always open to all residents of Franklin, MA. Since women are finding out about us and joining regularly, most likely you probably won't be the only new person there. Although some of us have lived here for years, many of us are new in town or new to motherhood! We all have one thing in common—the MOMS Club introduced us to other moms who stay home...and these moms have become our friends.

Here are some of the things that make us special:



—We meet during the day, when at-home mothers most need support.



—MOMS may bring their children with them to any event.



—There are many fun activities every month for children of all ages.



—The MOMS Club is a nonprofit corporation.



—Mothers of any age children are welcome.



—Each chapter performs at least one service project every year to help needy women or children.

Every month throughout the year we host fun activities and gatherings, including local park days, trips to children’s museums and zoos, tours of local fire stations or other businesses, and many other kid-friendly field trips. When MOMS need some time for themselves, the Club offers monthly MOMS Nights Out. Club members are also able to join existing playgroups or start their own. As a member, you will receive a monthly newsletter with a calendar of scheduled events. Feel free to participate in as many or as few activities each month as you desire.
results.name: MOMS Club of Franklin

results.description:
We have decided to shut down this meetup group

massmouth has a website (massmouth.com). you can become a member there if you would like to be up-to-date about coming events.

-----------------------------------------

massmouth works to renew the timeless art of storytelling in Massachusetts by building audience while engaging a new generation of tellers using digital capture of story in live performance in non traditional venues (from apple orchards to urban street corners, and at story slams). massmouth engages in dialogue with our audience and our colleagues in real time and through web 2.0 in order to extend and perfect our art.

THE GROUP STARTED: when we realized that our professional group, once MA based (www.lanes.org ) had became regional, MA had no state wide organization. massmouth was created to fill the void. We promote and create story in live performance because story is everywhere and needs a presence. We video tape and post our performances. We are storytellers willing to tell stories in the world. We are out of the clubs, the hot houses, the supportive audiences and into the streets.

WHO: Anyone willing to practice the art and craft of story in live performance.

WHY: massmouth was started to promote the art of storytelling in Massachusetts. We exist to bring the art of storytelling into the wider world, in the street, online and, by doing so, into the ears and imaginations of people everywhere. and open mic called a "mouthoff" every month and other happenings and events as planned.
Check out : http://massmouth.blogspot.com/
and join at: http://massmouth.com/
results.name: CLOSING DOWN THIS MEETUP GROUP: massmouth storytellers

results.description: This group is for real people who want to gain greater Balance, Strength and Power.  We have a beautiful space that is not your typical gym, martial arts studio or yoga studio.  It is a place to move, sweat, laugh, and become more embodied.  We offer a variety of classes: Authentic Chen Style Tai Chi, TRX, Strength and Balance, Fitness classes, and practical Safety and Self-Defense classes.   We love new students and want to share our enthusiasm for fluid, embodied movement with others.  Browse through the listings.  Some are on-going classes, others are special events.  Some are held on-site in the Energy Inspired Fitness Studio, and others are held in various locations.  See the expanded listings, and plan to join us soon.
results.name: Balance, Strength and Power

results.description:
This group is for people (experienced or not), who are interested in the benefits of the Chinese energy practice of Qigong (Chi Kung). I also hope this group will give people with various backgrounds an opportunity to build a community where we can practice, talk and learn about Qigong.

 

Qigong is a a moving meditation that helps us tap into the abundant energy of the universe, and is a wonderful way of helping help various health conditions. Qigong is also the mother of the internal martial arts (Tai Chi, Bagua or Xingyi) and will strength your internal energy for those practices.

 

The benefits of practicing Qigong include:

* Reduced stress, anxiety and depression

* Improved sleep quality

* Increased energy

* Lowered blood pressure

* Improved organ function
results.name: Greater Boston Qigong

results.description: After over a year of languishing into oblivion, I have decided to turn this group into a movie meetup group.  Because, well, I love movies, especially Independents.  Please feel free to leave the group if you would like to.  More page edits to come.  Thank you for your patience!
results.name: Boston Movie Peeps

results.description:
What is the purpose of this group?
The purpose of this group is for greater Boston area people to meet up and waterski for an hour or two or three. We need a minimum of three people to waterski, a waterski boat and of course the waterskis.  We encourage you to join even in NH , RI and Western CT and I can help you create Meetups across the region for the most possibilities to waterski close to where you are.

Who should join? If you have a passion for the water join now! Our members run from Beginners to some of the highest experience levels. Most important, it's a friendly social atmosphere where you can feel comfortable no matter your skill level. We help each other enjoy, learn and get the most out of it. We love people who have have experience waterskiing and/or who can navigate a waterski boat safely and responsibly. It is also great, if you have your waterski boat to add to the group. I expect we will share expenses such as fuel and other incidentals.

Members are welcome/encouraged to become Event Planners by contacting (text or phone is best) the Organizer that currently oversees administrative functions (Peter). You may have your own a ski boat or can beg/borrow/rent one. Ideally, Event Planners should organize a Meetup at least every other month.

Anyone who is looking to make and meet new friends in and around the area is welcome to join. Activities are not limited and can vary, depending upon the members interests. This is your group and members are strongly encouraged to voice their ideas and opinions.

I learned to waterski at seven years old. I still love to do it.
I have a boat and skis.  Several other members also have their own boats, so there is variety of boats and favorite waterski locations. Borrowing equipment to learn or try is usual, just let us know.

Where will we meet and Waterski?
For freshwater we trailer to nearby Rivers or Lakes such The Merrimac River, Lake Cochiutate, Chebacco Lake.  For saltwater, around Boston Harbor or near The Cape, and as far as Newport or Providence RI where the water is warmer. You can review the past meetups for more location details. And keep in mind that we are open to exploring your favorite spot.


Let's make the best of the days of summer we have here in Boston. Let's get out and waterski!
results.name: Boston WaterSki Enthusiasts

results.description: If you are a mom living in or near the towns of Canton or Westwood, MA, and are interested in meeting other local moms to socialize with...this group is for you.  The main goal of this group is to: *meet other local moms who share similar interests. *create new friendships for ourselves and our children. *to offer support and advice to one another. *have FUN!!!  All member ideas, suggestions, and comments will be an integral part of what will hopefully make the Canton-Westwood Moms Social Group a BIG SUCCESS! Looking forward to meeting you soon! *This group will be private (in order to protect ourselves and our children from unwanted internet predators). Therefore, you must submit a small introduction about yourself, a photo, and answer a few simple profile questions in order to become a member and have full access to our website.
results.name: Canton-Westwood Moms Social Group

results.description:
Asians and Friends - Boston (AaFB) is an International Friendship and social support group. Our group was established in 2001 as a grass roots non-profit to promote friendship among gay, Asians and non-Asians. Since Meetup has recently changed a few things, we no longer have an invite code and since we still want to maintain some privacy we now have to approve all new members, please be patient since we do not always check the emails daily.

Many of our founding members are still involved in the group and we welcome new members to join all the time. We have not charged dues since the first year and now there is no cost to join. So it doesn't cost any money to be a member! But most of the events do cost money (food, drinks, admission, etc.) you pick and choose which ones you attend. Keep in mind that the organizers do have to pay money to meetup.com to run the website. If you have enjoyed and can donate please do but do not worry if you are on a tight budget we would rather you attend than stay at home because you don't have a donation. The donations do go to help cover the costs of running the groups website.

The members of this group get together to meet, greet, and socialize, sharing life experiences in safe, social settings. We provide a wide range of social, cultural, and educational activities for men and women in a gay friendly supportive environment. Regularly held activities include potluck dinners and cookouts, movie nights, discussion groups, and dinner parties around the general Boston area. Special events might include bar hopping, concerts, sporting events, bowling, museum tours, theatre groups, shows, and theme park adventures.

We want you to join us in planning and organizing events which you feel others will enjoy as well as yourself. Please check out the ideas page and add your ideas, and VOTE for ideas or events which you would like to attend. Also let us know if you would like to assist in organizing any event, and we will be happy to help plan events as we all try to enjoy life.

If you are only on the Yahoo group or you know someone who is only on the Yahoo group, please encourage them to sign up for this meetup group.

If you have read this far and would like to sign up, Meetup as of May 1, 2013 has now changed and we no longer have an invite code and since we still want to maintain some privacy we will now be approving all new members, again please be patient since we do not always check the emails daily. When you sign up, you are able to restrict emails on the site so you do not get duplicated email notices, but this site is much more interactive and updated.



We are Your Group help us, help you, enjoy our lives!!!

 

ps, If you have sent the group an email and several days have passed by without a reply please check your spam folder and update your email system to accept our emails,  we try not to spam anyone.
results.name: Asians & Friends - Boston

results.description:
We just passed our 4th year!  We have over 280 members now!! Come on and join and see how much fun we're having!!

"South Shore (Randolph) Movie-Going Maniacs!"

 

We are the "SOUTH SHORE MOVIE GOING MANIACS!!! This is a social group for anyone over the age of 18 in the Norfolk County area or anyone willing to travel over to the South Shore Area!  We enjoy getting together at the theater for new releases on the big screen.

This group is for married people, single people, people who just moved here from out-of-state or people who are simply just looking for a new group to go out with and enjoy an amazing night out at the movies!!!

 

 

We go every Tuesday and take advantage of  $7.50 Tuesdays!! You can even see 3-D movies or IMax movies for only $9.50!  We'll traditionally go to Randolph Showcase Cinema, but have also gone to The Dedham Legacy Place or the newly designed AMC Theater in Braintree. We are also looking for people to host events in other locations as well, such as in other South Shore locations.

If this group sounds like something You are interested we would love to have you!  We also welcome ideas you have for events as well.


**BEFORE JOINING YOU MUST HAVE A CLEAR PHOTO OF YOURSELF INCLUDED IN YOUR PROFILE.  IF YOU DO NOT YOUR REQUEST FOR APPROVAL WILL BE DENIED.  THANK YOU FOR YOUR UNDERSTANDING.**
results.name: "South Shore Movie-Going Maniacs!"

results.description:
The Skidaddlers Ski and Sports Club Inc. is a non-profit organization whose goal is to create a fun and safe ski and sporting experience for all its members and guests. Our members are SINGLE and 21+ active professionals who love the outdoors and meeting new people in and around the Boston area.

We are an ALL SEASONS CLUB. You don't have to ski to be a part of the group. We have lots of year round events. Hiking, Biking, Canoeing, Tubing, Kayaking, dinners and other social events.

We will host all types of events some being held at the Skidadds Lodge and many other venues.

We have an actual year round lodge that sleeps 60 on 19 acres of land along Route 302 in Bartlett, NH. It is built for fun no matter what the weather. results.description:
Bring Your Lovely
Bring Your Diversity
Bring Your Friendship
Bring Yourself!

We are the Multicultural Women's Network, which was originally based in Astoria, Queens in 2009, but we now serve the Boston area.

Mission & Vision:
The Multicultural Women’s Network provides dynamic social events and networking opportunities for professional women of all walks of life and multicultural backgrounds!Many of the members who join the MWN are seeking female camaraderie and light-hearted fun to overcome life stressors and adjustments that we, as women, all experience. This exemplifies the MWN’s vision to build a cohort of women that offers social support, while developing an empowered female community that pays it forward and inspires one another.

The Leadership Team:
With a growing group, the MWN Leadership Team is diligently to build a new framework to better serve our members and organize events that support our mission.

Membership Dues:
We would like to enhance event opportunities and offer more incentives to members; in order to do this we will have to incorporate membership dues. These dues will go towards the website fees charged by meetup.com and also special events to show appreciation to the members who are consistent in participation and attendance. 

Additionally, to cater to the “pay-it-forward” vision, when funds allow, arrangements will be made to support actively participating members who may be struggling to pay the cost of an event themselves. 

Beginning July 15, 2014, there will be a non-refundable annual membership fee of $22.20. Payments can be made directly on our Meetup Page. If you have any questions or concerns regarding membership dues, please contact organizers Yvette Jones or Lisa Robinson. 

The $22.20 annual fee covers membership for one calendar year. Members will be notified of the renewal period.

  • Current members who have not submitted their membership dues by July 31st will not be able to participate in any events until payment has been received.

  • New members take advantage of trial period! If you've had a blast and would like to become an active member just submit your membership due within one month of your second event.


    Membership Status:
    Our membership tiers will give you the opportunity to increase status levels and receive privileges and rewards the more you attend MWN events! See details below:

  • Bronze -
    • A member must attend 1 event every two months.
    • Membership dues are required for this status.
    • Participation in 'Bronze Only' member events and access to Facebook page, blogs, and other social media websites.
    • Inactive Bronze members will not be removed from the group until their membership period has ended.


  • Gold -
    • A member must attend 1 event every month and 1 featured event within a 2 month period.
    • Membership dues are required for this status.
    • Access to in Bronze and Gold member events, featured events, and social media websites.
    • Gold members that fail to participate in 1 event a month or 1 featured event within 2 months will be moved to Bronze status.


  • Diamond -
    • A member must attend 1 event every month, 1 featured event within a 2 month period, and must contribute to the functioning and organization of the group (i.e. event organizer, recruitment events, referring new members, etc).
    • Membership dues are required for this status.
    • Access to all member events, featured events, and social media websites.
    • Rewards include member of the month recognition, discounts, and private invites to special events hosted for Diamond members only.
    • Diamond members that fail to participate in 1 event a month or 1 featured event within 2 months will be moved to Gold status.


  • Platinum -
    • A Platinum member must launch a MWN branch, run at least 2 events per month, run all featured events, and organizes and heads planning.
    • Membership dues are required for this status.
    • Access to all member events, featured events, and social media websites.
    • Platinum members enjoy Diamond status rewards.
    • Inactive Platinum members will not be demoted or removed until their membership has ended.
    Come join us on Facebook to discuss group activity options, read blogs about multicultural women's topics, and meet new friends in the area.

No Shows & Last Minute Cancelation Group Policy. Please be aware that last minute canceling and no showing can create disruptions in events and organizing of the events for both members and organizers. Any no showing or last minute cancelations with out an urgent cause  could  result in members being restricted from attending future events! Please contact the head organizer for comments, concerns, etc

results.description: Boston and surrounding areas! "Journey to Parenthood" hopes to engage and empower women who are experiencing the challenges of fertility. Let's work to eliminate the "stigma" that surrounds infertility and embrace our struggles and encourage one another on our own individual "Journey to Parenthood". We believe that we are stronger together than individually. We are here to offer you some good energy, and some girl power. We can share stories and strengths, laugh and cry and enjoy a meet up for coffee-talk,walks, dinner & cocktails/mocktails or whatever you suggest! Our goal is to create an encouraging and friendly environment. Whether you are single, married, gay, or straight, you are welcome. Whether your journey is through IUI, IVF, adoption,surrogacy or the traditional method we encourage you to join us. We are not a "group therapy session" but a group of ladies who believe that talking about our experiences is the best medicine. WE ARE NOT: Medical advisors- we have no medical experience whatsoever! So just join us for some support along your journey!

topics.name: Yoga and the Connection to Breath

results.description:
Grace Furnari, RYT

Registered Yoga teacher certified in Hatha and Seniors Yoga through Finding Inner Peace Yoga School.

Specializing in students with various auto-immune diseases such as Fibromyalgia , CFS and Arthritis.

Registered through Yoga Alliance: www.yogaalliance.org.

Classes at..

Yoga with Grace, Norwood, MA
Norwood Senior Center
Private instruction by appointment

See our Meetup Calendar  below for more information.

 

 

About Grace...

I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia over 10 years ago. The chronic fatigue and pain was so debilitating it affected my work and social life. A fibromyalgia specialist suggested I try yoga to ease my symptoms. So I started practicing yoga in 2003 on a weekly basis. Within a few months, I saw my symptoms diminish dramatically. Recently I decided I wanted to share my experience with others through teaching and became a certified yoga instructor in August of 2009.

Needless to say, yoga has been a saving grace for me (no pun intended!) It has boosted my energy, helped me gain strength and reduced my stress; thus keeping my fibromyalgia at bay.

For those of you who suffer from this chronic illness and other auto immune diseases such as lupus and arthritis, I suggest you give yoga a try.

The right approach for you…

I will design a program for you that will start with simple stretching and breathing techniques for mental clarity and relaxation. Then we will work our way towards asanas (poses) to help your strength and flexibility. And remember, yoga is not a competition; you can always pull back once you have reached your edge.

The style of yoga you will experience...

Hatha style classes blend breath work, mindfulness, meditation, and guided imagery, with stretching and strengthening. A Hatha Yoga class fosters an understanding between breath and movement. A typical class will challenge you in a variety of ways depending on your own personal level of fitness, connection to your inner self, and ability to balance—physically and mentally.
results.name: Yoga with Grace

The challenge can be anything... Finding the perfect career or job.... starting or expanding that business... running that 5k, marathon or completing the Ironman...  finding "the one" or soul mate... making a difference....

results.description:
Kabbalah is the ancient esoteric tradition, Jewish mysticism. Group 'Kabbalah and Meditation' is intended to connect us with the sources of knowledge in the Jewish mystical tradition and thus bring us closer to G-d. Kabbalah literal meaning is 'to receive', which alludes to receiving esoteric influx through learning and practice, with 'mindful heart'.



Of the three types of Kabbalah: theoretical, meditative and practical, we learn and engage only in theoretical and meditative Kabbalah. We draw exclusively upon Torah-based sources, while making every attempt to identify and connect the dots between kabbalistic notions and our contemporary spiritual experiences.

Learn and experience

OUR STUDY GROUPS.



Each group meeting of two hours includes 1 hour of learning and 1 hour of meditation.

WE LEARN THE BASICS OF KABBALAH FUNDAMENTALS:

  • Structure of creation, Universes and Sefirot
  • Mystical significance of Hebrew letters (we learn the letters as well) and their permutations
  • Structure of the soul
  • Individual and collective Divine Providence
  • Types of reincarnations
  • Seeing and understanding own life purpose from the perspective of higher self
  • Developing sensitivity to spiritual communications
  • Practices that help us to become closer to G-d

We base our learning on the works of Ramchal, Rambam, R. Moshe Cordovero, R. Nachman of Breslov, and our contemporaries, R. Aryeh Kaplan, R. Avraham Sutton, R. Avraham Itzik (A. Green). We touch on the texts of Sefer Yetzirah, Zohar and Bahir, but will not expand on them without extensive preparation.



IN MEDITATION PART, WE LEARN AND PRACTICE:

  • Identifying Sefirot with the parts of the body
  • Meditation on Sefirot and meditation on Hebrew letters
  • Expanding on importance of breath in attaining meditative states and tuning our connection with the higher levels of our own soul, and with G-d.
  • We learn and practice breathing techniques and chanting meditations.
  • Exploring and experiencing significance of routine Jewish rituals in drawing down the power of the spiritual realms -- 'elevating the sparks', bringing kochos to the state of tikkun -- clearing and elevating ourselves, and the world.

 

'KABBALAH AT THE SHABBAT TABLE'

is another format of our gatherings. Allow learning and experience integrate into your bodies with delicious traditional Shabbat food and fascinating rituals. Everyone is welcome, whether you want to reconnect with our tradition, or whether your soul is calling you to the Shabbat table, and to learn more about Jewish ways.

We meet on Friday nights to experience the beauty of Shabbat, to welcome, to be blessed and to dwell in the glory of the Shabbat Queen, Shechinah, the Divine Presence. 

We perform all Shabbat rituals in the Orthodox tradition, dress in festive way, light candles, sing, enjoy plentiful traditional Shabbat meals, read Torah and discuss how the Torah themes manifest in our lives on spiritual and material levels. We learn the Kabbalistic meaning of Shabbat, rituals and brachot (blessings). If Shabbat falls on Rosh Chodesh or Erev Rosh Chodesh, we bless the new moon and new month. On Shabbat that allows for Kedush Levana, we perform ritual blessings the moon that reaches its fullness. We celebrate all festivals that fall on Shabbat in traditional ways.
results.name: Kabbalah and Meditation

results.description:
Welcome to the VersatilePhD Boston group, and thank you for your interest! The main purpose of this group is to reach out and connect with doctoral students and PhD's who have gone off the beaten path to pursue careers outside of academia. There are many more of us out there than one thinks, and my hope is to build a thriving community in the greater Boston area.

The ivory tower isn't for everyone. Whatever your reasons for leaving the tenure track or your PhD program (or just pondering it), you need support, dignity, perspective, a little self-knowledge, and a new network of contacts. That's where this group comes in.

VPhD holds two types of Meetups. Once a month, we meet for a Meet and Greet.  Discussion runs the gamut from the nuts-and-bolts of translating academic skills and experience to nonacademic careers, to the more difficult project of figuring out what you actually want. Nor are we necessarily opposed to the academic world itself: some participants have left reassured that the professor track is in fact the right path for them.  This is simply a safe space to air doubts and explore other possibilities as well as swap contacts and information.

The second type of Meetup is our Speaker Series.  Each month or thereabouts, VPhD invites a former PhD, EdD, or ABD to discuss his or her successful transition into a nonacademic career. Again, the discussion may range from the technicalities of other fields and interview practices to the emotional and psychological work involved in leaving behind past professional identities, achievements, mentors, and colleagues.  Some of the speakers will address the search for creative outlets outside the academy; others will focus on the more prosaic problem of finding a steady paycheck.

Since this is the beginning of things to come, there will be some shuffling of things as such, but I guarantee that you will enjoy yourself and meet some great folks. I will try to plan monthly gatherings - and you are free to make any suggestions for things you'd like to do!

Come hang out, network, and make new friends while learning about a variety of opportunities! Also, if you'd like to share about your experience navigating the job market after graduation, that would be great as well. Please contact us at [url=mailto:versatilephdboston@gmail.com]versatilephdboston@gmail.com[/url] to get started!

Warmly,

results.description:
Well, it all about the chocolate, right?  This group is sponsored by Boston Chocolate Tours and the Boston Chocolate School and as a member, you will get discounts to various chocolate offerings and be kept up to date about the latest, greatest chocolate happenings in Boston.  It's not all about being commercial, it's about you, be an organizer, get involved, let's Meetup and have some chocolate fun.

Recipe swaps. fondue tasting, you name it and other chocolate lovers will step up and join you.  This group can be anything you want it to be.
results.name: Boston Chocolate Meetup

results.description: Welcome to the Boston Expat and World Travelers meetup group. Do you have a passion for traveling overseas and learning about other cultures? We are a group of friendly travelers and expats who meet monthly for a drink to exchange travel ideas, tips, and stories about exciting places we have traveled to, lived in, or hope to visit soon. We welcome anyone who is interested in world travel, whether you are considering it for the first time or a travel junkie who routinely quits your job in search of your next travel fix, or somewhere in between. Hope to see you at an event soon! Please note, we do not arrange slide shows, organize group trips, or push commercial ventures on you. Unlike some other groups, we're not affiliated with travel companies looking to promote their commercial services. What we do is meet, enjoy each other's company, and remind ourselves why people who travel the world are such good fun to be around. BEWT is a non-commercial social travel group. Active solicitation of members at Meet Ups or via the Message Board by commercial organizations is contrary to the spirit of the group. Commercial Message Board solicitations will be deleted.
results.name: Boston Expat and World Travelers Meetup (BEWT)

results.description: The Boston Real Estate Salon is a monthly forum where you can ask and learn about the latest news and developments in the Local Real Estate Market and about the Real Estate Field in general. Our friendly and informal catered gatherings are a great place to mingle and network as well. Come and eat, drink, have fun, meet people and learn! We'll discuss a variety of topics that are related to building your understanding of real estate so that you can participate in the market the way you've always wanted to. If you want to be not only engaged in short-term transactions of your interest (e.g. selling, buying, renting) but to do so with knowledge, vision and long-term planning for your desired outcomes in the field of Real Estate - this is the place for you! Join us for series of ongoing events, workshops and monthly updates, learn, plan and build your successful Real Estate Portfolio! WHAT HAPPENS AT THE BOSTON REAL ESTATE SALON? Curious about what is going on in the world of Real Estate? Want to know the latest trends and developments? Want to know how the REAL and LOCAL Real Estate Market is doing now? Do you want to: * Buy * Sell * Invest * Rent * Build * Renovate in the most efficient, profitable, fun and informed way? Then come to the INFORMAL and INFORMATIVE BOSTON REAL ESTATE SALON: When: The Last Tuesday of every month 7pm-10:00pm Where: Restaurant “Vernissage” 1627 Beacon Street Brookline, MA Agenda: 7-7:30pm: refreshments 7:30- 8pm: presentation on current news of the industry:" What's New?" current conditions of the national and particularly local market: "How's Market?" predictions and recommendations: " What's Best To Do Now?" 8-8:30pm: Q&A 8:30-10pm: eat, mingle, and network VISIONARY FOUNDER Olga is a distinguished, licensed Real Estate Professional with more than 15 years of experience and numerous awards in her field. She is a top broker, real estate coach, and consultant. Olga has assisted hundreds of clients to successfully reach their goals in Real Estate. Olga enjoys teaching Real Estate basics and principles as well as new and innovative up-to-date strategies. In addition to having her own weekly radio show, she has led the Boston Real Estate Salon for the past 2 years and has conducted numerous seminars on a variety of real estate topics. Olga is not only a broker - she has been a homeowner, landlord and developer of many years.
results.name: Boston Real Estate Investors Coaching Network

results.description:
Dance Freedom and Dance Friday are on-going participatory dances held every Wednesday and Friday.

People dance creatively, alone, with a partner or with many others. DJ music guides the dance, weaving together current, world, classic, and spiritual sounds. Both dances are safe places to share your energy and make new friends. No shoes, alcohol, or smoking are allowed. Respect for others is essential.

Dance Freedom is held every Wednesday from 7:30 p.m. - 10:30 p.m at the First Congregational Church, Mason and Garden Streets, Cambridge, MA, 02138. Ages 18+ are welcome. Admission is on a sliding scale of $10 - $15.

Dance Friday takes place every Friday from 8:00 pm - midnight at the First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church at 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA. All ages are welcome; children must be accompanied by a supervising adult. Suggested donation is on a sliding scale of $10 - $15, $5 - 15 for teens through young adults (22). Children 12 and under are free with adult supervision.

Dance Freedom and Dance Friday are activities of the non-profit Movement Collective.

For more information on Dance Freedom, visit the Web site at http://dancefreedom.com or the Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/home.php#/group.php?gid=491089432....

For more information on Dance Friday, visit the Web site at http://dancefriday.org or the Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/home.php#/dancefriday?ref=ts.
results.name: Dance Freedom / Dance Friday

results.description:
There's just something special about little white (or not so white) fluffy (or not so fluffy) dogs. It's amazing to see more than one at a time. And, I swear they recognize and love being with each other.

This Meetup Group is about getting them together for some silliness, in a safe environment where they can romp and play and know they are safe from their larger cousin dogs.

(We have the best and nicest human members too - so nice getting to know everyone!)
results.name: Camberville Area -- Little Fluffy Dogs & Friends
