results.description:
The Boston Content Marketing Meetup is a platform that brings together local marketers for events surrounding the topic of content marketing. This Meetup also gives marketers an opportunity to learn and share best practices and tips across all facets of the content marketing supply chain: strategy, production, promotion and analytics.


Please use this community as a platform to stay up-to-date with content marketing events in the Boston area. Feel free to share useful insight, pose a question or bring up a new topic or trend. Members of this group should be able to learn from each other and bring their own expertise to the conversation.
results.name: Boston Content Marketing

results.description:
New Wave is a group that incorporates the myriad perspectives of our members to build a radically-welcoming feminist community.

This isn't our grandmothers' Feminism - we draw on the great progress of previous generations while forging ahead and creating our own path.

As a diverse group of Feminists, Womanists, Gender Studies students, professionals, and other folks with an interest in gender equality, we welcome ALL voices, Queer or straight, cis or trans, all genders and all backgrounds.
results.name: New Wave - Young Boston Feminists

results.description: We are the Boston Area Chapter of the American Humanist Association. Basically, we are the people living in the Boston Metropolitan area (extending into New Hampshire and Rhode Island) who believe in Humanism and try to live a Humanistic life and who like to get together in association with each other in formal or informal humanistically oriented activities. The pages of this web site will describe what these activities and associations and services currently are. We are governed by our Chapter By-Laws. We hope that you are able to make use of them and that you will join with us on occasion.
results.name: Greater Boston Humanists

results.description:
This group is for you if
• You want to learn how to be healthy and stay healthy by natural means
• You appreciate experts and professionals, but you'd really like to have a say in your own health! 
• You want to hear speakers talk about the latest ideas about how the universe, and our bodies and minds, work
• You believe there are better, more holistic ways of healing other than drugs or surgery, and / or
• You want to meet like-minded souls.

This group will also have study groups for those who want to study a topic more deeply and to do so in a social setting. 

I also will present speakers who can share their professional knowledge (an M.D. who likes alternative, natural methods), their amateur love of something (a pickllng expert? someone who loves to make tempeh and tofu? someone who is an expert about the practical use of quantum physics?), and/or their personal healing experience ("I got cancer, and here's how I cured it without chemotherapy").

I personally know and hope to get Tom Monte, John Kozinski, Michio Kushi, and / or Rodd Stockwell, M.D.  as early speakers. Who would you like to listen to?

Perhaps YOU could be a speaker, if you have an area of expertise or are a professional in some health-related or consciousness-related field. Health professionals could give informative talks that would be educational as well as introduce your business.

Meetings will range from a low or no-cost meeting where a few of us gather to read a chapter from some interesting book together and then talk about it, up to a more expen$ive all-day seminar with some nationally renowned authority.

When you join, please answer the new member questions and tell us about yourself. Fee free to email me with requests, and also if you have a large enough home and would like to host a meeting.

Thanks,
Paul G.

>>About me, your group organizer, if you are curious:

I changed my diet and thinking back in 7th grade in 1967 in Indianapolis, Indiana. Now it’s about 40 years later, I’ve been living in the Boston area for years, and I’m still eating a whole foods diet and continuing to develop my understanding of medicine, the human bodymind, life in general, universal law, and how to experience love and freedom.

I earn my living by producing educational and transformative meetings, and by being a handyman and carpenter as well. I have learned and benefited a lot from my studies in macrobiotics, acupuncture, holistic health, emotional healing, psychology, human potential movement, Landmark Education, Process Oriented Psychology, various therapies and counseling (including Re-Evaluation Counseling, or Co-Counseling, Voice Dialogue, coaching, Guided Self Healing, etc.); Men’s Work, David Deida, Alan Watts, Tom Monte, Dr. Andy Hahn, Eckhart Tolle, Deepak Chopra.   TTYL, PG
results.name: Holistic Health Speaker Series and Study Group

results.description:
Boston Dogs Organization is the play-date, playgroup, reference section, dog and owner communication portal, extension of its nonprofit  www.boston-dogs.org

Our parent nonprofit specializes in unique, holistic, individual training; performing surrender interventions; facilitating rescue transportation and placements; and constant canine political advocacy (we spearheaded the first criminal devocalization Bill in the USA "Logan's Law" and passed it 155 - 1 by the MA legislature and signed by Governor Patrick in April. If you need help in any of these areas let us know info@boston-dogs.org and we work with a scaled finance schedule that is often free.

This group also serves to connect all the Boston and New England based nonprofit as well as altruistic Dog lovers and donors; whether you volunteer once per week at a shelter, send money in to an advocacy, or foster a dog waiting for a home, we want your participation and this is an outlet for you. Overall let's have some fun!!

Anyone wishing to Lead a Meetup please email the Leadership Team. We welcome new ideas and assistance.

We never charge for any Meetup (which to facilitate require money for several internet based costs,) but members are welcome to donate any amount (tax deductible) via PayPal or Credit Card by clicking on Our Logo to the right here OR directly from your account to donate@boston-dogs.org OR a check at a Meetup or USPS work as well:

This if entirely on a volunteer basis.

Confirmation and a receipt will be sent promptly for your generosity.

HQ - Boston (Back Bay,) Massachusetts

Thank You --- WOOOOOF
results.name: Boston Dogs Organization

results.description:
Do you want to reduce your consumer impact on the earth, humans, and animals? Are you concerned about the wastefulness of our consumer society? This new meetup group will soon have its first event. What kind of things can we do together? Dumpster dive to find useable goods, share skills on repairing bikes, clothing, computers, etc. We can also organize movie nights, reading groups, dinners-- whatever we like!
We need a "co-organizer" (really the real organizer there in Boston) who can set meeting locations and generally keep the ball rolling among the more than 60 people who are now part of this group. Email Madeline if you're interested.

results.description:
Welcome to the Downtown Women's Club Boston Meetup Group. We're a local chapter of the Downtown Women's Club.  Join us here on meetup to connect with other local members and stay informed about upcoming local events.

Also, visit the DWC website today where you can join as a DWC+ Premium member and enjoy our teleclasses and other virtual opportunities between local meetings.  Being a DWC+ Premium Member also allows you to attend most of our local events for free.

This chapter is run by: Jill Hauff and Emily Trask. Please address your comments or questions to either Jill at DWCjill@gmail.com or Emily at etrask@soliduseditorial.com.

No problem minimal charge to eat with us.

results.description: Our documentary film club meets the third Monday of every month at 7:00pm at Brookline Interactive Group. Popcorn is always provided! results.description: Ever wanted to learn how to kiteboard? Imagine the weightless feeling of soaring through the air, landing softly on the water and cruising. It's not that hard! It just takes practice. Anyone of any age with any body type can do it. A general level of fitness, not brawn, is what it takes. If you can run a mile, you can do this. In this meetup we will: *Meet other active, funloving people who want to try kiteboarding *Experience the thrill of flying power kites during Kite Nights *Learn the best way to get started in the sport *Escape the winter and learn kiteboarding in Mexico or Key West with other group members *Progress safely with practice partners You'll also get access to member only discounts on lessons, travel and equipment with Boston Kite School, Boston's kiteboarding outfit.
results.name: The Kiteboarding / Snowkiting Meetup Group

results.description:
This meetup group is formed for the cultivation and proliferation of True

Chi-Steppin in the New England region. Our events will provide an

opportunity to step with True Chi-Steppers, who are properly cultivated

to respect the fundamentals of the dance (True Chicago Style Steppin),

such as proper lane discipline, the beat, timing and flow, clear signals,

and smoothness devoid of a certain bounce. The true seductiveness of

the dance! STEPPIN IN THE BEAN cultivates the smoothest Chi-Steppers

in our locale, and good steppin habits will rub off on you when you step

with them, making you fit to step with any true Chi-stepper in the

national or international Steppin Community while traveling. The True

Chi-Steppers of Steppin In The Bean are innovative and as much fun to

come.

I am A.W. Taqwa, CEO of Steppin In The Bean Foundation Inc., Instructor of Boston's True Chi-Steppers. I am a protégé' of Masters Steppers Kevin Richards, and Andre Blackwell. I approve this message.

results.description: The Friends of Kevin is the only networking group that brings together the business, non profit and artistic communities. This allows you to meet people that you wont see at other networking events. The Friends of Kevin is unique because we combine in person monthly networking with online monthly promotion to offer you the chance to promote your business to my over 6,000 followers. If you are looking to grow your business this is the group for you! To learn more call Kevin at 978-995-1743 or email Kevin@friendsofkevin.com

results.description:
ALL ANIMALS ARE WELCOME!

Looking for a community who shares your interest in pet therapy or service animal work?   Are you ready to learn more about how to turn your pet into a therapy hero or train a service animal to make a difference in the lives of people?

The Therapy & Service Hero Pets of New England group was formed to identify exciting opportunities and conduct group visits to facilities and events, and to promote the healing power of your Fido, Kitty, Horse, or Llama!  Whether you already volunteer with a therapy pet or train/live with a service animal, or have a pet who is great with people and want to learn more, this group is for YOU!      

Another group goal is to assist shelters and rescue organizations in making pets more adoptable.  Let us help you find resources to certify animals who will make a great partner to a lucky human either needing a companion or wanting to make an impact on somebody's life!!  

Come share and create inspiring stories of "heroes!"
results.name: Therapy & Service Hero Pets of New England!

results.description:
• Would you like to have a relationship that is full of aliveness, love, and integrity?
• Do you want to know what works with women?
• Would you like to be more successful in your marriage, dating, or committed relationship?
• Do you want to know how to deal with an impending divorce? Perhaps prevent it?
• Would you like to learn how to be more naturally attractive to women (especially the kind you really want)?

If you said yes to any of these questions, then this could be just what you are looking for.

Each month we’ll have a two-hour “open coaching event,” an opportunity for you to receive expert coaching on this vital area of your life, at a low price, and to hear the coaching given to other men. The meeting will be men-only and confidential, designed to teach relationship skills to men want to be more successful and skillful in their relating to women.
results.name: Men Being Successful Relating to Women

results.description:
Happiness is a state of mind or feeling characterized by contentment, satisfaction, pleasure, or joy. Happiness comes from deep within, and not from people, situations, or circumstances.

According to Researchers from Harvard Medical School and the University of California, San Diego:

“When an individual becomes happy, the network effect can be measured up to three degrees. One person’s happiness triggers a chain reaction that benefits not only his friends, but his friends’ friends, and his friends’ friends’ friends. The effect lasts for up to one year.”

Since whatever we focus on grows, the aim of this group is to help members focus on happiness and to spread it at every opportunity.

If you are a happy person and want to socialize and network with other happy people, this is for you. If your goal is to become a happier person this group is for you. If you want to contaminate others with your happiness, this group is definitely for you. Visit http://iamhappyproject.org for more information; while you are there please follow us on twitter and like us on Facebook.
results.name: I am Happy Project - Boston, MA

results.description:
Seeking new friendships?  Hungry for fun?  New to Boston?

We are a great group of 50+ single progressive professionals with diverse interests who choose to expand our social groups beyond family and colleagues.  We are not a singles group, but individuals seeking peers with sharp young minds - open, eclectic, irreverent and tolerant.  We love the company of people with varied backgrounds, perspectives and experience.  Here is more on Who We Are.

We especially like to do things.  Our members proactively suggest and plan activities, then host them for one another.  We offer smart company with whom to share a good movie, museum, card game or meal out on a cold or rainy day; then we shift into hiking, kayaking, picnics, wildlife, skiing or beaches once better weather returns. Along the way, we take time for good humor and caring about things important, including laughter, exercise, adventure and one another

By sharing the tasks of hosting events, we each stay more active, entertained and happy, .

So check us out!  This group is once again public and accepting new members.  Please introduce yourself and join in our Summertime fun. .
results.name: Activities Network:  Beyond & Between Dating

results.description:
We are a group of ExpressionEngine users and developers in the greater Boston area who are interested in learning from each other, sharing best practices, and otherwise geeking out about EllisLab's ExpressionEngine, a fantastic PHP-based content management system.

We run structured presentations, informal "show-and-tell" sessions, co-hosted events with other local Meetup groups, "code & conversation" nights, and whatever other types of events our members dream up. We aim for one event per month, usually on a Tuesday or Wednesday evening. Join us!
results.name: BostonEErs - Boston ExpressionEngine Meetup

results.description: Cambridge Zen Center is one of the largest Buddhist residential Zen Training centers in the country. CZC was founded in 1973 by early students of Zen Master Seung Sahn, the first Korean Zen master to teach in the West. We offer daily morning and evening meditation and chanting, and weekly public talks and instruction free of charge. Retreats and accommodations are offered for a reasonable price. Zen meditation is a powerful way to clear our mind of habitual thinking. It helps us to balance ourselves and our world by pointing us towards our own wisdom and compassion. New friendships are formed and support for doing this practice is found by coming together for this special purpose.
results.name: Cambridge Zen Center

results.description:
North Burbs Business Women was created to support the marketing strategies and the professional development of women in business from the North Suburbs of Boston, Massachusetts. All women business owners, entrepreneurs and working professionals are welcome. Grow your business through monthly marketing forums, networking events and inspirational guest speakers. Be part of a dynamic group of like-minded women that understand that collaboration, learning, accountability and support is what it takes to succeed.

To continue reading, please visit the About Us page...
results.name: North Burb Business Women

results.description:
Boston Endurance Team is a Meetup based endurance training group for those located in and around Boston, MA.

This group was designed for people interested in training for and competing in various endurance events of any distance (5k, 10k, Sprint Triathlon, Half Marathon, Olympic Triathlon, Half Ironman, Marathon, Ironman Triathlon).

The members of this group will benefit by meeting other people who are interested in:

1) Meeting other local athletes to train with...  Those long training sessions can get lonely!
2) Learning training tips and training techniques from more experienced triathletes.
3) Finding information about triathlon resources in and around Boston

All in all, being a member of this group will help you accomplish your health goals and your life goals!

If you are interested in helping organize events for the Boston Endurance Team, please contact the Meetup organizer.  This Meetup brought to you by http://www.TriumphLIFE.com.

Make it a great day!
results.name: Boston Endurance Team

results.description:
Depression Anonymous
We are a group of people who support and encourage each other through the ups, downs and struggles of life. The meeting follows a 12 step recovery program to help work through the issues that have caused depression.

NAMI Metrowest - National Alliance on Mental Illness
We offer support groups for those recovering from mental illnesses of all kinds.  Another group is for families and caregivers of people living with any mental lllness.  We also sponsor educational classes and seminars that will be announced here.  See  nami.org for more information or call  508-485-8700
results.name: Depression Support MA

results.description:
As an entrepreneur, you know that the answers to certain legal questions can make or break your business. Do you know the best way to split the company’s equity? What are the tax implications for the different types of business structures, and what exactly is the significance of an 83(b) election? Is your intellectual property adequately protected? Should you hire independent contractors or employees?

Everyone will tell you that a good business attorney will provide vital assistance in almost every aspect of your business. However, not everyone will tell you lawyers need you just as much. Lawyers who focus on startup issues need to be around entrepreneurs to keep their fingers on the pulse of the startup community. They need to learn from entrepreneurs modern methods of operating a business, and technologies that may influence the practice of law for years to come. And yes, lawyers need clients too.

That’s why we created Lunchtime with Lawyers, a networking event unlike any other for both the attorney and the entrepreneur. A new concept, we envision this to begin as an informal lunchtime networking session with an opportunity for entrepreneurs to ask practicing attorneys and other professionals questions about legal issues. In the future, depending on demand, we can offer such unique activities as business plan hot-seats or roundtable discussions.

Please join us to show us your support for this idea. Lunchtime for Lawyers: where like-minded lawyers and entrepreneurs meet.
results.name: Lunchtime With Lawyers MA - Entrepreneur/Attorney Networking

results.description:
Boston Quantified Self (@QSboston) is a regular show and tell for people who are tracking data about their body and conducting their own personal investigations and research into their bodies, minds, and selves. Anything is game -- from personal genetics to ways to digitize and track information, from how to self-diagnose to how to self-experiment with data and statistics.

Topics include, but are not limited to:

* Self Experimentation

* Personal genetics and genome sequencing

* Generating, capturing, and working with biometric

* Lifelogging, lifecaching, lifestreaming

* Chemical Body Load Counts

* Self Experimentation

* Risks/Legal Rights/Duties

* Behavior monitoring, tracking, and modification (including studying habit forming and breaking)

* Location tracking

* Non-invasive Probes

* Digitizing Body Info

* Sharing Health Records

* Psychological Self-Assessments

* Medical self-diagnostics and keeping track of one's own medical data

The Quantified Self blog: http://www.quantifiedself.org
results.name: Boston Quantified Self

topics.name: Family and friends of disabled individuals

results.description:
Do you have a brother or sister with a disability, mental illness, or medical condition? If you want to socialize with other adult siblings like you and enjoy doing fun stuff in the Boston area, then this is the group for you! We've had some great activities so far: trivia nights, brunches, museum outings, craft brunches, and dessert nights. We would also love to have suggestions for other activities. This is the perfect opportunity to meet other adult siblings and have a great time. Please note, although we consider ourselves to be very supportive people this isn't a support group for siblings.

The MSSN Adult Sibling Social Group is part of the Massachusetts Sibling Support Network. The Massachusetts Sibling Support Network is a new non-profit organization, our purpose is to support siblings of people with disabilities in Massachusetts. This support is offered across the sibling's lifespan and includes providing information, creating welcoming communities for siblings, and improving access to sibling services. To learn more about the MSSN visit www.masiblingsupport.org and to join our mailing list click here http://eepurl.com/gVAaD
results.name: MSSN Adult Sibling Social Group

results.description: Guitarists, vocalists, cellists, woodwind players, sax, piano, hand drums... in short, we don't use electricity...We're professionals and closet musicians. Some of us are self trained and some  are classically trained. The group has evolved over the years.  In its current form, it offers a place for musicians of all levels to get together.  The goal is not performance or open mic, it's just a chance to get out and play with others.  Whether you are just starting out, or you've been playing for years, come out and meet some other musicians.  You can quietly noodle in the background, or lead us in a few tunes.  Either way, we hope you'll stop by and play.  Cheers!
results.name: Musicians for Acoustic Music

GREATER BOSTON TENNIS BIG SHOTS IS AN ORGANIZATION THAT



PROVIDES SOCIAL (ROUND ROBINS) AND COMPETITIVE (TOURNAMENTS; LEAGUES) PLAYING OPPORTUNITIES, AS WELL AS INSTRUCTIONAL SESSIONS FOR TENNIS ENTHUSIASTS OF ALL AGES AND SKILL LEVELS. WHETHER YOU SEEK TO PLAY TENNIS AT A SOCIAL/RECREATIONAL OR TOURNAMENT LEVEL, OR SEEK TENNIS INSTRUCTION TO UPGRADE YOUR GAME, WE AT GBTBS CAN ACCOMODATE YOU. WE ARE HERE TO SERVE THE GREATER BOSTON TENNIS COMMUNITY AND ENRICH ALL YOUR TENNIS PLAYING EXPERIENCES. WE INVITE YOU TO JOIN OUR GBTBS TENNIS MEET UP GROUP.

results.description: Come join me to share in the joy of owning "Little People!"  I'm on my second pair of rats and they truly are my best friends.  I even like spending time with them more that my cats, which I thought I would never say!  Join our group and make a whole new set of friends who don't think you are crazy for owning one of the most reviled creatures on this planet, sad, but true.  Maybe we can change the world in a little way by spreading the wonder of our little friends.  We will meet on line and at memeber's houses to swap stories and just have fun!

results.description:
This is a group for people to experience board games like they've never seen before. Not like Monopoly or those other games you played as a kid. I'm talking real board games, from competitive play, to co-operative play. From games like Ghost Stories, Arkham Horror, Tales of the Arabian Nights, Carcassonne, Catan and a variety of other games, owned either by the host or the guests.

This group does not have a meet-up location, and is created to for two purposes; (1) the potential to create a group, that meets up regularly introducing people to new board games, and (2) to allow people to create their own groups of friends and utilize the message boards to find other people to share their interests with.

SPONSORED by Toys n Things:

Members can enjoy a ten (10) percent store discount on all purchases (except beverages and tournament fees), access to their game library which people can use anytime they want to play, and access to their open gaming area. If you'd like to host any meetups at their store, please contact the Organizers and the owners Evan and Michelle.

topics.name: Trans/Gender Queer, queer and queer friendly peeps

results.description:
This is a community for Boston-area queer polyamorous women. Queer includes bisexual, lesbian, transgender, intersex, kinky, questioning, curious etc - I like it so that I don't have to come up with a laundry list of descriptors and risk leaving anyone out!

results.description:
Welcome to The Northeast Cryonics Group! This Group is intended to provide a medium for those interested in cryonics or other recovery, regenerative and longevity technologies to connect, share information, and coordinate geographic socials or working groups of like-minded individuals. This group includes but is not limited to people enrolled in cryonics programs.

This group is open to anyone interested in cryonics - its appearance and use in fiction, its social and environmental aspects, and the current state of this technology. There is room enough here for any engineer and artist, maker, nerd, futurist or fan.

Our primary focus is to provide information, clarify media interpretation, and give a clear message to interested parties, from those who are active participants within or subscribers to a cryonics provider, as well as their families and friends.

The Northeast Cryonics Group maintains an advocacy role for individual choice and foresees a positive future in which technology surpasses human limitation. See you forward!

Resources:

Kriorus - the first cryonics company in Eurasia

http://kriorus.ru/en/node/2

Suspended Animation, Inc.

http://www.suspendedinc.com/

Alcor Life Extension Foundation

http://www.alcor.org/

The Cryonics Institute

http://www.cryonics.org/

Documentary "Immortali" by Francesca Fini  -  http://www.francescafini.com/

SENS: Strategies for Engineered Negligible Senescence  -  http://www.sens.org/

ACS - American Cryonics Society -  http://www.americancryonics.org

Additional Information:  -  http://www.alcor.org/FAQs/index.html http://www.alcor.org/sciencefaq.htm

results.description:
Building community for lesbians and bisexual women over 40

Ova4D is a social group for lesbians and bisexual women born women, over the age of 40 in the Boston, MA area. We're all about building community, supporting each other, and having fun. Members may post social events for our community on our message board, and propose “meetups” via email to the Organizer. Please do not post political comments, items promoting a business, or anything unrelated to our purpose.

To become a member...

Please answer the profile questions and confirm that you are a lesbian or bisexual woman born a woman, over the age of 40.

Sponsor us!

We welcome sponsorship from businesses and for-profit events relevant to our demographic. For more information, please email the organizer. Please do not post for-profit ads to the message board.
results.name: Ova4D

results.description:
The Zeitgeist Movement is an explicitly non-violent, global sustainability advocacy group currently working in over 1000 Regional Chapters across 70 countries. The basic structure of The Movement consists of Chapters, Teams, Projects & Events. Overall, the Chapters are essentially what define the Movement and each Chapter works to not only spread awareness about the roots of our social problems today but also to express the logical, scientific solutions and methods we have at our disposal to update and correct the current social system and create a truly responsible, sustainable, peaceful, global society. Working through global and regional educational projects and community programs, the intermediate goal is to obtain a worldwide movement, essentially unifying the people, regardless of country, religion or political party, with a common value identification that we all invariably share, pertaining to our survival and sustainability.

It is the assumption of The Movement that the educational/activist pressure generated, coupled with what is currently a failing social system, will inhibit and override the established political, commercial and nationalist institutions outright, exposing and resolving the flaws inherent. It is our view that the traditional mediums of politics and commerce as forces for change will not obtain the goals needed to make our social system sustainable and humane for they appear to be born out of the same traditionalist, flawed logic that has created the problems as they stand.

The transitional goal, once such a global presence and pressure is obtained, is to implement an economic model that follows a truly scientific train of thought with respect to the technical factors that allow for human propensity, public health and environment responsibility over generational time. This new model, since it is based upon Resource Management and Natural Law (Science) as the logical starting point for all decisions and processes, is often referred to as a "Resource-Based Economic Model". However, the realization of this direction is not that of an institution but of a train of thought - the train of thought of objectively applying The Scientific Method for Social Concern and allowing its natural emergence to flourish without limitation as new efficiencies present themselves.

General Observations:

In the view of The Movement, the society today has become increasingly detached from the physical world, with techniques of production, distribution and social ordering that have little to no relationship to the environment, or the current state of scientific knowledge with respect to public health and sustainability.

Cyclical Consumption

For instance, our use of a profit based, "growth" driven monetary system has become one of the greatest destroyers of the natural world and sustainable human values. The entire global economy requires "cyclical consumption" to operate, which means that money must constantly be circulating. Thus, new goods and services must be constantly introduced regardless of the state of the environment and actual human necessity. This "perpetual" approach has a fatal flaw for resources as we know it are simply not infinite. Resources are finite and the Earth is essentially a closed system. To assume the need for constant consumption to keep people employed and hence the market system going is eco-cidal on a finite planet. The true goal of an economy, by definition, is to strategically preserve and create efficiency. The system today demands the opposite.

Infinite Growth

The Monetary-Market Model is based upon money being treated as a Commodity and its origination from Debt; sold for Interest Income. This is a "Ponzi Scheme". Each time this Commodity (Money) is sold (Bank Loans) it needs to be paid back (Debt) with more money charged as a fee for profit (Interest). The problem is that the Interest Value required to settle the debt does not exist in the Money Supply outright. In other words, Bankruptcy and Default are not byproducts - they are inevitable – as there is always more debt outstanding than money in existence. This creates severe, offset monetary scarcity that oppresses many people on many levels.

The Value of Scarcity

Likewise, the intents inherent within the monetary system derive a strategic edge from scarcity. This means that depleted resources are actually a positive thing for industry in the short term for more money can be made off each respective unit. This is contextual to the monetary law of Supply & Demand and hence "Value" in economics. It creates a perverse reinforcement to ignore environmental problems and the negative consequences that create scarcity; not to mention reinforcing technically unnecessary human deprivation. This system does not/can not meet the needs of the many because it isn't financially efficient to do so.

Problems/Inefficiency = Profit.

Similarly, the system also requires problems/constant consumer interest in order to work. The more people who have cancer or cars that breakdown, the better the economy due to the servicing of those problems. Needless to say, this also generates an inherent disregard for human well being and the environment. Sustainability, efficiency, and preservation are the enemies of this model.

Cost Efficiency & Irresponsible Obsolescence

There is also the Cost Efficiency mechanism that demands cutting expenses to remain “competitive” in the marketplace. Every single product created by a corporation today is immediately inferior by design for the market requirement to cut creation costs in favor of lowering the output "purchase price" to maintain a competitive edge automatically reduces the quality of any given item by default. It is impossible to create the "strategically best"/long lasting anything in our society, which translates into outrageous amounts of wasted resources and time. Likewise, this same mechanism is reinforcing the environmental disregard, depletion, and pollution that we see as a constant in the world today… among other issues.

Waste & Oppression of the Human Resource

As far as Occupations today, we need to ask ourselves what the point is of a given focus and why it is necessary. The fact is, most jobs today are not directly related to the actual necessities of life. Rather, most are artificial concoctions created in order to keep people employed so they can maintain purchasing power in an environment where our technology continues to expand exponentially, displacing humans from the production force.

It is a common statement in politics today to hear about "creating jobs". Well, in theory, an occupation could be created where people are paid to sit in a room and test chewing gum all day, everyday... but is that a viable use of the human mind? Should we relegate our mental capacity to simple any so called job due to mere "economic" reasons, regardless of what it actually contributes to personal and/or social development? This becomes even more bizarre as a train of reason when we realize that Mechanization not only frees us from labor, it is actually more efficient and productive due to the exponential advancement of science and technology.

On a different level, the very reality that each human being is required to be put in a position of servitude to a corporation or client in order to gain income to purchase the necessities of life not only perpetuates the waste of the human mind and human life, it is also a form of oppression – slavery. If we combine the aforementioned "Infinite Growth" point above regarding the Debt pressure that is build into this system, we see that the combination of the guaranteed Debt imbalance and the requirement to submit to Labor, regardless of its purpose/effect, in order to gain monetary income to survival – is a structural form of oppression against the lower classes (who hold the most debt and need for more period income).

As noted, advancements in science and technology have shown that we can automate a great deal. The more we have applied mechanization to labor, the more productive things have become. Therefore, it is not only negligent for us to waste our lives waiting tables, working at a bus station, fixing cars, or other repetitive, monotonous jobs, it is also entirely irresponsible for us not to apply modern mechanization techniques to all industries that it is possible for, apart from strategic resource management, this is a powerful way to achieve balance and abundance for all the world's people, thus reducing crime generating imbalances.

The fact is, the Market System cannot maintain itself with any viable integrity anymore for corporation will continue to save money through automation, displacing human labor- which also displaces purchasing power, continuing the inevitable loss of "growth" that defines this system.

In the end, today’s society now has access to highly advanced technologies and can easily provide more than enough for all of the earth’s people. This is possible through the implementation of an economy based on scientific resource management and applying modern methods. This is the purpose of The Zeitgeist Movement- to create a global awareness to thus transition into a new, sustainable direction for humanity as a whole.
results.name: The Zeitgeist Movement Massachusetts Chapter: Mass Awakening

In addition to the social networking, as well as enhance your Jewish experience, be a part of creating a platform for Jews to meet other Jews of like minds and souls, that ideally will land their Bashert.

If you are in this age demographic and have friends that would like to connect and meet other members of the tribe, this group is for you.

Check out our upcoming events.....ON FACEBOOK THE CHAIS 30'S-40'S

results.description:
This meetup group is for people interested in learning Reiki and Reiki practitioners of all levels who wish to hone their Reiki skills. We regularly offer Reiki shares, student Reiki clinics and Reiki Refresher workshops focusing on specific techniques that will make your Reiki sessions more effective. We welcome Reiki practitioners from all paths!

Meet your organizer: Joanna Scaparotti (Reiki Master Teacher) has been practicing and teaching Reiki in the Usui Shiki Ryoho tradition locally since 2003. She specializes in training people who are passionate about mind-body-spirit balance and personal growth, and who have a burning desire to help others find their own healing.

Most of our events take place at The Healing Center, but sometimes we post about other related or Reiki events happening elsewhere. If you have questions, you can contact Joanna at 978-338-5571.

results.description:
The Young Jewish Families of the South Shore was featured in The Jewish Advocate, and on WHDH-TV Jewish Perspective ...

 

We are a group of young Jewish families looking to meet other young families in and around the South Shore of Boston.  We are located in Avon, Brockton, Canton, Easton, Foxboro, Mansfield, Norwood, Randolph, Raynham, Sharon, Stoughton, Walpole, and surrounding towns.

We are not a very religious group, mostly cultural and social.  Although, we may have a Tot Shabbat and Friday night dinners every once in a while, we will also  get together for drop in playdates( some, may be around a Jewish Holiday, others will be purely for fun), park outings, family potlucks, apple picking, both Mom’s and Dad’s Nights Out, trips to local area attractions and more... We meet at our member’s homes, at local Jewish happenings as well as local parks, etc...

We will have meetups at least a couple times a month, if not more.  We try to bring our families great programming and foster friendships that will last a lifetime.

This group is for the whole family.  So whether you’re Orthodox, Conservative, Reform, married to a non-Jewish guy, or married to a Jewish guy and not Jewish yourself, this group is for you! Consider this a mommy and me group with a subtle Jewish twist.

We welcome anyone who has at least one child under the age of 6! We’re here to create a fun and supportive environment to those looking to meet other families with young children.

We Look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Young Jewish Families of the South Shore

results.description:
Are you a job seeker or career changer who wants help networking to build relationships and get a job? Have you been meaning to get out there and network, but don't consider yourself outgoing and need some help getting started?

Join our friendly, supported networking group of Boston job seekers and helpful professionals. We hold monthly structured networking events designed to make networking easier and help you make connections. From working on 30 second elevator speeches to learning how to gracefully start (or leave!) a conversation, each month we'll practice one more aspect of networking and then put it into action.

The group is open to job seekers, career changers and any professionals who feel like they can offer advice and support for job seekers (like recruiters, HR professionals, wardrobe consultants, etc.).

results.description:

Whether you're a seasoned veteran or just paleo-curious, our meetups are an opportunity to gather, have some fun, taste incredible food, and learn from each other. We are one of the largest Paleo Meetups in the world!

We organize potlucks, lectures, cooking classes, farm tours, author Q & A/book signings, picnics, BBQs, movies, walks, hikes, movement sessions,  etc. Any member can suggest and organize a Meetup!

http://www.facebook.com/LivingPaleoInBoston

Boston Meatup _ FB page.

results.description: Do you care about what you eat? This is a group of folks who want to support local, humanely raised, environmentally sustainable, fairly traded, "green" food. Thinking about joining a CSA? Maybe considering a tomato plant on your balcony this spring? How bout a new compost bin for your backyard? Maybe you work on or own a farm in Massachusetts? Or sit on the board of a an urban non-profit that brings produce to people in need......or you're a policy student, interested in finding ways of lobbying for the small organic food producers. We're all members of a community of food-lovers!! So let's get together and do what we do best - eat!

results.description:
Mass Fun and Games is a social networking group for Meetup members who live in southeastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island. We get together and play different types of games as a way to socialize and meet new people. You don't have to be an expert at any type of game to join. We're all about allowing people to get together and make new friends.

Here are some games that we may play:

7 Wonders * Agricola * Alhambra * Arkham Horror * Carcassonne * Citadels * Cash N Guns * Clue * Dominion * Elder Signs * Forbidden Island * Forbidden Desert * Get Bit * Ghost Stories * Ginkopolis * Imagine If * King Of Tokyo * Kill Dr. Lucky * Last Night On Earth * Libertalia * Level 7 * Mah Jongg * Mice and Mystics * Munchkin * Pandemic * Phase 10 * PowerGrid * Rummikub * Seasons* Scattergories * Settlers of Catan * Small World * Smash Up * Space Hulk * Survive: Escape from atlantis * Ticket to Ride * Trajan * Tsuro * Tzolkien * Zpocalypse

Generally we play what is called German-style board games (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German-style_board_game). We dont tend to play the longer ones when we have large groups but they are available for play usually. They are a step more advanced than your typical monopoly, scrabble and risk games. We may have all played these games in the past but we dont anymore. If you wish to learn these types of games feel free to join us as we are always up for teaching new players.

Some of the games we play are played on Wil Wheatons youtube show Tabletop. Check them out here: http://www.meetup.com/MassFun/pages/Tabletop_Episodes/

** Membership is free, but note that by applying you agree to our participation policy.  Read more about the group here. **
results.name: Mass Fun and Games

Looking forward to meeting you! 

Shifra

Eric McInerney

eric@mcgolfonline.com

We hope that through this group, people will:

1) Enjoy fun events

2) Make new friends

3) Possibly meet a potential spouse in a safe, friendly environment. For total clarification, we are not a "singles" group and don't want to be. Everyone is welcome here. And we will not be organizing any "singles" events. But we do hope to provide a nice environment for people to mingle given the lack of such opportunities in the area.

Please join us for some awesome fun events!

- We expect all members to be respectful to each other. We will not tolerate any kind of harassment by individuals towards other members, whether in person or virtually. We'll meet to discuss various challenges (and joys!) of making cold process, hot process, liquid, and glycerin/melt and pour soaps. Among many thing's we'll exhange ideas, soapmaking techniques, troubleshoot soapmaking problems, and business related subjects. We'll have workshops to share various techniques and also classes to get you started. Join us, we're a friendly bunch!
results.name: New England Soap Makers

results.description:
Boston Armizare (formerly SSG Boston) is a martial arts group practicing an integrated system of longsword, grappling and dagger, taken from the early 15th century fighting manuals of Fiore dei Liberi, who wrote the earliest comprehensive system (L'Arte di Armizare) for teaching Historical European Martial Arts (HEMA) that has survived to the present day.  We also work from other historical Italian, English, German, Spanish and French manuscripts, working both in translation and producing our own translations and interpretations. At this writing, we have classes in Newton and Arlington/Cambridge.

Our students are a mix of experienced martial artists who enjoy the cross-training and interested brand new folks. Our beginner class works equally well for each, working on a combination of longsword, abrazare (grappling) and daga (dagger/knife) skills. We also host workshops with outside experts and periodic gatherings with other groups to exchange ideas, spar, and just have fun.  These skills are drawn from direct translation from our historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed.  Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of interpretation, drill, and both focused and open sparring. Intermediate and more advanced students continue their work on the core techniques of grappling, dagger and sword, and expand to other weapons like pollaxe or bastone, or combat in armor.

Start with a Foundational class (four classes and annual membership), which we offer ~5 times per year; after that monthly fees are $40/month/location.  Come wearing comfortable workout clothes & flat shoes (worn-out sneakers are best).  Men need groin protection (cup), but other equipment can usually be lent for a time.
results.name: Boston Armizare -- Historical Swordplay and More!

results.description:
BOSTON SECURITY MEETUP 

This Meetup group hosts monthly events to discuss security processes, techniques, and much more. Each event features engaging presentations from several security experts, as well as pizza, craft beers, and sangrias! Our numbers include security researchers, sysadmins, developers, entrepreneurs, students, and more! 

Join this group and attend our meetups to advance your knowledge of security practices and meet professionals in this field.

We are the world's largest and most active cybersecurity group: hackers, pirates, ninjas, thinkers, engineers, explorers, inventors, tinkerers, and more. We also have former NSA, Marines, Air Force, and private investigators. Come at your own risk =).





We're easy to find right off the MIT T.

Sales and Recruiters. We appreciate your interest in our events; however, in order to keep the focus on learning and having fun in a casual environment, we request that you not engage in marketing, sales, or recruitment business at our meetups. If you would like to attend or mingle with our members in a professional capacity to promote a product or recruit, please contact us directly about sponsorship opportunities through the Meetup site.
results.name: Boston Security Meetup

results.description:
Modern-Day Meditation®

Meditate: Open your heart, body and mind, Calm yourself, Think clearly and access answers for your life, and change in the ways you want to! Use the Modern-Day Meditation to help you evolve spiritually or to improve the quality of your material life. The Modern Day Meditation is a place to learn techniques to release and let go of pent up emotions and tensions, to find calm, to think clearly from your higher intelligence, and to receive solutions to life's challenges. 

Most importantly, you will learn to trust your own ability to access the Source of Love, and to find the feelings of love, peace and fulfillment which every human being longs for.

This is a four-part meditation for spiritual and material well-being: 1.) Open your heart to the source of love within. 2.)Calm your mind, senses and emotions. 3.)Think clearly and find the answers you need. 4.) Act powerfully to improve your life.

Deepen your spiritual connection - Expand and awaken your consciousness - Release stress and negativity - Access the qualities you need to achieve your spiritual and material goals - Connect deeply to Divine Presence within.
results.name: Modern Day Meditation: Boston

These meetings provide food, drinks, internet access, and an opportunity to collaborate and associate with like minded individuals who are looking to meet new people and have fun!
results.name: Meetup202: Boston Affiliate Marketing Group

results.description:
Description:

We host meetups at Inner Space Meditation Center in Harvard Square (www.innerspaceharvardsq.org)  and Retreats at Peace Village Learning & Retreat Center.

PEACE VILLAGE LEARNING & RETREAT CENTER --
EXPERIENCE THE TRANQUILITY

Enjoy a weekend retreat on a wide variety of topics in the mountains of beautiful Upstate New York, 3 1/2 hours from Boston.

PLEASE NOTE:  Retreats go from Late March until Mid-December. If you see no retreats listed, we are currently on 'Winter Break'  which is why no retreat meetups are scheduled during these months.  Stay tuned, if not yet~ you will soon see meetups scheduled at our Peace Village location for the spring!  It will be well worth the wait.

At Peace Village, some enjoy the opportunity for solitude, for silent
walks through the woods, and group interaction with like minded seekers.
Others find answers to questions about spiritual knowledge, spiritual
power, and the deep experience of meditation. Many have expressed
surprise at the complete shift in awareness that can take place in just
a few days.

* Discover new life tools through self work and group work in interactive sessions.
* Share with like-minded seekers.
* Take time for quiet reflection, relaxation, walks, and exploration of the beautiful grounds.
* Experience periods of silence and meditation.
* Study the practical aspects of spirituality through classes, exercises, and journaling.
* Enjoy the rejuvenating effects of a pure, serene, and spiritual environment with a vegetarian diet.
* Peace Village is a smoke free and alcohol free environment.
* Stay in comfortable rooms with private bath. In most cases, double accommodation is provided.
results.name: Meditations and Spiritual Retreats Group

results.description: Meet up for some fun, intermediate-level and Advanced rides in and around the North Shore. Explore new trails, get some exercise, and enjoy our natural treasures from a mountain bike! Anyone is welcome to join. Suggestions for future rides encouraged.
results.name: North Shore Mountain Bikers

results.description:
Hello,

results.description:
We are a  group dedicated to improving our photographic skills by participating in photo shoots, workshops, travel workshops and one on one tuition. We are open to all levels from beginners with point and shoots to professionals who want to learn new skills in all areas of photography from digital to film, from camera controls to lighting, and all the way to post-processing in Photoshop.

Led by professional photographer and qualified teacher, Ian Murray, who has over 40 years of experience, the majority of the meetups offered by this group involve high quality teachng in small groups.  For these workshops there is a fee of $20 and upwards depending on the subject, location and the group size.

We will regularly  offer  free classes and events and will provide occasional scholarships and free spaces for those unable to afford workshop fees.

If you are looking for high quality workshops with a great teacher and don't mind paying a fee to attend  then this is the group for you.  Ian has been widely published, including having his work selected  for inclusion in the book "Photos that Inspire". He has taught at several well known colleges and more recently at the ICA in Boston.  With over 450 successful events and workshops already held, this group is one of the premier New England photography teaching groups.  The classes and workshops invariably receive a maximum rating and rave reviews from our members.  

If you are looking for just a social gathering of photographers and are not looking for paid instruction you are very welcome to stick around and join our occasional free meetups - we love to hang out with other photographers!  If you are serious about improving your photography skills with some Top-class instruction at a great price, then this is the place for you.

Either way we don't charge a membership fee.

Read the group reviews and you will be assured that the workshops offered by this group are uniquely special and of a very high quality.

Please note that many of the workshops have a very strict limit on numbers and payment is required in advance. To maintain the high quality of attention provided by such a small group approach it is necessary to have a policy of no refunds or credits of any kind if you cancel or don't show. This enables the classes to be kept cost effective and keeps the cost down to a reasonable level for everyone.  Of course, if the class is cancelled or has to be re-scheduled then a full refund is given.
results.name: Photography Workshops

results.description:
Hello and welcome to the Metrowest Writer's Circle, a writer's group establish in May of 2010 based in Framingham, Massachusetts and dedicated to supporting aspiring novelists, short fiction writers, and poets through disciplined critique sessions. If this sounds like you, we'd love to have you joins us.

Currently, we meet on the second Saturday of every month at Framingham Public Library. Each critique session generally lasts about two hours and one or two works are critiqued.

THINGS YOU SHOULD KNOW BEFORE REQUESTING TO JOIN

  • MWC runs on an attendance-based system. This means the more meetings you attend, the more likely it is we'll review your work. New members still have ample opportunity to have their work critiqued.
  • The three words that embody our critique process are honesty, respect, and discipline.
  • MWC runs a biannual audit of its membership. Members who have not participated in the group for six months will be removed from the membership unless they request to remain in the group.
  • Despite how serious all these points sound, we're still a fun bunch of people, and have one or two social events a year. Writers need to socialize, too. :)
  • Curious about some of our members? Visit the Member Links Page.

 

HOW TO JOIN:

1) Send an approximately 13 line writing sample to meetup (at) aaleil (dot) com with 'Writing Sample' as the subject header.  You may also use the 'Contact Us' button to send your sample.

2) Click the 'Join us' button on the top right of the screen and fill out the membership form.

If you have requested membership and have not heard from us, make sure you have performed Step 1. If you have performed both steps and still have not heard from us, feel free to send an inquiry via the 'contact-us' button.
results.name: Metrowest Writers Circle

results.description:
Hopkinton Newcomers Social Club offers community members a way to meet neighbors, build friendships and contribute to the community through a variety of social activities and special events. New and established residents of Hopkinton are welcome. Join us to make new friends in a casual social setting.

The club plans monthly social gatherings for individuals, couples and families. Some of our interest groups have included Book Club, Ladies’ Night Out, Creative Neighbors Craft Group, Bunco, Scrapbooking, Couple's Events, Family Events, Gourmet Group, Around the Town, and a Walking Club. We also have offered Special Events planned by our Social Committee, such as our Annual Wine Tasting and Lobsta’Fest, and occasional community service activities.

HNSC is open to all residents of Hopkinton, Massachusetts, as well as to those with a business affiliation here. So whether you are new to town, or have lived in Hopkinton for years, married or single, with kids or empty nesters...we welcome you to join us!

Note: The Club has been on sabbatical for some time now. We are gearing up to get it running again so committee chairpeople are needed to help plan events. If you enjoy leading small groups, have a craft you'd love to share, or like to organize events, we need your help. Don't be shy! Come check us out!

 Please email me if you need more information.

 

Join us for FREE until the end of the school year!

This group was created from a small group of MetroWest Motorcycle Riders, but has grown to include the Greater Boston area, with rides departing from various locations.

Our main focus is to have safe, scenic, fun group rides and build camaraderie. You do not have to own a motorcycle to join, only have the desire to be part of a friendly group that has a passion for motorcycle riding.

Please review our About page to see important details which will help you decide if you would like to join our group: http://www.meetup.com/MetrowestRiders/about/.

Our rides vary from 10's to hundreds of miles, half-day to full-day trips, some have early kick-stands-up (KSU) time, other rides start later. The rides encompass many different road types and vistas. Some rides are planned and posted well in advance, and this group also serves as a great way to find riding companions for spontaneous and last-minute rides. Please feel free to use the Discussion Board to connect with other riders.

We hope you will join us.

Please post a recent portrait-type photograph of yourself so that we know what you look like and can identify you when you are meeting up for a group ride.

Have fun, be safe, and keep the shiny side up!

results.description:
The New England Aces (NEA) is a group for asexual spectrum individuals and allies that provides support in an open and affirming environment, builds community based on friendship and respect, and promotes awareness of asexual spectrum identities in the New England area through outreach, trainings, and collaboration with community partners.

NEA was formed in 2010 as a small Boston-based group and has since grown to more than 350 members throughout New England. In addition to hosting regular social and community-building events, NEA members have presented at conferences and workshops across the country and organized Boston’s first Asexual Awareness Week in October 2013.

NEA is committed to values of inclusivity, intersectionality, and social justice. We welcome members of diverse sexual orientations, gender identities, races, religions, nationalities, socioeconomic backgrounds, and abilities.

For more information regarding asexuality, please see the AVEN (Asexuality Visibility and Education Network) website.

See our twitter, facebook, or our website for up to date information on events, meetups, and general asexy news:

    Website: neaces.org

    Twitter: @newenglandaces

results.description:
We've been holding drop-in meditation circles here at Sacred Spaces for 10 years now! Fresh, alive and simple, they are touch points of sanity and happiness for many friends.

There are drop-in groups each week on Friday mornings at 9. We sit for about 40 (the time goes quickly in a small group) and then have a cup of tea.  There is no charge and donations are welcome.  They support these circle and the good energy, kindness and wellbeing in our neighborhoods and community.

If you've been meditating on your own, these groups can really jump-start your sittings. It's an amazing effect to sit with a group in stillness. If you're new at meditating, you can either just show up (it's easier than you might think because it's natural!) or, send a note to me and come a little early and I can give you some tips. I look forward to seeing you here!

Oh, and if you want to know more about Sacred Spaces, you can visit http://www.sacredspaces.ws/
results.name: Meditation at Sacred Spaces

results.description:
The Blue Hills & Beyond Hiking Club

One of the amazing things about living near the Blue Hills is that there are so many hiking trails that you can work a full day, take a part in a scenic hike after work, and still have time to get home at a reasonable hour! This Meetup Group will focus on doing that. This is a private group, however all adults are welcome.

ABOUT THIS GROUP - This is a group of fun and friendly people who share a common interest in hiking.  We pride ourselves the fact that we've taken many from the couch to the trail and have advanced to levels beyond their expectations all while having a great time with fellow hikers. To become a member you must have a recognizable facial photo of yourself that we use to identify you at our events along with a positive attitude to match our spirit :).


WHEN WE HIKE - We hike any day of the week all year long.  Our weekday hikes tend to be in the afternoon to accommodate after work schedules while our weekend hikes can start at any time.  We often have several hikes posted on the same day to accommodate different levels and skills.

WHERE WE HIKE - We primarily hike in the Blue Hills Reservation for the vast majority of our hikes.  Sometimes we may offer hikes in the greater Boston area.  However, rather than to re-invent ourselves we have partnered with one group that Random Group of Hikers which has proven itself to be one of the most successful hiking groups in New England focusing on more challenging hikes in New England and beyond such as the Adirondacks, Main, and the White Mountains.  Once you feel you've reached advanced Blue Hills hikes then be sure to sign-up with the Random Group of Hikers for one of their events.

Voluntary Membership Dues - There are NO membership dues to join this club.  However, donations are welcome for any amount.  Although it does cost to maintain a meetup group I choose to pay for that myself.  100% of the donations go towards door prizes at our annual anniversary hike and party.  As a thank you for those who donate you get a special title "Skyline Member" under your name on the site.

ABOUT THE BLUE HILLS - The Blue Hills were so named by early European explorers who, while sailing along the coastline, noticed the bluish hue on the slopes when viewed from a distance. More than ten thousand years before those Europeans arrived, Native Americans made their home in the hills. The Natives referred to themselves as Massachusett, or "people of the great hills". Eventually the Europeans began settling in this region. The colonists built houses and barns, cleared fields for crops and livestock and logged the hillsides for lumber.

In 1893, the Metropolitan Parks Commission purchased the lands of Blue Hills Reservation as one of the first areas set aside for public recreation. Today, the reservation is rich in both archaeological and historic resources. Sixteen historic structures listed on the National Register tell the fascinating tales of Native Americans, explorers, farmers, quarry workers and inventors. Additionally the Blue Hills Weather Observatory, a National Historic Landmark, sits atop Great Blue Hill, as a crowning feature.

The living treasures of the Blue Hills include flora, fauna and natural phenomena – from coyotes to copperheads, dogwoods to lady's slippers, and turkey vultures to dragonflies. Trails traverse upland and bottomland forests, marsh, swamp and pond edges, meadows and an Atlantic white cedar bog. A great variety of plant and animal life thrive in the diverse habitats, including several rare and endangered species in Massachusetts, such as the timber rattlesnake.
results.name: Blue Hills Hiking Club

results.description:
LESS IS MORE

LESS: stress, discomfort, tension, pain
MORE: ease, flexibility, fluidity, choice

When you drop a pin in a quiet room you can hear it more clearly than in a busy nightclub. Awareness Through Movement applies this principle to our sensory motor experience, exposing unconscious habits in body and mind.

By slowing down and clarifying fundamental biological movement patterns, new options for moving, feeling, and thinking emerge. Improve the quality of your attention in movement and experience a shift in the quality of your life. 

http://www.tiffanysankary.com 

http://www.facebook.com/artandfeldenkrais

results.description:
A writing group. An accountability group. A lamenting and rending of garments group. Every. Single. Week. We'd love for you to join us!

This is a basic get-it-done group. The first half hour we introduce ourselves, discuss our work, and make goals for the week. Then we get right down to writing. Did you know that putting several writers to work in one space creates a kind of bubble of focus and productivity? It's pretty amazing.

There is no ending point. People generally start wandering out around 8:30, but you can stay longer if you're on a roll. On the last Tuesday of the month, when we've finished writing, we wander over to a local restaurant to cap off a good month of productivity.

That's all there is to it!

results.description:
Meet with other web site administrators, developers, designers and business people who are interested in making their sites faster to get a better user experience, lower abandonment rates and more money.

Our Gold Sponsors:

Akamai® is the leading provider of cloud services for delivering, optimizing and securing online content and business applications. At the core of the Company's solutions is the Akamai Intelligent Platform™ providing extensive reach, coupled with unmatched reliability, security, visibility and expertise. Akamai removes the complexities of connecting the increasingly mobile world, supporting 24/7 consumer demand, and enabling enterprises to securely leverage the cloud. To learn more about how Akamai is accelerating the pace of innovation in a hyperconnected world, please visit www.akamai.com or blogs.akamai.com, and follow @Akamai on Twitter.

Instart Logic accelerates cloud application delivery for the world’s most performance-obsessed organizations. Its unique cloud-client platform and web application streaming technology solves performance challenges inherent in wireless connections and makes content delivery networks (CDNs) obsolete. Using web application virtualization in the browser, Instart Logic intelligently parses and streams content, providing a significant boost in web performance metrics like Document Complete, Start Render and Time to First Byte compared to vanilla CDNs.


New Relic is a software analytics company that makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution provides one powerful interface for web and native mobile applications and consolidates the performance monitoring data for any chosen technology in your environment. Our 250,000 users that utilize our cloud solution every day to analyze more than 690 billion data points per day across more than 4 million applications. When your brand and customer experience depend on the performance of modern software, New Relic provides insight into your overall environment. Learn more at newrelic.com.


Our Silver Sponsor:

 

 

Catchpoint radically transforms the way businesses manage, monitor, and test the performance of online applications. Truly understand and improve user experience with clear visibility into complex, distributed online systems.

Founded in 2008 by four DoubleClick / Google executives with a passion for speed, reliability and overall better online experiences, Catchpoint has now become the most innovative provider of web performance testing and monitoring solutions. We are a team with expertise in designing, building, operating, scaling and monitoring highly transactional Internet services used by thousands of companies and impacting the experience of millions of users. Catchpoint is funded by top-tier venture capital firm, Battery Ventures, which has invested in category leaders such as Akamai, Omniture (Adobe Systems), Optimizely, Tealium, BazaarVoice, Marketo and many more.

Our Bronze Sponsor:

 


 

 

Test faster.  Release Sooner.

Everyone wants to release the next hot app or bulletproof their website. But until now, it took a unique breed to thoroughly test them and to ensure they’ll perform at scale. That’s because functional and performance testing have traditionally been challenging, complex, costly and time-consuming. But not anymore. SOASTA is driven by a radical idea: Make powerful testing accessible to anyone. Do it in the cloud. Make it visual and far less complex. Deliver immediate actionable intelligence in real time. And incorporate testing for gesture and touch interfaces. Our SOASTA Platform, products and services are like no one else’s—uniquely innovative, flexible, fast, affordable and exceptionally effective. And we think that’s cool.

 

Our Gracious Host:

 

 

 

Wayfair.com offers a zillion things home – the largest selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points. With an unparalleled selection of more than seven million home items from 12,000 brands, Wayfair.com helps people find the perfect product at the right price. Our unparalleled selection and superior customer service coupled with the convenience of online shopping, makes it easier than ever before to find exactly what you want for your home. Other e-commerce sites within the Wayfair.com brand portfolio include AllModern.com, the leading destination for original modern design, Joss & Main, the fastest growing private sale site for the home, and DwellStudio, a lifestyle retailer known for groundbreaking design and impeccable quality in modern home furnishings.

results.description:
>>GROUP IS CURRENTLY CLOSED TO NEW MEMBERS<<

This is a group for writers of speculative fiction, a broad term that includes genres such as science fiction, fantasy, horror, steampunk, and magical realism. Speculative fiction includes such classics as Herbert's Dune and Tolkien's Lord of the Rings series, beloved youth favorites such as C.S. Lewis's The Chronicles of Narnia and J.K Rowling's Harry Potter books, and even contemporary mainstream works, such as Audrey Niffenegger's The Time Traveler's Wife and Margaret Atwood's The Handmaiden's Tale.

Our group meets regularly to critique original writing projects (novels, novellas, short stories, etc- no fan fiction, please). We don't focus on writing exercises; rather, we share already written projects (or portions of projects in the case of longer works) for reading in advance, and then critique them at our meetings.

At each meeting we critique approximately two pieces, depending on length and availability, and pieces are available in advance for download via our Files section. Part of our time may also include discussing craft, techniques for improvement, and preparing works for future publication.

We have also added regular informal writing nights, where members get together to just work, work, work on whatever ongoing projects they might have. And we schedule occasional meet ups for author appearances or conventions, social nights, and hold informal (fun!) writing competitions.

This group is open to writers with experience from amateur to published, but we're looking members who are serious about writing, submitting, and meeting regularly, as well as having a basic handle on the craft itself. To ensure this, we ask that everyone interested in joining please email a writing sample (for example, a short story or first novel chapter, preferably in your preferred genre) to the Group Organizer. Once you request to join, the GO will respond to you with information about where to submit this. (In addition, members who join up but don't visit the site for over three months and/or don't attend any meetings are removed in the interest of keeping our numbers reflective of active members.)

If you are a dedicated spec-fic writer who is looking for a writing group that will motivate you to keep working on a project, as well as providing useful critique, this is the group for you! We've been meeting regularly now for over three years, and are looking forward to many more!

To best benefit our writers, we keep our numbers low and limited to regular participants. All new members will be subject to a "trial membership" and asked to attend a couple of meetings before joining permanently. This is in no way meant to be exclusionary; we are simply looking for members who are good fits for the current (awesome!) group dynamic.

Please make sure to fill out your profile in it's entirety when requesting to join. If it sounds like you'd be a good fit, an Organizer will contact you with instructions on where to send a sample.
results.name: Boston Speculative Fiction Writing Group

Our members include martial artists who enjoy a combination of historical martial theory and practical sparring. We welcome both serious martial artists and curious students interested in learning about medieval combat.

This is the meetup group associated with the Boston Figurative Art Center, headquartered at the Vernon Street Studios in Somerville. You can join this meetup group online for free, and get information about what we're doing, and when. There is a fee for drawing and painting with us, and you can become a member of the BFAC by paying per month, which entitles you to lower cost drawing and painting sessions and events.

We are a group dedicated to promoting figurative art in the Boston Area, and to providing a community where figurative artists can meet, talk, and work together. We would like to help create a context for figure artists that we feel is lacking in the area, and by coming together foster a more visible figurative art presence in Boston.

Please visit our website at bostonfigurecenter.org for more information.
