results.description:
THIS GROUP IS FOR WOMEN ONLY:)

Looking for a better social life? New to the area? Have your friends moved away? Got married? Had kids? This group is for females who are  single, married or divorced, who want to get out and have some fun and make new friends. Hello, my name is Sue and I am the organizer of North Shore Women's Group. We are a fun loving "circle of friends", we are non judgmental, a group that is accepting of everyone.. I would best describe us as loose collared, casual jeans and sneaker type of ladies, who like to kick back and have fun.  Drama free.....PLEASE LEAVE THE DRAMA AT HOME, if you insist on drama you will be removed from the group!

It is time to make some time for yourself, find that sense of belonging with other women and even harder, find a group with similar interest. Or try something new with a new group and begin being a better you, that is our ultimate goal! If you are interested in meeting some friendly, fun, caring, down to earth ladies, this will be a great meet up group for you.

We have a wide range of activities/interest such as:  Foxwoods Casino, Comedy Clubs, Canobie Lake Park, visiting local beaches or searching out a new one, picnics, lunches/brunches, game nights at a local restaurant, participating in local fund raisers/charities, jet ski rentals, miniature golf, bowling, shooting pool, walking, hiking, geocaching, biking, workout partners, book club, learn a new hobby, attend local sporting events,  anything active, social and fun!

If any of these activities interest you, come join us and make some new friends. Do you have a venue, activity, or other idea for a meet up? This group will allow you to share your passion and interest. Each person is responsible for their add to the mix, if you craft feel free to schedule a craft event, etc. I want people to come together and share their talents. To post an event, please email the organizer and ask to become an assistant organizer.  No solicitations without prior approval.  Anything that looks to be a scam or has feedback on google as being interpreted as a scam will be removed immediately.

We ask that each of you contribute to the success of this group by encouraging participation and remaining active by RSVP-ing YES, NO or MAYBE on our website at least once in a three month period, or you may be dropped from the meetup group.

WHEN ATTENDING A MEETUP ....THERE IS A CHANCE THAT IT MAY BE A SMALL GROUP, BE AWARE SOMETIMES YOU HAVE TO ASK IS THIS THE MEETUP GROUP.  PLEASE BE AWARE OF THAT WHEN YOU SIGN UP FOR A MEETUP.  THE LARGER GROUPS ARE EASIER TO FIND.  SOMETIMES THERE WILL NOT BE AN ORGANIZER AND IT'S UP TO YOU TO NOTE WHO IS ATTENDING AND FIND THE GROUP.  THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION IN THIS MATTER:)

SPAM and unsolicited emails of any kind are not tolerated and is grounds for removal from the group. We will not tolerate unwanted emails, mass emails or gathering of members information.

IMPORTANT CHANGES TO GROUP ATTENDANCE POLICY......Please READ

9/12/10: UNFORTUNATELY we have had to change or attendance policy to the following:

Members who RSVP ‘yes’ but fail to show (a 'no-show') AFTER 2ND NO SHOW will be removed from the group.
Members must call Sue (978) 815-0258 to cancel when they change their RSVP to 'no' 48 hours before an event. Failing to do so will result in removal from the group.

Due to the size of our group we have had to eliminate plus ones on some meetups.  We recommend you have your friends join our meetup so they can rsvp when meetups are posted.

We've set these guidelines out of fairness to other members who can't attend an event when it fills up, as well as out of basic courtesy to the organizers, restaurants and fellow members who are expecting you.

NOTE:  The above attendance policy will be reinforced at the discretion of the GROUP ORGANIZER,

If you would like upload a photo when you join, it will help us meet and mingle easier at events and put a name with a face and this group is all about friends, this is a great way for us to get to know you, if not please put a picture of something you like that will also help us relate to you. I encourage you to also add 5 things you would like us to know about you.

Grounds for removal from the group:  Threatening behavior to any members or organizers, solicitation of good/services that have not been approved by the Organizer, Sue Collins.

Indemity Agreement: By joining our meetup group you agree to hold the North Shore Women's Group and it's organizer, Sue Collins, and Co-organizers free from liability or responsibility what so ever with regard to any negligent or intentional conduct of any third party including but not limited to Restaurants, Lounges, Social Venues, Tour Groups, Bus Company, Travel Agency, Hotels, Cruise Lines, Air Lines, Bowling Alleys, Movie Theatres and other meetup venues, etc., resulting in the loss of personal property, physical injury, monetary loss with regard to an event/meetup. In signing up, paying and attending any of our listed events you are in agreement to the above.  If you rsvp a guest to the event they are also in agreement to the Indemity Agreement stated above.

I AM ALSO POSTING MEETUPS RELEASE, IN JOINING NORTH SHORE WOMEN'S GROUP YOU ALSO AGREE TO MEETUPS RELEASE AS FOLLOWS: Release. Because we do not supervise or control the Meetup Group Meetings or interactions among or between members of Meetup Groups or Meetup Everywheres and other persons or companies, and because we are not involved in any way with physical transportation to or from Meetup Meetings or with the actions of any individuals at Meetup Meetings, and because we do not control Amazon.com, PayPal, credit card companies or other payment processing companies, and because we cannot guarantee the true identity, age, 3.3(b) (Meetup Everywhere Fees; New Meetup Everywhere Activation Fees), nationality of Platform users, and because we have very limited control, if any, over the quality, safety, morality, legality, truthfulness or accuracy of various aspects of the Platform you agree that you bear all risk and you agree to release us (and our officers, directors, shareholders, agents, employees, affiliates, subsidiaries, and third party partners) and Organizers and Creators or Hosts and their designees from claims, demands, and damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, suspected and unsuspected, disclosed and undisclosed, now and in the future, arising out of or in any way connected with your use of the Platform, your Third Party Transactions, our resolution of any disputes among users, and/or your transportation to or from, attendance at, or the actions of you or other persons at, a Meetup Gathering. results.description:
The worlds of hackers and journalists are coming together as reporting goes digital and Internet companies become media empires.

Journalists call themselves "hacks," someone who can churn out words in any situation. Hackers use the digital equivalent of duct tape to whip out code. Hacker-journalists try and bridge the two worlds.

This group is to bring all these people together -- those who are working to help people make sense of their world. It's for hackers exploring technologies to filter and visualize information, and for journalists who use technology to find and tell stories. In the age of information overload, all their work has become even more crucial.

This group aims to help members find inspiration and think in new directions, bringing together potential collaborators for projects and new ventures.

Please also check out our site at http://hackshackers.com, along with our question-and-answer site at http://help.hackshackers.com.

Help us build the future of media!

results.description:
Do you wonder why others are in satisfying loving relationships and you are not? Do you wonder what you're "doing wrong"? Are you confused about what “Intimacy” actually means? (No, it doesn't mean “sex.”) Are you frustrated with one-night stands or platonic dates? Are you ready to create the relationship of your heart’s desire? You deserve it! This Meetup group is dedicated to teaching you the very necessary skills of Intimacy that you need to create deep, long-lasting relationship(s). The end result? You will feel free to express yourself fully, receive others in a loving way and have the very best in communication skills (the most vital ingredient to creating lasting love!). Join us!

 

YOU WILL LEARN TO:

*Express yourself in ways that draw people to you. They will want to know you better.

*Be present with yourself and others, creating an interpersonal dynamic that provides safety and love.

*Feel confident when reaching out to meet someone new.

*Effortlessly create fun and easy connections with people.

*Create conversations that flow easily and naturally.

*Be your authentic self and let others truly see you.

 

Join this experiential Meetup and you'll be on your way to more Intimacy and love in your life!

topics.name: Healing loss of love, attract healthy relationship
Love Yourself and Attract True Love
Law of Attraction for Attracting Your Partner
Attract The Love of Your Life
Love and The Law of Attraction

results.description:
"Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all
the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." — Rumi


Has your love life been...

  • A series of unsatisfying relationships with Mr. or Ms. Wrongs?
  • Sabotaging yourself when meeting and dating interesting people?
  • Excessive conflict when in a relationship with a good person?
  • The frustration and loneliness of the endless search for love?


This Meetup group is dedicated to helping you discover your internal emotional barriers to finding love and what to do about them so that you can attract and keep the healthy love you have always longed for.


Some of these internal emotional obstacles include:

  • Being subconsciously attracted to the wrong kinds of people
  • Self-doubts and insecurities
  • Fears around love (many of which may be hidden from you)
  • Unresolved emotional attachments from past relationships
  • Limiting beliefs about yourself and what is possible
  • Negative relationship patterns from childhood


What you will get out of this Meetup:

  • You will learn why you can be strongly attracted to the wrong people and how to break out of this unhappy pattern so that you will be attracted to the right people
  • Discover your fears, blocks and limiting beliefs around finding healthy love
  • You will learn about a powerful technique (EFT Tapping Therapy) that you can use to quickly release your fears and limiting beliefs about being with the right partner.
  • Master a powerful force of the universe for attracting love! (the Law of Attraction)


Join this experiential Meetup group and you'll be on your way to finding the love of your life!

 

Please note: This is a brand new Meetup group. Events will be added once there are enough members to get started.
results.name: Keys to Attracting Love

results.description:
Hello -  WELCOME TO THE GROUP!! The intent and goal of this meetup is to nurture musical ability and talent and gain more theoretical and practical experience, and play out.  We go to open mics and have shows  periodically with other meetup groups and on some Sundays a jam/rehearsal to jam or rehearse for performances.  Music is a powerful force for good in the world.

Lets get together and JAM!!!  See list of standard songs in the Music Jam Lists

This group is for musicians and aspiring musicians who are looking to play with others and have fun ........developing skills for playing with a vocalist or band.  We can help develop guitar, bass, keys etc. techniques (reading a lead sheet, building a solo, hooking into the groove, jam, improvise, learn & CREATE songs, and learn and the dynamics of playing with a group).

We will also go out together and listen to live music around around Boston, and play at open mics.

Join us if you want to have a great time playing music with some great folks! We focus on Rock, Folk, Blues and Popular music.  We will take the first hour of the meetups if requested to focus on theory, practice, technique, instrumentation , arranging and other musicianship essentials.

This is a no pressure group. The group will concentrate on material appropriate for beginners and intermediates to the experience of playing with others and playing with a band. We will all commit to being patient, non-judgmental, and supportive. As we develop, we can go together and perform at open mics.

SINGERS, we especially will need you.

Hope to see you'all soon!

results.description:
Boston Women Connect (Service Mark, Massachusetts), formerly Women Entrepreneurs and Professionals Network is a professional community of success-minded women who own or run a business, or who are corporate or non-profit professionals and executives.

Who should attend: Women Entrepreneurs; Corporate, Non-Profit Professionals and Executives.

Why should you attend: To build strong business connections, To share ideas on business challenges and success; To enjoy and relax with smart, talented business women.

Networking Events facilitate networking with a focus on sharing and helping each other to succeed. This approach helps women to not only make great connections on the spot, but also fosters strong ongoing business relationships. Networking Events are held monthly, at venues in Boston-Cambridge, Metro-West or Metro-North area.

Business Workshop Events, held quarterly, feature Expert Speakers on pertinent professional and business development topics. Interactive learning sessions, these workshop events also incorporate networking to foster our business connections.

results.description:
The aim of this group is to help more people become aware of the power of minerals in the human body.

Today, we're living in a stress-filled environment and our mind and body require more nutrition on a daily basis than our ancestors did. Unfortunately, we're getting less nutrition from our food than our parents and grandparents did. Often excess hunger and cravings for certain foods people experience reflect the body's need for nutrients that aren't sufficient in the diet.

A major cause of the problem is that our farm soils themselves are very depleted in nutrients, and as a result, our foods (even organic) are deficient in major and trace minerals, which are also among the cofactors needed to utilize vitamins. Mineral deficiency is affecting our health and increasing the risk of chronic or degenerative diseases later in life. Supplementation is now necessary if we want to achieve even adequate health, however, there are issues of safety, absorption and efficacy.

Getting adequate minerals in the diet can be of benefit for people with ADD/ADHD, allergies, arthritis, asthma, depression, diabetes, digestive disorders (celiac, Crohn's, IBS, malabsorption), fatigue, headaches (including migraines), herpes, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, immune system balancing or strengthening, insomnia, mental clarity and focus, psoriasis and other skin diseases, stress, and autoimmune disorders (rheumatoid arthritis, chronic fatigue, fibromyalgia, lupus and others), weight loss, women's health issues.

This Meetup will be of interest to anyone concerned with preventative healthcare or specific health conditions, as well as healthcare practitioners of all modalities. Let's meet and discuss our options - food, herbal remedies, supplements and supplementation choices, food preparation methods, soil amendments, etc. For more information, see the "About" page and the files under "More".
results.name: Mineralize to Optimize Your Health

results.description:
About Us and Our Values:

The Humanist Hub is a place where you can connect with other people, act to make the world better, and evolve as a human being.

We are a center for humanist life — a nonreligious community committed to the power of human connection to help us do good and live well. We use reason and dialogue to determine our highest ethical values, we act on those values with love and compassion, and we help one another evolve as individuals, as we work to improve our world.

Founded in 1974 as the Humanist Chaplaincy at Harvard, we were a small organization serving Humanists, atheists, and agnostics at and around Harvard University for over 30 years. In recent years we have evolved into a hub for secular community-building activities at Harvard, in Greater Boston, and beyond.

All are welcome to join us every Sunday at 1:30pm! We also have many other public programs and ways you can get involved, on other days of the week. 

We are located at 30 JFK Street (4th Floor) in Harvard Square.

Check out our website: humanisthub.org.
results.name: The Humanist Hub in Harvard Square

results.description:
Entrepreneurial moms meet and network with each other. �Anyone who owns a business, wants to own one, is working on a creative venture, or wants to be around other businesswomen in Boston and surrounding neighborhoods can be a part of this Exchange. �You do not have to be a business owner yet.

This Exchange is about networking, helping each other through trials and tribulations, questions, problems, educating and empowering each other. �We will invite speakers and experts on interesting topics. �And, of course, we will discuss our kids, too!

results.description: The Greater Lowell Area Science-based Skeptics (GLASS) was started to help foster a healthy community of critical thinkers who gather to talk, eat, drink, game, and whatever else we do to be fun and social. We hold up the candle of science to shine light on the darkness of all things pseudo-scientific. If you've ever questioned the evidence for psychics, ghosts, creationism, or the efficacy of alternative medicines, then you might be a skeptic. Join us.
results.name: Greater Lowell Area Science-based Skeptics

results.description:
UX BOSTON

This Meetup group hosts monthly events to discuss UX processes, techniques, and much more. Each event features engaging presentations from several UX experts, as well as pizza, craft beers, and sangrias! Our numbers include designers, product managers, engineers and more! Join this group to attend our meetups and advance your knowledge of UX practices and meet professionals and others in this field.



We're easy to find, right off the MIT T Stop on the red line.


Sales and Recruiters. We appreciate your interest in our events; however, in order to keep the focus on learning and having fun in a casual environment, we request that you not engage in marketing, sales, or recruitment business at our meetups. If you would like to attend or mingle with our members in a professional capacity to promote a product or recruit, please contact us directly about sponsorship opportunities through the Meetup site.
results.name: UX Boston

results.description:
If you've ever wanted to confidently speak in front of an audience, and you'd like to sharpen your skills or become more confident at it, then you're going to like this.

The purpose of this group is to provide a platform for you to develop your material and practice it in front of a live audience. By doing this, you will become more confident and comfortable when doing any kind of public speaking.

You can be at any level of experience, and you're not limited to one type of presentation, as long as it's under 7 minutes. To illustrate, here are a few of the many types of presentations our members can do:

- Storytelling (either personal, business, or folktale)



- Short, informative speeches (5-7 minutes)



- Stand up comedy routines



- Your elevator speech for networking events

Our motto is - "Personal growth through public speaking". In other words, you'll learn how to be a better, sharper communicator by learning how to communicate your ideas to a small, supportive group of people.

Is this group for you? Well that depends. Let me ask you a few questions...

- Do you have a story from your life that you've always wanted to tell, but you're not sure what to do first?

- Have you always wanted to learn how to do public speaking, or perhaps overcome your fears around it?

- Do your friends tell you you're a "ham" and that you belong on stage?

- Do you have some life lessons that you've learned, and would like to share with others so they can benefit too?

If you said yes to any of these questions, then this group could be just what you've been looking for. Come join us.
results.name: Personal Growth Through Public Speaking

results.description: Music Together is a 45 minute music and movement class for families with children ages newborn through five years.  If you've never tried a class, now is the perfect time.  Come sing, dance and play instruments with us.  Music Together classes are based on the belief that all children are musical and that parental involvement is the key to a successful early childhood music education.
results.name: Music Together of Blackstone Valley

results.description:
We are the Boston Chapter of the ASGA (American Singles Golf Association). The ASGA is a National organization comprised of many chapters and thousands of fun people throughout the country. The Boston Chapter was established in 2010 and our membership is growing everyday! If you are single, enjoy the game of golf, and socializing with a welcoming and great group of people, this is certainly the place to be. We schedule golf events around the Boston area every weekend as well as many social-only get togethers in the off season.

Meet Up is a tool we use to announce scheduled events and to let singles know more about us. Non ASGA members are most welcome to join one of our events as we are about promoting the game and engaging people who share a common interest. We guarantee that after you participate in one of our events you will become an ASGA member since membership provides many benefits. Not only will you be able to participate in local events on a continued basis you can sign up for multi-chapter and nationally scheduled events as well. Several National ASGA events are scheduled through the year which bring you to great golf venue locations such as, Pinehurst, Ireland, Scotland and yes Hawaii. And, since so many members from all chapters sign up for these events you cannot beat the price. Single golfers from all player levels, beginner to expert, are welcomed so join us!  If we have convinced you already and you wish to become an ASGA member now please visit our National website at www.singlesgolf.com. The current annual dues fee to join is only $79.00. Sign up for the Boston Chapter to begin to take advantage of all the ASGA has to offer. FUN, FELLOWSHIP, AND FAIRWAYS await and we are looking forward to meeting and playing with you and of course enjoying your company at the 19th hole!!!!

Playing a golf round with other singles is simply a great way to spend your time!!!!

PLEASE NOTE: Effective August 1, 2012, non-ASGA members who sign up for a posted event will be required to pay a surcharge for event participation. To forego this expenditure go to singlesgolf.com to register as an official member.
results.name: Boston Chapter -American Singles Golf Association®- ASGA

results.description:
This is a community site to share health insights that we have learned over the years. We are all experts on aspects of health, illnesses or our recovery. We can agree that we are not short of information but the "know how" to put it all together and the community to help us keep healthy and focused.

This meet up is primarily devoted to helping people develop healthier habits and getting rid of old habits that no longer serve our purposes.For smokers, quitting tobacco is THE key change needed  to lead a healthier life. Tobacco use is the single cause of preventable death disability and disease!
Another aspect to being healthy is looking after our mental health, our way of thinking. You will find some resources on the meet up that addresses common conditions like depression. (More specific info on depression anonymous meet up site) I hope you find this site a helpful one.

Feel free to call 508 293 1785 if you would like to be a contributor or have community lectures to post.


Siobhan

results.description:
Project Freerun covers all bases of Parkour and Freerun Coaching. Over the past years we’ve take inspiration from traditional Parkour, Ninja Warrior, Olympic Lifting and even The Marines Training to develop a curriculum that will not only highlight every fundamental step of Parkour and Freerun, but craft the student to train safely and progressively. We have a saying in Parkour – Être fort pour être utile - To Be Strong Is to Be Useful. This perfectly encapsulates what Parkour is about, adapting the human body to whatever challenges it’s presented with.

What is Parkour?

Parkour is a non-competitive natural method to train the human body to be able to move forward quickly, making use of the environment that's around us at any given time. This 'art of displacement' requires neither specific structure nor accessory for its practice. The body is the only tool. It's an athletic discipline accessible to all, because it combines all the natural skills of the human body: running, jumping, climbing, etc. It's a utility sport that permits exploration of the potential offered by your body. It's about being able to face the obstacles with which you are presented, whether they be in the natural environment or in the urban environment, in a search for movement that combines effectiveness and control.
results.name: New England Parkour and Free Running Group

I would also like to include a charitable element to our group. There are many organizations such as Project Linus, Warm Up America, Rosie’s Place and the Pine Street Inn that are in need of hand made items such as squares for afghans, scarves, hats, mittens and blankets. results.description:
We are a network of neighbors and friends dedicated to local food, good eating, and building community.  We are based in the Whipple Hill area, which is the junction of Winchester, Arlington, and Lexington but have members from a wide area.  We rely on farms we know and our own gardens to get food on the table year round, using food traditions that unlock nutrition and taste unknown in the industrial system.  If this sounds like you, please join our group!

Our cooperative structure efficiently bridges the gap between the seasonality of local harvests and the eating of a whole diet based on them year round.  At the same time we advance our own knowledge as food artisans, experience the joy of creating and sharing, contribute to regenerating the local economy, and participate fully in the relationships upon which the local food system is based.  

Our products derive from such sources and methods as dairy cultures--buttermilk, creme fraiche, yogurt, butter, cheese, kefir and whey; lacto-fermentation--sauerkraut, kimchi, sour pickles, sodas, beet kvass, and more; scoby or yeast culture--kombucha tea, vinegar, hard cider, ginger beer, water kefir, sourdough bread; and other preservation methods such as freezing, dehydration, covering with olive oil, and canning.  

Clearly, one person cannot keep all that up alone, which is why we need you!  Here's a quote from an article that could well be the group credo: "We envision a society where every household has a speciality, be it soda or sauerkraut, soap or stock, bread or soy sauce, that they make in quantities sufficient for five or ten households--precisely the quantity that maximizes efficiency without compromising quality."

We meet in small groups to learn from and support each other in specific food preparation tasks that will extend the season of a quantity of local farm produce or otherwise transform a raw ingredient into a product ready for the kitchen or table.  Members can provide support in many different ways besides helping in the kitchen, including obtaining the raw ingredients fresh and economically, providing the venue, or assuming childcare responsibilities.  

Trade may be the focus of an event, in which members bring items to share, swap or trade.  As more of us learn the skills we share, and as we increase our reliance on the local food system year round, then with a little creative organizing it should be possible to coordinate a trade event at any time of the year that meets the needs of all participants.  

Finally, by pooling our resources we can support local farms, leverage our ability to buy in bulk and save, and pave the way to create new jobs and enhance our own livelihoods within the local food system.
results.name: Whipple Hill Food Preservation and Exchange

results.description:
Jazz in the City is a group for local jazz aficionados, which introduces you to the finest musicians performing at some of the most elegant venues in cities around the globe.

The group’s organizers manage, book and produce both established and up-and-coming recording artists, so we have our finger on the pulse of the jazz scene!

We started this group because we want to share our passion for jazz with other fans. However, the group is not exclusively for jazz connoisseurs. Anyone who has an interest or would like to just sit, listen, and maybe sway to some great jazz tunes, can join us as well.

We will endeavor to offer our members live jazz events without a cover. However, in cases when we can’t, we will try to broker with clubs and venues special reduced admission fees for our members.

In order to become a member of our Jazz in the City Meetup group, we ask you to pay nominal membership dues of $10 per year. Any way you look at it, it’s a great deal – where else can you listen to top-notch live jazz in the best venues (and meet other fans while you’re at it) for mere pennies per event? And, you will receive additional benefits and discounts from our various partners and sponsors throughout the year. So your $10 really goes a long way and is a pittance, all things considered! Join us today.
results.name: Jazz in the City Boston

results.description:
The Boston Ethical Community is a non-theistic humanistic religious and educational fellowship inspired by the ideal that the supreme aim of human life is working to create a more humane society. Together we develop our ethical ideals, celebrate life's joys, and support one another through life's crises. We work for the improvement of our world and for the future of our children. Membership is open to those who agree with our principles regardless of race, religion, or national origin.

As ethical humanists, we believe it is important to understand the complexity of modern life. We live in a changing society and we want to help it change in a way that is helpful to humanity. Like traditional religious groups, our values are important in our lives and social actions, but they are not limited by dogma or tradition.

The Ethical Society is part of the larger Ethical Culture movement whose member societies are joined together through the American Ethical Union, headquartered in New York, NY, which has about two dozen societies in the U.S. The AEU belongs to the International Humanist and Ethical Union with branches in about 100 countries worldwide.

We hold Sunday Platform Meetings in the Humanist Hub, 30 JFK St. on the 4th floor, Cambridge, Massachusetts each Sunday from 10:30 A.M. to 12:30 P.M. on a more or less academic calendar. Meetings are free and open to the public. Platforms include a featured guest speaker and discussion, readings, and music. We cover a wide range of social, political, environmental, emotional, and interpersonal issues - including matters of war, peace, and justice.

We also give a series of short courses called the School for Ethics that explore ethics in society, in personal relationships and in the arts. We present an annual Humanist of the Year Award each Spring.

We also have a range of social events, including potluck suppers, nature walks, book discussions, and a movie group.

For more information, visit our website: www.BostonEthical.org
results.name: Boston Ethical Community

results.description:
Enjoy traveling with other fun and easy going people who always Look On The Bright Side!

Offering weekend, week long, and day trips!
 This group is primarily for singles but couples are welcome.

We're having lots of fun! We've been to The Amalfi Coast Italy, The Azores, Ireland, Vermont, Maine, Cape Cod, Mystic CT, Nantucket, Bermuda, Quebec City, Florida and the White Mountains in NH. Get in on the fun and sign up for a trip now!

 

This group is for you if...

  • You are a positive person who likes to have fun with other healthy minded singles and couples.
  • You are computer literate and can easily sign up for events and pay online without assistance.
  • You are able to communicate well via email without the need to speak to someone on the telephone.
  • When you attend events, you leave your personal issues at home and bring your upbeat, positive attitude with you. This could be grounds for removal - see below*
  • You like to have a whole lot of fun and you "always look on the bright side of life"


The goal of every trip is for all attendees to enjoy their time away.
If just one person talks about their personal problems to another, it is energy draining and depressing to that member and it can ruin the whole trip experience for them.  As the Brightside Travelers’ Meetup Organizer, I try to do everything in my power to assure a positive, fun time for all attendees and by making it clear to all members that we do not bring our personal problems on vacation with us, we do not complain or act rude to others (especially service professionals such as wait staff, hotel workers, etc.), and we do not need others to take care of us. We are self-sufficient and enjoy having a good time. We always look on the Bright Side!

P.s. People often ask me if I am a Travel Agent and the answer is no. I just enjoy putting trips together; it comes natural to me and I love to travel. However, my passion for traveling and organizing trips has helped me land a job of becoming a Tour Director with professional Tour Companies. So when I'm not planning/organizing a trip with my meetup groups, I am off working as a Tour Director some place around the US and Canada.
results.name: Brightside Travelers

results.description:
Open Awareness Sangha is a group of friends who meet for meditation and discussion on Monday nights, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. (The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138) The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group

results.description:
The BeatBrigade is an interactive drumming group operating through HandReach, a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping the poorest children in the developing world overcome severe debilitating trauma injuries. The BeatBrigade engages in therapeutic drumming that promotes community and benefits survivors of burn and trauma injuries. Outstanding BeatBrigadiers are invited to tour locally and abroad to drum with people of all kinds!

** Everyone is welcome to join and participate in the BeatBrigade

** Little or no drumming skill is required prior to joining -- professional music facilitators weekly teach BeatBrigadiers basic as well as advanced drum technique.

** Along with drumming together, trauma experts regularly give presentations at drum rehearsals to improve the team's clinical skills for working with trauma survivors.

** The BeatBrigade uses hand drums and a wide variety of percussion instruments, occasionally with string or wind instruments thrown in for fun!

** The BeatBrigade relies on every BeatBrigadier to operate effectively together. There's a certain charm in numbers, and the power to advance is in everyone's hands.
results.name: HandReach BeatBrigade

results.description:
SIE is an adult-oriented discussion-only group for mature and respectful adults.  If you are an adult who does not wish to read or discuss adult material, please exit now.

    Since this is a private group we request that all members have a clear, recent face photo on their profile. 

* SIE stands for Sexual Intelligence Exchange.  The aim of this group is to expand our definition of what is "normal" in the broad range of human sexual behavior by partaking in honest, mature conversations and by attending well-planned and hosted events. Any member can propose or host an event.

Sexually intelligent people possess:

    Curiosity and the desire to learn about themselves and other's human sexual behavior as a way of expanding understanding and acceptance.

    Insight into their own internal relationship with sexuality: They know themselves, specifically the complex, inner landscape of desires which may include both genuine, healthy impulses and painful, destructive myths about sex that have been absorbed from our families, media messages, and our own painful experiences.

    The Ability to Connect: Sexually intelligent people know how to how to talk to their partners about their sex life and have sexual empathy - They are able to imagine vividly the emotional effect of their behavior on their partner.

    Scientific Knowledge: They seek accurate scientific information about sexuality - for example, the physical and mental health benefits of an active sex life - and are able to put that knowledge into practice.
results.name: SIE *

results.description:
The Boston China Interest Network (formerly known as Boston China Business Opportunities Network)is a group that promotes understanding and awareness of China's economy, business, and changing culture.

Since starting the group, we have expanded the purpose of this group to go beyond the realm of business. Some of our events will continue to be related to business in China.

We also have events that are more culturally or socially oriented., such as the weekly bilingual Mandarin-English chat group and the weekly bilingual Cantonese-English chat group at the Harvard T. H. Chan School of Public Health in Boston's Longwood Medical Area (LMA), near Brigham Circle.
results.name: The Boston China Interest Network 波士顿中国兴趣俱乐部

results.description:
Serlingpa Meditation Center

(http://meditationinmass.org/)

is dedicated to achieving world peace through following the Kadampa Buddhist Path. Kadampa teachings offer us special advice, so that we can learn to become happy and lead meaningful lives that have the power to greatly benefit others. It is a path of compassion and wisdom , with a great emphasis on integrating what we learn into our daily lives. You do not need to be Buddhist to benefit from Buddha’s teachings: this is ancient wisdom that remains strikingly relevant in our modern, busy lives. Everybody is welcome!


Serlingpa Meditation Center offers an extensive program of meditation classes, study programs, and retreats. The methods and practices taught at the center are suitable for all individuals, whatever your level of interest. By following Buddha’s special advice, we can relax our mind, dissolve our pain and fear, and become of greater benefit to others.

A typical class consists of a gentle relaxation meditation, teaching, discussion, and a concluding meditation. The meditations are guided and are suitable for beginners and experienced practitioners alike. Each class is self-contained so feel free to join at any time!

We offer ongoing meditation classes in New Bedford; Jamaica Plain; Providence, RI; and Portland, ME. In addition we also hold retreats, day workshops, and special events, all of which are open to everyone regardless of background or experience.

Everyone is welcome –  just drop into any class!
results.name: Meditation in Boston: Serlingpa Meditation Center

results.description:

We offer opportunities to meet other moms like you in Norfolk, Plainville, and Wrentham, Massachusetts via our organized playgroups and activities. We also offer a monthly Moms' Night Out and various volunteer and charitable opportunities to those who are interested. Our activities, play dates and meetings are held during the day and children are always welcome.

Membership in this meetup group is limited to members of the MOMS Club of Norfolk, Plainville and Wrentham.  Find out more about NPW MOMS at http://www.npwmoms.org/.  If you are interested in joining the club, please email us at npwmoms@gmail.com.
results.name: MOMS Club of Norfolk, Plainville and Wrentham

results.description:
Welcome Newcomers!

This is a weekly support group meeting for people with Hurts, Hang-ups, or Habits.

We celebrate God's healing power.   This weekly experience facilitates change in our lives. We open the door by sharing our experiences, victories, and hopes with one another. In addition, we become willing to accept God's grace in solving our life problems.

By applying Biblical principles, we begin to grow spiritually. We become free from our addictive, compulsive, and dysfunctional behaviors. This freedom creates peace, serenity, joy, and most importantly, a stronger personal relationship with God and others.

Welcome to an Amazing Spiritual Adventure!

results.description:
Who we are, what do we do, and why should you join…

Cloud9 Outdoor Adventures is, as the name implies, all about Adventures! We are a group of folks who enjoy taking Adventures with like-minded people. The trips that we offer will take us to places well off the beaten path and to places that you will want to explore and savor for a lifetime.

Have you ever wanted to see the sun rise over the ocean while being in total seclusion; have you ever wanted to Mountain Bike along old trails that were once trade routes? Have you ever wanted to leave all of the planning to someone else so that you can just enjoy the ride? If these are the types of things that you seek, then you have come to the right place.

Through the trips you will forge new friendships, see unseen places and have a lot of fun while doing it all. Trips may include food, lodging and gear transportation as described in the event description. We look forward to hosting many adventures including those centered around Mountain Biking, Road Biking, Hiking and Kayaking.

Scott
Cloud9 Adventures Organizer

results.description:
The Boston Synagogue is the only synagogue located in downtown Boston with Shabbat services 52 weeks a year plus holidays & Passover. Our mission is to serve the needs of the diverse body of Jews living in downtown Boston.

We are unaffiliated, post-denominational egalitarian, where both women and men are active participants in the service. There is an openness to all and it’s a place where people across Jewish denominations can make their own spiritual connections.

Besides holding weekly services, we also have monthly Friday Night Community Shabbat Dinners and a growing group for Young Professionals who meet monthly over wine & cheese to discuss hot Jewish topics.

We hold a variety of different adult ed classes, have a once-a-week Hebrew school for children starting at age 5, and much more!

All events take place at 55 Martha Road in Boston, MA - a quick walk from North Station on the Orange and Green Lines, Science Park on the Green Line, and Charles MGH on the Red Line.  Parking available.
results.name: The Boston Synagogue

results.description:
Are you a "mature" mother of a pre-school child who wants to connect with other moms? Would you like to make new friends for yourself and find playmates for your kids? Then join us!

Did you come of age during the Cold War and scandals like the Iran Contra affair? Did you spend hours watching MTV when all it showed were 24-hour music videos? Did you play with a Rubik's Cube or try to clear the last level of Pac Man? Did you ever have the hallmark "big hair?" Do you remember the original Pop Rocks and the "New Coke?" Can you do all the "arm moves" for Y.M.C.A.? And did you truly get tired of hearing your doctor refer to you as a "mother of advanced maternal aged?" (I did!)

If yes... then...

You should join other like-minded moms for playdates, coffee, lunch, free activities at local libraries (like story time, music shows, magicians) and other kid-friendly activities. We plan Moms' Night Out once each month for some grown-up conversation. Our calendar is bursting with fun activities that include kid-friendly outings, playground playdates, and library events. We welcome all suggestions for activities.

Our group is designed primarily for stay-at-home mothers of children from newborns to kindergarten who are able to take part in daytime events, but working mothers are certainly welcome. We plan some weekend events to accommodate those who can't meet during the day.

We welcome diversity and differing opinions, and hope that we can cultivate a close-knit group of mothers connecting around their kids. Moms who share an interest in attachment parenting, breastfeeding, eating healthy and organic, co-sleeping, the "no-cry sleep solution," baby wearing, cloth diapering, green living, recycling, alternative or holistic medicine, or natural parenting are especially encouraged to join. But ALL are welcome!

Expectant mothers and stay-at-home dads welcome, too!

We hope this group can be a great source of support and friendship. If this sounds like a good fit for you and you live in the MetroWest Area or just beyond, we hope you decide to join us!


*This group has been listed as "private" in order to protect ourselves and our children from internet predators. We have a full calendar that is private until you join.
results.name: Metrowest Older Moms Network

results.description: A place for women who want to look great and feel fabulous.

results.description:
Looking for a place to practice yoga? Are you interested in exploring more aspects of yoga? Then come and take a class at Nirvana Yoga!

A guided meditation in motion, yoga is a place to explore peace and find relaxation through a physical practice. Nirvana yoga classes are taught by Helen Coyne, a lifelong dance and fitness enthusiast who has been practicing yoga and Pilates for more than a decade.

Trained to teach in the Yogaworks® method, Helen blends the Iyengar and Ashtanga traditions to create a vinyasa flow with a strong emphasis on alignment principles in a practice called Energetic Flow. Each pose is designed to help significantly improve your posture, increase your range of motion and flexibility, strengthen joint stability and mobility, and enhance the function of every system in the body.

With detailed instructions for every pose and skillful sequencing, Helen will guide you to a deeper understanding of yoga and the benefits to your body, enriching your yoga practice. By moving through a series of vinyasa flows, maintaining longer postural holds, and linking breath to movement, you'll ignite your body’s internal heating system, allowing for deep tension release and stimulation of the relaxation response.





visit: www.nirvanayogaclass.com for more details.
results.name: Nirvana Yoga in West Medford

Most (but not all) activities and events are in the Acton area; play dates, Mom's Night Out (MNO), family-oriented get togethers, playground meetups, etc. We also do a lot of social gatherings for moms (without the kids).

Hope to see you soon!

results.description:
-Mission statement: It is my sincere hope this club will be a haven for those who have tried to find worthwhile people in all the usual places (clubs, bars, parties, conventions) and only came up empty. I want myself and the club members to truly take life back and live a sensible, humane, warm, compassionate, artful, and full life again in this country. I am forming this club largely as a reaction (and hopefully solution) to the declining quality of human interaction in the US. I have my theories about why this decline is occurring, but I’d rather reserve talking about those for the club’s initial meeting.



-I would like the core focus and format of this club to be more intimate and low-key to facilitate interpersonal connections and meaningful conversation. I will have a topic, presentation, or discussion question to begin each meeting and we will see where the meeting goes from there. Certainly, more larger scale events such as film screenings and trips to museums or dinners out will be a part of the club too.





-Even though I am the organizer of the club, I encourage others to step up and lead certain meetings. Their particular passions and hobbies should be their guide for these meetings.



-And to conclude, perhaps a few anonymous posts on a website dedicated to people considering leaving the US sums it up best: “I want a place where I can live among the people and help and heal. I want a place for people to come lay down and rest awhile...” and “I'm just a regular guy wanting to focus more on the quality of my life than the incessant drive for more hours, less quality of life and higher fees, payments, charges by the utility, telecom, pharmaceutical, "health care", and education system monopoly near you.”

***Please Check out the Photos and forums section of this meetup page!!



----------------------



This club may be for you if:

-You’ve ever been called “an old soul” more than once



-You just know there’s something very wrong with modern American culture. More specifically, how the breakneck pace of technology that has become the wallpaper of our lives has made us less adventurous, loving, romantic, earthy, caring, open, and spontaneous. Instead it has made us feel blah, stale, disconnected, numb, unfulfilled, and distracted. But you also realize every age has its drawbacks and there is no golden age and you must make the best of any era.



-You don’t slavishly serve and identify with one political/philosophical/ideological/religious group because you know life is too complex and rich to see the world through only one lens. Besides, you know what it truly means to be open-minded: being open to give-and-take in a conversation and not being afraid to be wrong because you like learning worthwhile things from people.

-Your patience grows ever thinner for having to learn new technology seemingly every month.



-You are naturally suspicious this is a feel-good new age group. It isn’t.

 

-You understand that truly committing to anybody (be it friend or lover) is a risk and don’t shy away from the emotional ups and downs that it entails. That is, you don’t cling to the chic “misanthrope” tag because you are adult and brave enough to take risks on people and risk disappointment and hurt feelings.





-You have a sneaking suspicion that art is all that matters





-You constantly strive to simplify your life and think twice before letting more technology into it.





-You continue to be a good person even though you fully realize you may never receive the full reward or recognition you deserve for being one



-You die a little every time you see canned “inspirational” speeches by politicians/celebrities with the usual platitudes (“Live like every day is your last,” “Carpe diem!” etc)



-You’re fed up with the glut of entertainment and media for the 14-year-old male demographic and wonder where all the art and entertainment for mature, adventurous, intelligent, and sensible adults is.



-You wonder how much easier life would be if you were easily amused at mass entertainment like most people and not have to seek out more rarified art and entertainment to satisfy yourself



-You wish people who are jealous and/or intimidated of your rarified taste and intelligence would know just how difficult and isolating it can be to be that way and it’s not really that enviable.



-You realize that bad taste is essential sometimes. Plus it can be a lot of fun.

-You resent being called “dude.”

results.description:
Facilitated By:

Massachusetts CFIDS/ME & FM Association

Mission Statement:

Our mission is to support individuals with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFIDS or ME) and fibromyalgia and to provide educational resources so they may better cope with these conditions.  We will do this through open discussion, group support and occasional guest speakers who work in the field.

We aim to:

*Develop a safe, nonjudgmental support network between members so they may connect and offer support to each other.

*Foster empathy, understanding and a positive outlook.

*Offer a space in which members can share their perspectives and experiences.

*Expose members to a variety of educational resources.

Group Format:

1. Opening circle to check in briefly with each member.  Please be brief to allow each member the time to speak.

2. Presentation on a selected topic.

2. Discussion and group interaction.

4. Q and A

5. Closing and time to socialize.

Topics and Speakers:

We will present information about various topics related to fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome (CFIDS/ME/CFS).  Please provide us with your feedback regarding the areas of healthcare and pain care that most interest you.

Information:

For more information contact us at info@masscfids.org.
results.name: Boston CFIDS and Fibromyalgia Support Group

results.description:
Hello Guys and Gals

The group is just to have fun all time.





This group is aimed at spending week ends and free time with some fun filled group let be a on the rocks in pubs or salsa in clubs or movies in theatres or pot luck at some friends house or celebrating Indian festivals together or some sports or volunteering in some social service activities. exploring new places or lasts on birthday parties, A long drive along the coast, saying happy new year in the dark in the first minute of the new year etc etc ultimately anything that comes with a package of fun.

Why Singles ?



I just mentioned singles in the group welcome description because with my experience all married people they have less time for all these nonsense , kiddish activites , not just because they dont want to but they have other commitments to do.But if you are married and still feel the same thoughts to have fun and have time you are always welcome.

Why Indians ?



Because if it is generic than there will be huge numbers out there and there will not be enough time to have fun even if it is 24/7 then we may end up quiting our jobs :) Just that we might have lots in common to share no other intention, if you feel you also have lots in common with Indians and or interested to have more Indian friends and want to know more about them , you are most welcome to join the group.

Who Should Join ?

Those who dont have friends

Those who have friends but want more friends

Those who want to kill there time but not alone

Those who like having fun all time

Those who can get along in the group.

Those who want to get along with groups but dont know how.

Ohhh people come on there is no conditions to join the group everyone are welcome to join but be ready always for one or other meet up ......

results.description:
Are you a Christian adult looking to meet like-minded people who love to do fun things, fellowship, and enjoy life?

Whether you like movies, beaches, skiing, dancing, karaoke, dining, concerts, museums, sporting events, theater, hiking, rock climbing, kayaking, game nights, festivals, or just reading the Bible together... this is the Meetup group for you!

This group is set up for Christians - particularly singles in their 20's and 30's who live in the Greater Boston area - to connect with each other, share fellowship, and use their gifts to benefit the body of Christ and beyond. We will not exclude anyone on the basis of age, marital status, or geographical location. We will dance, we will sing, we will laugh, we will learn stuff, we will do things that matter, and we will have a great time... all of this in one passion, one voice, and one love for Jesus Christ!

Who We Are

- A group of practicing Christian adults who enjoy fellowship

- Kind, positive, encouraging, and uplifting!

- Welcoming

- Fun, silly, and eclectic

- Forgiving, because, well, we all blow it from time to time

Matthew 6:33 reads: “But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added to you.”

We are to seek God first before any other relationship or endeavor. This group doesn't focus on dating or finding your partner in life. Many of our members are not looking to date right now, and we want everyone to be comfortable. You are God's partner, complete as you are, and your status (be it single or not) gives you the opportunity to be of great use to God.

Don't be shy! Join us! We look forward to seeing you at our meetups!
results.name: Live Out Loud Boston: Christian Young Professionals

results.description:
Living On Purpose: Starting the Year with a Powerful Resolution and Resolve

Each year, we make a commitment to ourselves for ourselves: to change something. Or to give something up. Or maybe to start a new project, or learn something.

For most people, the coming year is going to be very important on many levels – financially, our relationships / interrelationships, and in our personal development.

And the New Year is a powerful time to create this change and prepare for the coming year. We can create the highest and most potent version of ourselves with a vision of who we have always known we were supposed to be.

When we live the life we were born to live: we tap into the powers of inspiration, will, dynamic energy and passion for living. We become unstoppable.

Sometimes is it hard to change: there are pressures from our lives: work, relationships, obligations, friends and society. Or habits that feel impossible to break. And sometimes, change feels more difficult than simply “suffering” the consequences of leaving things as they are. Or perhaps we need more will.

But there is knowledge about how to do this: it comes from ancient cultures and it’s been developed over centuries. It gives us a map showing us on how to make a plan and to harness energy to create stamina and power. We learn how to unleash inspiration, enthusiasm and self-confidence to help you maintain and follow through with all your goals!

This meetup will be a series of talks set to create the right environment to create a successful year – one of vision, commitment and exceptional results. We will study exactly what you need to get support for your success in the New Year.

The individual talks in the series will be:

1. Creating a program for a successful 2011 using real goals. And in the beginning of the New Year, doing a powerful practice to make them a reality.

2. A review of the past year: what worked, what didn’t and what you want see different in the upcoming year.

3. Understanding specific astrological aspects of the coming year and creating an individual program: what is our outlook and destiny for the year.

4. Picking and prioritizing our goals correctly so we are working with our power and essence to create the life we were born to live.

5. How to manifest more energy in our lives to make the changes possible: the secrets of Aharata – a special lineage of empowerment

6. How to protect what you’ve created in your life from stress, negative relationships, aggressive behaviors of others, pressure from people and the culture around us as well as how to work with ourselves to remove the obstacles to success: self-sabotage, low self-esteem, etc.

7. What will be the principles of financial success in the new coming year and how to use them in our lives: to maintain what we have gained and expanding our business or career!

The practice and program are simple but extremely effective– and doing them in the beginning of the new year – creates a preparation and intention for the coming year. When you start with an intention, empowered by knowledge, practice and support – you have all of the components to make your life more powerful, fulfilled and complete.

I hope you will join us on this remarkable journey of understanding our individual destiny and creating a toolbox of knowledge and practices to make it reality in the New Year!

THIS COURSE SERIES WILL BE TAUGHT BY POWERFUL AND EXPERIENCED TEACHERS TRAVELING THROUGHOUT THE WORLD, HELPING PEOPLE WHERE EVER THEY GO, TO BECOME THEIR HIGHEST POTENTIAL.

Each has a minimum of 10 years full time teaching, and each brings a unique aspect of the knowledge to creating the plan of your perfect life.

Blessings
results.name: The Art of Living Powerfully - Boston

topics.name: Seniors Who Love To Travel/find Travel Companion

results.description:
Welcome to the Women’s Travel Group

Hi, I am Janice Underwood, Owner of Flynn Travel & Tours, INC and Organizer of this wonderful group of traveling ladies!

This group is for DAY and WEEKEND trips and WEEK long travel VACATIONS, GETAWAYS.

YOU MUST BOOK YOUR LAND OR CRUISE VACATIONS WITH FLYNN TRAVEL & TOURS IN ORDER TO TRAVEL WITH US:)

CHECK OUT OUR FEEDBACK AND PHOTOGRAPHS FROM PAST TRIPS!  OUR REPUTATION SPEAKS FOR ITSELF....THAT'S WHY OUR MEMBERS ARE REPEAT TRAVELERS AND LOVE US!  WE PRIDE OURSELVES ON FAIR TRIP PRICING.

Why travel alone when you can travel with a group of women who share the same interest as you while you can also enjoy the company of other women, form friendships and visit beautiful TRAVEL destinations.

This is a perfect solution  and better than going on vacation solo, it’s easier, and safer being in the company of others and more fun!

This women’s only travel group was established to attract fun loving ladies, who tend to share similar interest, are open to new friendships and ideas. These women are also looking for travel companions, some of you might travel alone, others with a friend or relative. Our ladies are married, single, widowed and divorced, who are interested in traveling in the company of others.

Why not join us….make some new friendships, share some laughter, stories and create some new memories. Enjoy the camaraderie and security of being with a group of women, who knows you may develop  friendships that will last a lifetime.

WHAT WE ARE NOT....we are not a group that goes for super sale deals off season (Mexico in August)...I would not post a trip to Bermuda during high hurrican season, but rather in Mid June- early July when chances are better for better weather.  Same is true to International travel, we try not to travel on high peak dates, but maybe a little earlier in the season or later, after all who wants to see Italy in the cold/rain.  Also a lot of the super saver deals you see online ARE NOT available for group.

When filing out information for a roommate...PLEASE be honest on your questionaire form, we do not want to pair up a snorer with a non snorer, that would not make a good vacation for either!  We do get snorers and have others to match them with.  So again, please be honest!

The only age requirements we have is you must be 21 years of age. I have found that when I travel I end up mingling with all various age groups and sometimes have had the best time with girls in their 20’s and on the next trip a group of ladies in there 60’s or 70’s. Net, net age is not important, it’s the person within!

We’ll design all our vacations for women, including activities and accommodations.

We will try to chose vacations based on interest.

Your interaction in our meetup is very important. For this group to be a success we will need members to leave feedback, and responding to correspondence.

Please be respectful of others in the group.  Being disrespectful is grounds for removal from the group.

NO VENDORS are to be listed on site without prior approval from the Organizer, or you may be removed from this meetup.

NO TRAVEL PACKAGES can be sold to other members (ie you purchased a trip outside of our meetup and cannot make it).  Without prior approval from the Organizer, or you may be removed from Meetup.  This is for your protection.

All trips are posted with terms and conditions, when you sign up for the trips offered you are subject to the terms and conditions which you are agreeing to by signing up and putting down a deposit for the trip.  

On occasion members may list a trip they are attending to put it out to the group in the event they may wish to join that member at a destination.  If you are interested in that event you make your own reservations with the hotel or vendor, it is listed here for informational purposes only.

Women's Travel Group/Flynn Travel & Tours INC,  is in no way responsible for any lost deposits due to late cancellations or late final payments.

If paying by PAYPAL you are responsible for the fee's associated with your payment.

PARKING IN AREAS TO MEET A TOUR BUS:   Parking is at your own discretion, will anyone guarantee nothing will happen?  Absolutely NOT and The establishment, nor our group or the tour company will take any responsibility for your vehicle.  Any time we leave vehicles anywhere and carpool or travel you assume all responsibilities.  The lots are not guarded and you park at your own risk.  To date we have not had any issues anywhere we have parked.  If you want a guarantee then I suggest you get a ride to any of our pickup locations to board the bus.  The establishments are gracious enough to offer us to park in there lot at no charge.

Indemity Agreement: By joining our meetup group you agree to hold the Women's Travel Group and it's organizer, Flynn Travel & Tours, INC and Co-organizers free from liability or responsibility what so ever with regard to any negligent or intentional conduct of any third party including but not limited to Tour Company, Property Owners, etc. resulting in the loss of personal property, physical injury, monetary loss with regard to an event/meetup. In joining this meetup and signing up or paying or attending any of our listed tours you are in agreement to the above. If you rsvp adding a guest/s to an event they are also subject to the same Indemity Agreement.

results.description:
Monthly hypnosis group to help you create your ideal body and maintain a healthy-eating lifestyle.

Each month, you'll enjoy a group hypnosis trance and
you'll learn a cognitive behavior technique to help
manage unhelpful eating patterns.

Your facilitator: Kathryn McGlynn, Certified Hypnotist and Success Coach

Note: For your scheduling convenience, there is a morning and an evening monthly Meetup.
results.name: Hungry Minds : Hypnosis Weight Loss Group

results.description:
The purpose of our group is to get people together to learn and share information related to getting along in the great outdoors without a car or a radio or a barbecue grill. "Survival" means a lot of things to a lot of people and we'd love to hear your ideas on the topic. In the beginning we will probably get together infrequently, mostly for 2 or 3 night trips; the more people get involved, the more opportunities we'll have to meet up to talk and then go out to practice!

Imagine hiking into the woods with only a small day pack with gear, sleeping in a shelter that you built without tools, cooking food over a fire that you started from twigs, and leaving in the morning with only a few footprints to indicate anyone was ever there.  If you've ever wished you could leave the world behind and just head off into the woods, this is the group for you!

Skills you might learn with us include, but certainly aren't limited to:

Fire lighting
Shelter building
Survival psychology and strategy
Priorities of survival
Attracting attention
Use of sharp implements
Knife/Axe sharpening
Acquiring food
Basic knots
Improvised cordage
Wilderness cooking
Sourcing safe water
Camp craft
Basic stalking
Camoflage and concealment
Emergency first aid
Survival equipment selection
Wilderness hazard identification
and more!
results.name: Massachusetts Survival and Primitive Skills

results.description:
If you're a man, you know that being a man isn't always easy.

We're expected to do it all. We're supposed to be the perfect husband. The successful breadwinner who never needs any help or support. The ultimate father who never makes any mistakes. The brother or son who is always there, no matter what.

Are you sick and tired struggling with your relationships?
Are you struggling to find your true calling? Are you tired of just "getting through the day" and watching your life go by?

If so, then this is one Meetup you definitely want to check out. It's for every man who's ever wanted to fulfill his potential as a man. It's for men who want to become better-- a better friend, a better husband, a better father, a better son.

It's time to Man Up. Time to get honest with yourself. Time to quit making excuses and blaming others.

It's time to take a risk and become the kind of man you want to be. It's time to start living your life from a place of deep strength, total integrity, and deep compassion.
results.name: Boston Open Men's Group - Personal Mastery Workgroup

results.description:
Google Developers' Group Boston (formerly Boston GTUG). Bringing together experts, beginners and enthusiasts alike to meet and discuss a wide array of topics related to Google technologies and writing code that uses Google product APIs. We hold the occasional hackfest, and we get involved in Google developer challenge events.

Follow us on Twitter (@BostonGDG) and add us on Google+ . Some of our talks will be posted as Hangout On Air videos to our G+ feed.

We typically hold meetings in the offices of Google Cambridge, but please see our G+ feed for specific details of each event. We currently require attendees to RSVP in this MeetUp group.

Our meetings are always free and open to the general public. We will sometimes co-host joint meetings with other Boston-area MeetUp groups.

Disclaimer: GDG Boston is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.
results.name: GDG Boston - Google Developer's Group Boston

results.description:
Boston jQuery and JavaScript hackers unite!

Note that this is the SAME group as the one at meetups.jquery.com. It's been duplicated here because there are a lot of people on this website that don't even know the jQuery group exists!

http://meetups.jquery.com/group/jqueryboston

While this meetup group also exists on meetups.jquery.com, It's my hope that cross-promoting it here on meetup.com will help increase awareness and activity and help facilitate meetups, talk ideas, and discussions, so please sign up for this group and RSVP for events!

Typically, our meetups are held on the first Wednesday of every month at the Bocoup Loft, a 5 minute walk from South Station, and we have plenty of sponsor-provided beer and pizza.

http://loft.bocoup.com/

Be sure to check out all of our upcoming events. If you have any event suggestions—including a talk that you want to give—please don't hesitate to mention it.
results.name: The jQuery Boston Meetup Group

results.description:
Join author, paranormal investigator, and radio personality Ron Kolek each month for a lively discussion of the supernatural. As part of this unique study group, you will delve into the shadowy world of the paranormal investigator, where all is not as it appears to be. You will explore both the scientific and metaphysical methods of investigating as well as the theories and techniques behind the methodology.

What is a haunting? What type of equipment works best? Is there anything to fear? These are just a few of the many questions to be addressed by this spirited study group. This program will have elements for both the novice and the experienced ghost hunter. So if you have a passion for the paranormal, please join us for this monthly event.
results.name: New England Ghost Project's Paranormal Study Group

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to learn Astrology though dialog, sharing, and experiencing each others' charts.

Each month we'll be studying the chart of someone famous (or maybe not so famous). We will learn about the elements, the moon cycles or the current trend in the universe, it all depends. Basically we will learn to read charts and start putting everything together from our basic Astrology knowledge.

Practice makes perfect when it comes to learning about Astrology, so reading many charts is the best way to gain experience. Bring your own chart, too, and we can compare aspects in others' charts to your own.
results.name: Astrology Study Group

results.description: Join a Reiki community dedicated to the practice and study of Reiki as we share how this powerful energy works in our lives.
