results.description: This is a group for Clojure enthusiasts in the Boston area to gather and discuss topics of interest to the Clojure community.
results.name: Boston Clojure Group

results.description:
C.H.A.O.S. is Climbing, Hiking, Adventure and Outdoor Sports

Welcome, and thanks for checking out our group!

Tired of trying to convince all your friends to go hike a mountain, camp around a fire, climb a slab, ride or ski, tear up a trail?  Well, so were we! We've got it all, and we're looking forward to meeting you!

Age - CHAOS is intended for adventurous people in their 20's and 30's.  Our members have told us that they value attending meetups with people their own age and with similar interests, potentially forging friendships that grow beyond just posted events.  The new leadership team has thus decided to maintain the original age restrictions as of July, 2013.*


What YOU can expect from C.H.A.O.S.

We're one of the most active groups in the area.

We have a diverse list of activities including:

Skiing, Snowboarding, Snowshoeing, Ice Climbing, White water rafting, kayaking, Surfing, Standup Paddleboarding, Outdoor Rock Climbing, Indoor Rock Climbing, Backpacking, Camping, Hiking, Mountain Biking, and more!

We've got lots of members, (and we typically dismiss inactive ones to keep everyone active), we've got sponsors, and we've got tons for you to do!

 

What WE'RE looking for in members:

Active in the group - We need YOU to want to participate, otherwise why join?

Adventurous - Try new things!  We've got experts in all areas!

Expertise - Are you a white water rafting guide?  A certified belay instructor?  Know how to fix a mountain bike and willing to teach others?  We need people like you!

Leadership - Looking to lead your own outdoor climbs?  Your own hike up Mt. Washington?  Know a bike trail that's tucked away from the world?  We have experts and leaders but are always looking for more so we can be more active!

 

We hope you'll join our group and look forward to meeting you at an upcoming event!

-Kelsey, Sean, Jason, and the entire CHAOS team.  (Most content originally written by our founder, Bill.)

 

*Regarding Age: Some original CHAOS members are now older than 40 and others will of course eventually surpass the intended age for the group.  These members will always be welcome in CHAOS.  Additionally, friends of current CHAOS members who attend events as guests can be given special approval to join the group in certain situations.  CHAOS reserves the right to reject any membership application for those over the age limit.
results.name: C.H.A.O.S.

topics.name: Metrowest Married Couples Dessert and Coffee

results.description:
This group, now in its 5th year, is for committed couples in the Metrowest area interested in a lively dinner, and post-dinner get-together, with other couples every month or so, on Saturday night.  We go to dinner at good mid-priced restaurants somewhere inside the Framingham, Natick, Westborough, Marlborough and Sudbury area.

After dinner, we usually go to someone's house nearby for coffee and dessert.   If you live in the area, we encourage you to occasionally volunteer (but no more than once a year).  If you live outside the area, or aren't comfortable hosting, no problem!  We still hope you'll join us.

We also occasionally have spinoff activities.  For example, one July someone hosted an Independence Day BBQ, and members have hosted Games Nights, and Girls' Nights Out.

Although newcomers are welcome, this is not primarily a newcomers group.  We hope that people new to the area will stay involved even after they get settled.

We're mostly (but not entirely) from Metrowest, with ages ranging from mid-30s to late-50s.  We're a fun group, we think, and hope you'll consider joining us!.

/Jeff and Kathy (your organizers)


IMPORTANT:  For all activities: One RSVP per -couple- please. Thanks!

Misc:

Some members have indicated they're not getting all our messages from meetup.  To insure you get all messages, you may email us at meetup -at- kwcpa -dot- com and we will add you to our backup list.  We send 2-3 messages/month to this list to insure good communication.

We ask restaurants about "gluten free" and post their response in the invite.  All choices also have vegetarian options.  We're not experts in either though, so if you're unsure we encourage you to call the restaurant yourselves, and let us know if you have concerns.

Restaurant checks:  To simplify things, we do one check for our entire party.  Each couple pays for what they ordered, plus tax, tip, and meetup fee.  This breaks down to ~7% tax (includes local meal taxes), 20% tip (assuming the service merits it), and $1 per person to cover the organizer's fee charged by meetup.com.  If you're not inclined to do the math, a 30% adder is in the right range.  You can pay your portion by check or credit card.

Note to potential after-party hosters:  Some of our members may have allergies.  Please flag if yours is a cat household, and label any desserts that contain nuts.

Last-minute Cancellations:  If you've RSVP'd for an event but your plans change, that's cool (life happens!), but please update your RSVP, even just before the event.  The organizers get an Email and it eases the logistics.

Late Arrival: If you going to be late, that's also cool, but please post a comment or send an Email.  We go to busy restaurants at busy times.  If we don't hear from you, we can't guarantee to hold your seat more than 15 minutes after the start time.  Thanks for understanding.
results.name: Central Metrowest Couples Weekend Dinner Group

results.description:
Creating a place for EFT practitioners, whether amateurs or professionals, to come together, exchange ideas and techniques and get tapping together. This meetup is meant to be:
- a community where like-minded people can connect;
- a support group pushing its members forward on their healing journey;
- a reference structure where knowledge and know-how is circulated;
- a lab where new experiments take place and where members develop the healing techniques of tomorrow;
- a social and professional network for increased therapy opportunities;
- a playground dedicated to making self-healing and self-discovery fun and exciting...
results.name: Boston EFT Group

results.description: You’re in your 30’s or 40’s with a great career, maybe an advanced degree or two, but don’t have unlimited time to meet new people on a regular basis to date. You have the flexibility and stability to do some really cool things when you aren’t working but are missing someone to go with you. You work for a company that is known by just letters, an engineering firm, a software start up, a biotech company or something similar and would like to meet a person that understands the demands of your job because they have similar experiences and goals. You realize that there is more to life than 70 hour work weeks and are looking for a change. This group will schedule regular social events for after work drinks, dinners, games or other gatherings where you can meet singles in your area and industry. We can’t promise that you’ll meet a soulmate but you will expand your professional network. It doesn’t matter if you’re shy or gregarious, qualitative or quantitative, in R&D or sales, all professional singles are encouraged to join.
results.name: Single Geeks, Nerds And Professionals (30-49)

results.description:
I have 2 standard poodles who love to play and socialize. We go to a couple of other dog meetups but don't meet too many other big dogs for running and more robust play. We're hoping to get together with any larger breeds who like to play and run too. We live in Southie, but we especially like Cat Rock Park in Weston. We are open to anyplace we can be off-leash in a safe or fenced place.

We welcome all sizes of dogs as long as they and their owner are comfortable with large dogs who may play more roughly or just seem to due to their size. Please be sure that your dog will be comfortable with a group of up to about 8-10 big dogs (I don't limit the number but that's about the most we've had at one meetup). This group is set up so that anyone can suggest and schedule a meetup, not just me. If you'd like to go somewhere particular, feel free to suggest a meetup and if at least 2 other people RSVP "yes" it will go out to the group.
results.name: Big dog playgroup

results.description: We gather with the collective unconscious and use the bio-electric rhythms of the body to open up blockages allowing for healing to occur. Format of the class includes group healing, long distance healing, and individual energy work.

results.description: Boston Badminton is about socializing, meeting new people, and having fun while playing badminton. From beginner to self considered pro, this club is open to everybody. We may even get a drink or two after we play.
results.name: Boston Badminton

results.description:
Welcome to Couples Without Kids, where couples who don't have children can meet other like-minded people. We are a social club for child-free couples who have made the conscious decision to not have children. Membership is open to adults who have never parented -- regardless of gender, age, race, ethnicity, social or economic status, political, sexual or religious orientation.  Most of our members tend to be in their 20's-50's.

Who should join? Any childfree couples in MA who want to meet new and interesting friends!

Recently, Kelly has also started up a travel business called Couples Without Kids Trips.  If you're interested, check it out at www.coupleswithoutkidstrips.com.
results.name: Couples Without Kids - Boston & Metrowest

results.description:
Test and share board game prototypes with local game designers and game-designers-in-training! Get feedback, give feedback.

We welcome both playtesters and game designers of all levels!
results.name: Game Makers Guild

results.description:
As serious writers, practicing our craft is a joy for us, hence our use of the term "wordsmiths."

Please join us if:

  • You consider yourself a writer, regardless of education or experience;
  • You're looking to form a bond with other writers;
  • You would like to improve your skills;
  • You value honest, thoughtful feedback;
  • And you are willing to give helpful critiques to others.

We meet in Bedford every other Thursday night to enjoy friendly discussion and the companionship of other wordsmiths as well as the occasional cup of coffee.

There are only three requirements for membership:

  • Critique other writers' manuscripts in writing before the meetup;
  • Share your work as often as you can;
  • And contribute to the warm solidarity of the group.

Donations are graciously accepted at each meetup.

Group Guidelines:

  • Post your file by the Sunday before the meeting so attending members have time to read your piece and mark it up with their comments.
  • Critique all pieces posted for review. Positive comments are to be noted, followed by any suggestions for revisions.  Ideally, print out the piece + your review/edits to hand over to the writer after the critique.
  • Writers are asked to refrain from speaking until after all members have commented on their work.

We look forward to meeting our companion wordsmiths!
results.name: BEDFORD WORDSMITHS INK

results.description:
About  - Introductions By Diana LLC

Is the typical Boston singles scene off putting to you?  Maybe it is too young, too predictable or too lonely. Many people join and are looking for meetups specifically for Boston singles events over 40, over 50.

Now is the perfect time to try something new in a bright, warm and inviting environment, courtesy of Diana.
Diana ensures all of her guests feel welcome and are properly introduced to other diners at each event.  Events are held in private spaces of upscale restaurants in and around Boston. Cost of admission for a dinner party typically includes a cocktail hour and a four course meal. Between each meal, participants switch tables to ensure everyone has proper time to spend with one another.  
And, unlike other dating events you may have attended, every event offers a 50-50 split of men and women.

Diana is not a match maker. She simply eases the stress or awkwardness of first time meetings with old-fashioned proper introductions, offering a human touch to interpersonal relationships that is often missing in the modern world. 
Come dine with us. We think you will be happily surprised by the people you will meet!
results.name: 45+  Singles Dating Events!

results.description:
A unique adventure group fun for those 25- 125!

We are dedicated to outdoor activities combined with good beer/wine and good food. Join us on our weekend outings of hiking, snowshoeing, x-country skiing, kayaking, biking, horsebackriding, etc.. Share your favorite wine, cheese, snacks with energetic friends who like to "earn" the calories we so enjoy! These are NOT hard-core, survivalist elite level sporting events, but you do need to be in decent physical condition and bring your own equipment (and wine and foods to share of course!)

 

Due to the nature of our outings, minimum age to attend a Trekking Gourmets Event is 25 Years Old.

Please Note DOGS are welcome only with permission of the group organizer/ event host prior to the event.

Trekking Gourmets welcome folks of all ability levels, but please be in adequate physical shape to join us on our outdoor outings.

Membership agreement, details and fine print:

TREKKING GOURMETS CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCLAIMER: In order to participate in any Trekking Gourmets activity, you acknowledge and agree that this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others. * You assume all risk associated with this activity. * You are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity. * In the event of a hiking event, you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at  hikesafe.com. * You release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group on the hike and others in the group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons. * The description of the event may contain some errors.  You acknowledge that this description is only a guide. * In the event of a hike, labels of "beginner", "intermediate", and "advance" are subjective and depend on the experience of the hiker.  Distance and elevation gained are only approximate.  GPS coordinates are approximate, best viewed using Google Maps. Car, cell phone, and handheld GPS'es vary in accuracy and may not correspond to the meetup location. * The equipment list is a requirement for participation.  If you do not have the required gear, you may not be able to participate. * If you sign up for the event, but change your mind, you must update your RSVP to NO.  If you do not attend, or do not hike with the group (either late or by hiking faster than the group), your attendance may be marked as absent. If you are a no-show three times, without adequate reason, you may be removed from the Trekking Gourmets Meetup group. * Many events will involve the consumption of beer/wine/ alcoholic beverages. Excessive consumption of alcohol resulting in unruly behavior will be cause for immediate banned status from the Trekking Gourmets Group.

*Our group's theme is exercise followed by gourmet meal. Please be prepared to join us for both activities. Joining for the "Trekking" portion but not the "Gourmet" portion of the outing, or vice-versa, is not allowed by your organizer team, so please be prepared to join us for the entire event when you RSVP "Yes". (In certain circumstances due to venue capacity we might break events into a part 1 and a part 2, which negates this rule at the event organizer's discretion)

The Trekking Gourmets is intended to be a fun Meetup Group for all members. Members join the group freely and can cancel membership at any time. Conversely, membership may be cancelled at anytime at the discretion of the organizers with no recourse.

The Trekking Gourmets is YOUR Meetup Group!

Suggestions for events are invited and encouraged, and all members are eligible to act as  Event Host for the Trekking Gourmets after attending 3 events, and with the approval of Trekking Gourmets organizers.
results.name: Trekking Gourmets

results.description:
This is a Boston based group dedicated to rallying in support of free speech, freedom of information, free press, pro wikileaks, for freeing Bradley Manning and Julian Assange, Net Neutrality, and anything else that is related to these causes.

Its a broad message, but most people who are into one of these causes are into all of them. And if not you can come out and support the things you support.

Rallies will be held every 3rd saturday of the month. There will be meetings in-between rallies to brainstorm ideas for the next event. The meetings will also be for coming up with ways to expand, how do we reach more people?

results.description:
The MetroWest Photography Collaborative is a bit different from other Meet Up groups. We have an actual brick and mortar building with 2 photography studios/class rooms and a gallery for group shows and visiting artists... We’re located in Maynard MA, just south of Concord, west of Lincoln and north of Sudbury.

Come learn, teach and share your love of the photographic medium. Whether you are someone who just wants to take better family pictures or a serious artist who uses photography as part of their art work, we want to make this group work for you.

The MetroWest Photo Collaborative is in a great space for people of like interest to gather in Maynard MA. In order to keep things fresh I hope to attract different people who would like to teach a class or a workshop as well as people who would like to attend. Please sign up, share ideas and help make this the most resourceful and interesting Meet-up group in the MetroWest Boston area.

WE ARE NOT A CAMERA CLUB!!

No shooting to please anyone but yourself.
No following rules of composition (they're mere suggestions anyway).
No competitions, art is subjective.

We are here to encourage your creativity.
Use the medium of photography as an expression of your art form.
Good cameras are not necessary, creative yearnings are.

We will share our work, ideas and inspirations with each other.
We will offer workshops, critiques, share art books, offer lectures and beginner classes.

We plan on offering different meeting times for people with different skill levels and a special Teen group to explore the medium.

Professionals, come and share your knowledge, and meet with other professionals.
Amateurs, come and share your love of the medium.
Beginners, come with open minds and get inspired.

Where is Maynard?? http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=63+Main+Street,+Maynard,+MA&aq=0&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=30.682067,78.046875&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=63+Main+St,+Maynard,+Middlesex,+Massachusetts+01754&ll=42.432239,-71.453007&spn=0,0.009527&z=17&iwloc=A&layer=c&cbll=42.432231,-71.453004&panoid=2YDGfXXYSSybPOBet5LMFQ&cbp=13,30.23,,0,13.24

results.description:
After almost a decade in this crazy business I wanted to start a group specifically geared towards women in real estate. 

Our mission is very simple:  Discover the keys to success in real estate and network with like-minded professionals.

My goal for this group is:

  1. To provide a network for women serious about making the MOST of their career in real estate.
  2. Creating financial and personal freedom through real estate.

Lastly, I want this group to be a team of woman who want to better themselves, the people around them and conquer the real estate profession.
results.name: Real Estate for Real Women

results.description:
The ultimate freedom is to have a completely clear and free mind. The human mind is always changing and is always trying to add more desirable experiences. There is no end to this addition. The way to find peace and clarity is to know the real world, the True world, by subtracting the past that has been recorded and stored within the body and mind as pictures.

There is nothing more valuable than one's mind. It shapes the entire world that one knows. Through subtracting in Maum Meditation the Universe mind will remain.  This mind is always at peace regardless of conditions. It is the mind where there is no more ups and downs.

Become free of the limitations imposed by the past. These pictures dictate thoughts, emotions, desires, behaviors and health. Although these pictures are illusions, people unknowingly live within these illusions thinking they are real.

Maum Meditation is a non-profit organization that exists for the sole purpose of bringing people out of the mind world they are living in that includes stress, fear, anxiety, sadness, loneliness, resentment, anger, judgment, separation, boredom, purposelessness... all sorts of pain and burden.

The human mind is an accumulation of pictures of the past which create false limitations, habits, and a fixed, narrower mind. By subtracting the human mind with the method of Maum Meditation, people can remove the source of all disturbances. Even one's body will become healthier through practice since stress and other emotions cause so many health problems.

People live according to what they have in their minds. Through subtraction one's mind will change to the Universe mind and always follow the flow of nature. People will come to clearly know meaning and purpose in living.

Everyone from any background is warmly welcomed. Come to know Truth directly from within without any reference to what one has found or been told in the past. Maum Meditation does not tell people to believe or not believe something, but through subtraction, they confirm for themselves. When the human mind changes to the Universe mind it is born again and never dies.

--- What People Say About the Meditation ---

"Throughout my entire life I always felt like there was something missing. So I kept adding more and became stressed, but Maum Meditation was just the opposite. Instead of adding, Maum Meditation provided a simple method of subtraction. After subtracting my past I began to change my mind; how I viewed the world. The method of subtraction allowed me to get rid of my 'self' and my self-centered mind which controlled my speech, thought, and action. Maum Meditation allows me to live freely, without judgment and with gratitude." - Ben / Foster City, CA

"Maum Meditation transcends the boundaries of all religions. It will elevate the human mind to the highest level of existence; the level of divinity. That is where peace is; the element that is meant to control the universe. Once we achieve a permanent peace, we can give it to others." -Dr. Charles Marcieca / International Association of Educators for World Peace. UN-NGO

"I have tried other forms of meditation in the past, but none stuck because they lacked the method of subtraction. Shortly after I started Maum Meditation I found that I began to clear my mind and open my heart to a new Joyous feeling." -Clara / Santa Clara, CA

 

Come to an introduction!  Wednesdays at 7pm and Saturdays at 3pm

results.description:
"Education" is that which prepares our child for his future.  Parents are the principal guide of their child's education; we hope that the education that we give our child during her formative years prepares her for a bright, successful, and happy future.

Schools are (just) one of many suppliers of that education; however, we know that the school that we choose for our child can often be an important determinant of how bright her future will be.

A school that matches your child will enhance your child's skills, values, character, social abilities, confidence, motivation, passion, and academic abilities in such a way that your child enters her future well prepared to triumph over the inevitable obstacles that will stand in her way and secure a happy, successful place.

But when a school does not match your child, it will not provide him with he needs for his particular future, and worse, it may damage his confidence, undermine his true passion, ignore the unique combination of skills that he needs, or teach him beliefs, values, traits, emotions, or social lessons that reduce his future success and happiness.

Every child is unique; no two children have the same interests, passions, abilities, goals, values, strengths, character, and learning styles. Every child's future path is unique; no two children will experience the same future.  So, it is obvious that different children will need different types of schools.

However, most parents are fooled into believing that their only reasonable choice for schooling is the local "public" school, but in fact there are an infinite number of possible types of schools.  Any particular school may fit your child better or worse than another school. The local public school is only one possible school; it would be statistically shocking that that school serendipitously just happened to be the "best school" for your unique child.

In the past, a broad range of possible schools have not been available to us, and we have been forced to send our child to a school that is unlikely to support him.  Most cruelly, the child himself (and sometimes the family) is often blamed, when the child does not fit into a one-size-fits-few school.  However, we are at the dawn of a new era of broadening school alternatives.

Alternatives to Traditional Schooling is here to help you explore the emerging alternatives, some of which will likely better fit your child.  Across the region, education innovators are creating new types of private schools, homeschooling, charter schools, hybrid schools, self-directed schools, learning centers, co-operative schools, religious schools, internet schools, hacker-spaces, voyage schools, work-study schools, charter schools, apprenticeships, individualized schools, travel schools, partnership schools, experiential schools, etc.

Don’t let your child suffer a diminished future just because the default school can't prepare her well for her future. Explore schools that may better match your child.  We are here to help you help your child soar into her joyous future.

Join us as we explore the alternatives to traditional schooling in the Greater Boston area.

Please visit, overview, and add to our list of alternatives to public school.
results.name: Alternatives to Traditional Schooling

results.description:
Hi!
It's time for Boston to have a fishing group. New England has the best seafood on the East Coast, and there are SO many avid fishermen and fisherwomen (fisherpeople) in the area. We just don't know about each other!
Fishing enthusiasts have many reasons to band together and go in a group.
1. Share resources- if members go together, they can save on equipment, bait, boats, carpooling, lures, and more!

2. Share knowledge- What are "busting fish?" What are "slicks?" What is the correct lure for medium sized saltwater game? When are where can you find small mouthed bass in MA? NH? ME?RI?

3. Share dinner!!! What is better than grilling your freshly filleted catch with friends at the end of a long day of fishing?

Members are welcome/encouraged to become Event Planners by contacting (text or phone is best) the Organizer that currently oversees administrative functions (Peter). You may have your own boat/kayak/canoe or can beg/borrow/rent. Ideally, Event Planners should organize a Meetup at least every other month.

Anyone who is looking to make and meet new friends in and around the area is welcome to join. Activities are not limited and can vary, depending upon the members interests. This is your group and members are strongly encouraged to voice their ideas and opinions.

Please get involved today. You have been granted the power to suggest new events. Check with your friends to see who else may want to join in the fun. Thanks to Aspen for getting this going! Now, its yours to make what YOU want out of it.

To get get a new meetup on the calendar, suggest all you need is a Title/Headline, Place and date&time.  When 2 more people rsvp yes it's a meetup. Don't be discouraged if it takes a few tries. Its OK. Just put up what you were going to do anyway and see if someone else can join you.

results.description:
Iaido, the Way of the Sword, is the art of drawing and using the traditional Japanese sword. Iaido was practiced by the ancient Samurai for centuries.

Iaido consists of a number of techniques, or waza, that represent combative situations where generally one or more opponents initiate an attack. Although the waza represent combative encounters, the deeper purposes of iaido are to develop mental discipline, awareness, and mental and physical harmony through practice and control of body and sword movements.

Iaido is not considered a sport, but rather an ancient traditional art based on a unique oral tradition for the development of mind, body, and spirit. This art form has been passed from teachers to students in an unbroken line over hundreds of years, so it is the responsibility of each practitioner to learn and practice the techniques correctly so that the tradition is preserved and can be passed on intact to the next generation.

Muso Jikiden Eishin Ryu, meaning "peerless, direct transmission, true faith style", is the most widely practiced style of Iaido in Japan. It has a lineage of roughly 450 years, making it the second oldest martial art form in Japan.
results.name: BOSTON IAIDO

Come join us and be a part of our community.

results.description:
Come share ideas, techniques, and resources for how psychotherapists can help people enhance their intimate relationships. This group is for mental health professionals and anyone else who relishes enthusiastic in-depth discussions of clinical theory and practice.

Each meeting starts with a presentation, after which we discuss the topic and socialize.

Past topics:

  • What predicts divorce?
  • Using behavior modification techniques to improve your relationship
  • Three kinds of love: infatuation, lust, and long-term bonding
  • Attachment theory and attachment therapy
  • Useful ways to understand emotional and physical abuse
  • A brief history of couples therapy

Future topics:

  • Passion in long-term relationships: Why does it fade, and how can it be rekindled?
  • Using relationship therapy to treat "individual" problems such as depression and alcoholism
  • The first three floors of Gottman's Sound Relationship House

Note: This group respects all forms of consensual intimate relationships.

results.description:
Leave your technical manuals behind - this group is for those interested in photography as an art form. Although we recognize the importance of the craft of photographer we feel that the craft is already very well catered for by a plethora of meetups and camera groups in the New England Region.

This group will take a step to the side and cater to those for whom art assumes a far greater weight than craft.

We won't be talking about camera settings, lenses, tripods or equipment, we will be discussing artful photography - delving deeply into why a photograph is artful and what makes it work.

We will explore artisitc vision and how we can develop our own skills of expression.

We will take part in group shoots geared to creating art rather than what Vincent Versace refers to as "Sharp images of fuzzy ideas".


We will meet to critique and appreciate each other's work. We will have salon style discussions over great food and wine as we strive to grow and nurture the artist within each of us.

If you consider yourself first and foremost an artist and photography is just the medium you use to express your vision then this is the group for you.

This group will be run totally on a non-profit basis but to ensure that members are serious in their intent and to discourage the frivolous their will be an annual membership fee of $15 which will go towards maintaining the group, providing accommodation and food and wine for the salon style meetings.

results.description:
This group is for adults with ADHD and the people they are close to. We believe that these two groups of people will benefit the most by supporting each other and learning from each other as a single community. This enables us to leverage our relationships and collective wisdom for the growth of each member.

To facilitate this we have a number of community building blocks:

1. Meetings for adults with ADHD

2. Meetings for adults who have a close relationship with an adult who has ADHD

3. Meetings for couples in which one or both people have ADHD

4. Special events where everyone can come together and get to know each other

5. Online discussions on this website

We are excited about the possibilities for this community. Please join us!

 

HISTORY:

Marcel and Ose began this support group with the idea that we would build a community that offers support, connection, education, and resources for fellow adults who have been affected by ADHD.

Ultimately, the ideal is that from this community would merge a model of being that could inform the outer society. That rather than label, blame, judge, hold to rigid ways of operating in this world – those participating, with or without ADHD, would learn to observe without judgment, be creative with their resources, learn from one another, build on passions, hone skills, enjoy one another, and collaborate on various endeavors for the benefit of interesting and meaningful projects and outreach.

We hope that this group will thrive by its diverse leadership – formed from within and without. Led by those with, without, and professionals working to help this field. Ultimately, it might be great to have a board of professionals helping to guide the educational piece.

THE VISION FOR ADULT ADHD SUPPORT COMMUNITY

Why this meetup group

  • To provide a supportive space, community, and access to resources that enable those affected by ADHD or debilitating distractions/disorganization/impulsivity to find information, connection, support, and resources so they not only survive but thrive.
  • Because there are many people trying to go the journey alone – and it is much more fun, interesting, and fruitful to help one another.
  • Because there are very few support groups for Adhd out there
  • Because the path to help for ADHD is not an easy one. And perspective, good information, and support can make all the difference.
results.name: Boston Area Adult ADHD Community

results.description:
Founded in 1872 by four young men who wanted to form a "Debating Club" to better prepare them for the world they faced, the club soon grew to over 40 members in the 1890s and reached a peak in the late 1940s when the club had over 100 members. Although initially they wanted to master such topics as parliamentary law, improve their social skills and their knowledge of literature, the club soon became a forum where Cantabridgeans could meet over dinner to discuss current events and listen to a debate about immigration, women’s rights or the like. Today the club meets six times a year at the Gran Gusto restaurant, 90 Sherman St., in Cambridge on the first Monday of the months of February, March, April, October, November and December. All meetings start at 6:00 PM with a social hour, followed by dinner at 7:00 PM and a featured speaker at 8:00 PM. 

Our Members are usually former college educated graduates who still like good conversation and a good lecture! We try to obtain Harvard and MIT related speakers when possible. 

 Current Club Officers: President: Les Hellenack, lesh10@comcast.net Vice-President: John Kernochan, jakern@comcast.net Secretary: Evan Nelson, w-nelson@comcast.net Treasurer: Alice Kidder, flintkiddr@aol.com
results.name: Economy Club of Cambridge

results.description:
The heart and soul of MDI in Massachusetts and New England resides in our men's teams, where teams of men gather to listen, to advise, and to support each other. We also offer larger events to support each other in our success in relationships, with our families, in our careers and in our communities. You may also visit www.mdijawbone.org or www.backbonedivision.com for more information about our circle of men.

Jawbone and Backbone are both circles of men affiliated with MDI which is an organization in the United States and Canada. www.mdisuccess.com.

We inspire men to pursue a purpose larger than themselves; while we recognize that, to be effective, men must confront their life challenges and personal demons, we do not seek to devote our time focusing solely on the individual.

We empower men by providing them with the tools they need to succeed. These tools are discovered and put into use in weekend trainings or weekly courses, one-on-one mentoring or weekly team meetings. As an organization we believe that true wisdom comes not from a single source but from the diverse viewpoints of our community of men.

We pursue our passion by being in relationship with the men of our team; they provide the inspection, feedback and support necessary to get the job done. When we stumble, our teammates are there to get us back on our feet, brush us off, and ensure we have learned the lessons from a setback or challenge before we get back into the game.

When we realize our passion, and then start to manifest it, we have a circle of men to celebrate with. These men acknowledge our victories and the unique qualities we bring to the world; this allows us to continue to carry our personal legacy forward to our families and communities.

In a nutshell: We are unconditionally committed to men winning in their lives.
results.name: MDI Massachusetts

results.description:
We study and train in authentic Israeli Krav Maga, direct from the source in Israel. We don't teach an American/US version or interpretation of "Krav Maga" but the authentic, genuine, real deal system that is taught to the IDF (Israeli Defense Forces) in Israel - both to the general infantry, special forces and law enforcement agencies.

We train in a 16 000 Sq Ft, studio and gym (the largest dedicated Krav Maga training facility on the East Coast of the U.S.) in Charlestown, with FREE Parking for up to 150 cars.

The aim of this group is to introduce people to Krav Maga and give them the true and unique experience of training in this authentic Israeli system of self-defense.
results.name: Krav Maga Boston

The purpose of Sunday Assembly Boston is to bring the Sunday Assembly model to our neighborhood, for monthly congregational programs that are family-friendly, open, and energizing.

results.description:
Hello and Welcome to the Red Line Book Club! (Formerly the Davis Square Book Club).

This is a club where friendly interesting people meet to discuss the books we have all read together. If there is a general theme to the books we read, it's that we read "great" books: enduring classics and new books with lots of potential. For an idea of what we read please look at our past meetups and also visit our polls section where we vote on which books we'll read.

A few notes on format: We nominate books to read on our discussion board, then form a poll and vote on the books. Our fine selection of books depends completely on the excellent taste of our members!

All are welcome! If you'd like to come join us, simply join this group and RSVP to our next meetup. It's preferable but not entirely necessary for you to have read the book.

We look forward to seeing you! Happy reading,

Mike

results.description:
Founded in 2004, A3D (African Development through Drum and Dance) started with a group of friends who traveled to Senegal, West Africa on a two week journey that forever changed their lives. After experiencing the sights and sounds of Africa, it became clear that many of the things we take for granted, most of the people there either never had or need more of, but will likely not be able to achieve without help from outside. Some of those things include medicines, school computers, and much more.

The A3D group is always looking for friends and volunteers who can put their skills to good use. We host an annual festival in Salem every July (complete with artists and vendors, musicians and performers, even a moon bounce), we raise money for useful items (desks and computers for a school in Senegal), to name a couple of active projects, and we have a good time doing all of this. We meet regularly in Salem, Massachusetts and welcome you and any guests you would like to invite to attend any and all of our gatherings. There, we discuss current projects, what needs to be done, and what we would like to do.

We look forward to meeting you soon.

results.description: ‎Mamadou Diop and MAMADOU BAND are humbled and honored to have won the 2011 Boston Music Award for International Artist of the Year.This group brings MAMADOU friends and fans together at live performance venues. Led by Senegalese native Mamadou Diop, MAMADOU is an eclectic group of musicians who have truly formed a guitar and drum led sound that is all their own (enough to win the 2011 Boston Music Award as International Artist of the Year). The music they produce is made for dance, and drumming and percussion are integrated into their live shows, getting the audience to move their feet to the beat! The best way to appreciate MAMADOU is to experience their performance LIVE. With lyrics sung in several languages, the positive messages of the ensemble are conveyed through the universal language of music. If you like to dance, enjoy quality live music, or are just looking for something different, then you'll want to join this group.

results.description:
Welcome!

We are a friendly, diverse, active group of North Reading moms looking for a chance to make connections and create lasting friendships within our community. If you're new to the area, a new mom, or just looking to meet other local families this is a great way to do that. There are adult-oriented events including a monthly book club, mom's nights out or mom's nights in (such as Oscars night or wine and cheese events). For the kids, there are playgroups, meet-ups at local playgrounds and play spaces, and outings to places like Connors Farm and Look What I Made. And for the whole family, we have events such as a our Halloween party and Dinner and a Movie Night Out.

Since the group consists of both working and stay-at-home moms, events are held both during the day and at night or on weekends. There is also a strong focus on creating ties within our community, as evidenced by our partnership with the NR library and our presence on NR Patch as a Local Voice.

This is a fully volunteer/member run group. All meetups in our group are organized by members and dues go towards running the site as well as towards special group events. We ask that you pay your dues promptly.

For prospective members, please note that we ask you to provide a photo to help identify you at meetups. These photos are NOT visible outside our meetup space. Please attach a current photo of yourself.

Thanks for checking us out, and we look forward to meeting you at our next event!
