results.description:
Drumming cleanses the soul, organizes the mind, coordinates movements of the body, and just feels good! Mamadou Diop is from Senegal, West Africa. He has performed with some of the biggest named musicians in his country, and he KNOWS music and rhythm. It is his joy to teach what he has learned, bringing the rhythms of not just Senegal, but all of West Africa to whoever wants to learn them. Join this group if you are a drummer, want to be a drummer, or are just curious what African drumming is all about. All skill levels are welcome at his classes! Bringing your own drum helps, but there are some drums available if you do not have one. Just be ready to have fun!

The first sound we ever heard while still in our mother's womb, was the beating of her heart, and the rhythm of her breath. No matter our race, gender, age, religion or belief system, this common experience exists for all human beings.

When newcomers are first introduced to drumming as adults, they often say "oh, I don't have any rhythm," in an attempt to excuse themselves for their imagined inadequacy.

The truth is: We All have Rhythm!

Rhythm is our natural inheritance. It exists in our bodies, our hearts, our breath. It exists in the vibration of atoms, the cycles of the seasons, the ticking of clocks, the orbit of the earth. There is no part of creation that is without rhythm!

Drumming is a practice that spans the globe and has a presence in every culture. It has been used for centuries in rituals, ceremonies, communication, rites of passage, music and dance, celebration, healing, community building, and cultural events.

Drumming Therapy is a method of utilizing the natural power of rhythm and music and applying it to an individual or group for the purpose of healing. A truly holistic healing approach, group drumming breaks down social barriers, promotes freedom of expression, non-verbal communication, unity and cooperation. Drumming awakens dormant emotions and unexplainable feelings of excitement, peace, and ecstacy. It decreases depression, anxiety, and stress, boosts immune system functioning and benefits physical health.
results.name: African Drumming with Mamadou Diop

results.description:
Nerds and Fiber.

We knit. We crochet. We spin yarn. We weave. And we are mobile.


We'll get together and knit at cafes, picnic tables, yarn shops, parks, ...
results.name: the nerd fun boston mobile knitting group

topics.name: Making new friends when you're over 50 years old
Forming supportive communities for gay men over 50

results.description: This group  promotes fellowship/friendships between gay men age 50+. In any case the purpose of this group is to promote caring, supportive, loving friendships between gay men living either in partnerships or alone and dealing with this fast paced world in which we now live. Meetups can be very casual and as members join I hope they will reach out to each other just to meet for coffee, a drink, or to go to a movie or shopping...just to take a walk and talk....anything at all. We do have a regular monthly brunch at 1pm the last sunday of each month at Club Cafe. We are open to new ideas/suggestions from all members. You are welcome to bring any friend of any age. Our focus is older Gay men .
results.name: Gay Men 50+/Friendship Connection of Greater Boston

results.description:
The Teacher Travel Network is a group that provides opportunities for teachers to socialize, share war-stories, and ideally, make connections with other people who like to travel and have the same vacation schedules. Connections and friendships made through this meetup have so far resulted in trips to Charleston, Miami, Santa Fe, Italy, and even Cuba.  We hope to keep this list growing!

Our mission is not to actually organize trips, but rather to provide a means for teachers to network with each other. If at any point someone is interested in organizing a trip or other adventure, however, the door is open!

We do plan to organize one meeting a month and are open to suggestions for different meeting spots. The one dollar charge at our monthly meetings will go towards the fees that Meetup.com charges us to organize the events. We look forward to meeting you!

Terresa
results.name: Teacher Travel Network

results.description:
Please note that you must have a recognizable picture of yourself that includes your face as one of your Meetup photos in order to have your membership request approved.  This is so that our event organizers can recognize you at our events.  Thank you!

Welcome! This group is for those in Boston who like to play strategy (and slightly silly) games and be social at the same time. It is perhaps easiest to break this down word by word:

Strategy games: We will not be playing Apples to Apples, LCR, or even Monopoly here. Instead, the gaming focus of this group will be on strategy games, games that make you think and plan ahead, such as Ticket to Ride, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Settlers of Catan, Power Grid, Agricola, and many more. Of course, we don't expect that you know how to play all these games; we will always welcome newcomers and will sometimes be learning these games ourselves for the first time.

Slightly silly games: Munchkin, Killer Bunnies, and Fluxx are examples of "slightly silly" games. Do note that there's still strategy involved, but we certainly welcome games that make us laugh while we're playing!

Social: To be clear, this group will be as much about the gaming as the social interaction, which is why it's different from other such groups in Boston. But if you see the person next to you as simply someone to beat and nothing more, then this is not the group for you.

From the gaming groups I've been to (and run), there is a clear set of gamers in the Boston area who very much like these types of games, and who like the idea of possibly forming friendships with their fellow players, and that's who I'm looking for!  If you think you'd like this kind of interaction, sign up and come to one of our events. And if you have questions, don't hesitate to contact one of the organizers. See you soon!
results.name: Boston's social strategy (and slightly silly) gamers

results.description:
Let’s enjoy and explore our diverse Boston local and international cultures.

Let’s attend art, music, dance, and sports events; enjoy good food and drink; and share stories.

The purpose of this club is to simply enjoy life and maybe make a new friend as we enjoy and learn from our shared cultures.

I imagine that many of you will be new to Boston, perhaps you are from abroad or other parts of the US; I would like to offer activities that will introduce you to the Boston area.

Also, I would like you to consider this group as your group. I encourage you to be active members and share your ideas and information. I will need your help, your feedback, in making this group truly representative of all the cultures within the group.

I would love to have a diverse number of event organizers, please let me know if you would like to share your cultural interests in leading events.

The requirements for joining are your respect towards others of diverse cultural and ethnic backgrounds and your demonstration of common courtesy in showing up for confirmed events.

In order for events to be successful, it is necessary for organizers to depend on an accurate attendance count. Organizers work very hard in thinking up and planning event. No-shows should be a rare occurrence. If you are to be a no-show, I expect you to show the minimum courtesy in sending a message to the event organizer in acknowledging your absence or to explain any difficulties in finding the event.

Membership will be revoked to those who show do not show respect and common courtesy to the group and who have a history of not showing up for confirmed events.

I ask members to post a simple photo and fill out anecdotal profile questions, nothing identifiable, so I know you are a real person, not a spammer.  This information helps me get a sense of your likes and ideas for the club. Also, a photo really helps event leaders in recognizing you at the Meetups.  However, I can make an exception if you send me an email  confirming that you are a real person.

All ages and cultures are welcome!
results.name: Boston Culture Club

results.description:
Are you a progressive working on campus?

We started this group to create an inclusive multi-issue network of progressive faculty and staff in the Greater Boston area.

While this began as a project of Socializing for Justice, a grassroots group established in 2006 to build a cross-issue progressive community, network and movement in Boston by putting the SOCIAL back in social justice - it's now a separate group.

Ideally, this group will facilitate inter-departmental and cross-campus collaboration among faculty and staff and support progressive student groups by connecting them with like-minded community-based organizations and student groups at other campuses in the area.

Members are encouraged to add their own Meetups, which will be announced to the group when 3 people say they are attending. Have an idea for networking with progressive faculty and staff? Post it! Want everyone to know about an event on your campus? Post it!

 

Why are faculty and staff the key to campus networking?
Faculty and staff have the ability to achieve and maintain a sustainable impact. Students graduate but faculty and staff usually work at a university for longer periods of time. When students graduate, faculty and staff may be able to connect them with community organizations that are hiring and identify other students to take on vacant student leadership positions. Progressive faculty can also encourage students by becoming an adviser to a progressive student group.



Why get involved with Campus2Community?

    To connect with faculty & staff with similar interests in other departments at your institution and at other campuses in the area

    To support the maintenance and development of progressive student groups

    To facilitate students connecting with local community-based organizations and student groups
results.name: Campus2Community: Progressive Faculty & Staff Network

results.description:
Are you a Wayseer?

  •      You see the world in a different way than most
  •      You are a highly creative problem solver
  •      You often use your intuition to guide you through difficult situations
  •      You are ambitious and industrious
  •      You have tons of energy
  •      You love being the hero in emergencies

Wayseers are the change engines of society. Wayseers are the one's who know first, who sense earliest the disturbances in the fabric of human affairs - the trends, the patterns, the fashions, the revolutions that are afoot, the coming groundswells.

We started this group so Wayseers can come together, celebrate in ways only Wayseers can, immerse yourself in awesome music and make amazing connections.

Will you join us?

Curious about us? Check out the Wayseers Manifesto
results.name: Wayseers Boston

results.description:
Hello! This group was started in 2011 to provide moms in the Quincy area with support and socialization opportunities. So if you are a new or experienced mom with infants or toddlers please join this group so we can share in the joys and struggles of motherhood together! Suggestions for meetups are welcome.

We also have a very active Facebook group. To join (it's a secret group), use the "Contact" button on the left to send me a message with the email address you use for facebook.
results.name: Quincy Area Moms of Infants and Tots

results.description:
Awesome Hikes Around Boston & NH is a group of adults who enjoy the great outdoors and making new friends. Our focus is intermediate level hiking in Massachusetts and other parts of New England. If you prefer a slower more casual pace, this may not be the group for you. The majority of the members are in their 40's thru 60's. There are also a few geriatric old coots in their 70's.

Please provide a recent, clear, close up, recognizable face shot photo without sunglasses. You will be declined if you don't .

Our group has a high level of privacy. Meetup locations, descriptions, member information and photos are only available to group members. They are hidden from non-members.
results.name: Awesome Hikes Around Boston & NH

topics.name: Social Get Togethers for Bridge Players

results.description:
Have you ever wanted to learn and play Bridge?

  • Looking to exercise your brain and have fun doing so?
  • Getting tired of poker and want another challenge?
  • Want to know why business executives play Bridge to keep an advantage in their careers?

Beantown Bridge is a casual Bridge meetup in the Greater Boston area. We have events in Metro Boston area. Our mission is to bring back this classic game to a new generation of game players.  Our focus is not on competitive or professional play, but rather the social and fun aspect that has allowed the game to continue to thrive.

Although beginners are encouraged to go to one of our popular "Bridge for Dummies" classes, players of all experience levels are welcome to all of our events... even if you just want to watch and learn!

Beginners, if you want to learn at your own pace, check out the free web tutorial from ACBL at the website https://web.acbl.org/LearnToPlayBridge/
results.name: Beantown Bridge

results.description:
MU-FA-SA and O-HI-O to All that’s just my way of saying Hello!

On May 4, 2013 Boston Raw Food Living will Celebrate 2 Years!

When I started this group it was my hope to create a supportive environment that was engaging and inspiring. Now sixteen meetups later I feel that this hope has grown into much more than I could have ever imagined possible. We have accomplished so much over this time together… We have been open to leaning and willing and able to teach.

As we continue into the future together, I as the organizer could not be prouder of those that had the courage and desire to step outside their comfort zone, to experience life and seek out healthy relationships and connections. As we celebrate 2 years together let us realize that the solid foundation we have created and built upon is strong and solid. More amazing moments to come!

To the Seasoned Members of Boston Raw Food Living, please know that you are appreciated and admired, respected and supported! I am glad to know you and I can't wait to meet with you again you are outstanding human beings. Thank you for allowing me to know you! I look forward to and are excited to meet even more of you this year! 

To the New Members of Boston Raw Food Living, We look forward to many moments of joy and laughter, we are open to being a shoulder and support in your journey, we respect and admire you wherever you are in your life and in this journey without judgments or preconceived notions. We will meet you where you are and hopefully we can be and inspiration to one another. Thank you for joining and Welcome to Boston Raw Food Living!   

-Lynette May 1, 2013

Update: As of October 23, 2011 I am now a Certified Level 3 Raw Food Teacher! Trained by Alissa Cohen and Stacie Cohnen I completed my Comprehensive Training which included 3 Certifications for level 1, 2 and 3!

 I am producing a Documentary about my Raw Food Journey to inspire others who can relate to me to reach past their circumstances and realize the true magnitude of their power so that they challenge those that are quick to judge to respect and support the significance of each end every individual’s contributions!  I hope to take you along for the ride! Great thing to come in 2012!

HAPPY NEW YEAR!!!!

 This is a group for people who are looking for New and Healthy Connections through Raw Food in the Boston Area. If you believe Laughter Fun, Exploration, Adventure and even a little silliness is Raw Food for the soul, than this is the place for you. I am starting this group to support me as I am in the beginning stages of my Raw Food Journey and I am looking to be inspired and inspire. This is a place to share your natural gifts and passions as I share mine; In a supportive environment without judgments or pre-conceived notions. Through our connection we will set and meet personal goals through things like food and fitness challenges; and no matter where you may be from beginning to advance you are welcome. There will also be shopping excursions for the best and most cost effective places to buy products, fruit, vegetables nuts, seed and grains. There will also be occasional Movies, Hikes, Walk/Runs, Comedy Shows, Plays, maybe even a concert or two all on a shoe string budget. If this interests you sign up we will be happy to have you.

 

GET EXCITED ABOUT RAW FOOD!

Learn about what Being Raw means to you

Meet and connect with new people

Find Motivation and Support to Enjoy and live to the fullest

Have, more energy, mental clarity and peace of mind

Get in or Back in Shape

Exchange and Try New Recipes

Get Healthy Weight loss or to Maintain Weight

THANK YOU CECILIA FOR THE WORDS & ENCOURAGEMENT I AM FOREVER GRATEFUL! 

SPECIAL THANK YOU, AND WELCOME TO KATIE FROM COSTA RICA 6/17/2011
results.name: Boston's Raw Food Living ~Inspiration ~Fun ~Adventure

results.description:
We love to skate and organize weekly, monthly and annual events to share our love of skating. Our official skates roll from early spring through October 31st of each year.

We welcome beginners to experts of every age.   To join our skates, you must know how to stop and be comfortable skating on streets for at least 8 miles.

More information here:   http://icbskates.org
results.name: Inline (Skating) Club of Boston - ICB

results.description:
The Social Philosophizers Club is a group for the intellectually curious! It is a club for both singles and non singles, and for anyone who finds intellectual mingling to be the best form of social mingling. The club offers a variety of interesting venues to achieve its mission:

• Discussions on works in literature and philosophy  

• Philosophical films shown in private homes 

• Topical conversations over brunch, lunch or dinner

•  Guest Speakers

•  Study groups 

•  Book club 

• Adventure walks (long philosophical ruminations while walking nature tails or strolling city streets)

• Plays, movies, museums and special events 

• After work mixers

While this club is philosophically oriented, the name should not fool you.  It is much more than a philosophy club. Rather, it is a club for philosophically minded folks who enjoy discussing and contemplating the important issues, from the perennial issues of classics in philosophy and literature to the most contemporary interests and concerns. Whether you are single or non single, into social networking or just being social, dating or not dating, Social Philosophizers is intended for people who believe that the life of the mind is a major ingredient in the joy of life.

The Social Philosophizers Club utilizes Membership Levels, currently including Basic, Bronze and Gold. The requisite membership level  for each event is stated at the top of each event description.
results.name: Social Philosophizers

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in the famous three Rs: reduce, reuse and recycle. Membership in this group is your backstage pass into the world of recycling in Massachusetts.

 

Ever wondered...

• Where your recycled materials actually go?

• What new products are made with materials you recycle?

• What is recyclable, what is not – and why?

 

MassRecycle invites you to:

• Tour recycling facilities in the state and lean how they work,

• Meet with recycling experts,

• Look for ways to make our lives – and our state – less wasteful.

 

Who should join? Anyone interested in recycling is welcome – whether you are looking for ways to recycle more at home, at school or at work, you will find useful information at our meetups.  Our group will also help you visit the many businesses that take materials collected in our communities and help turn them into new products.

 

This group was created by MassRecycle, the Massachusetts Recycling Coalition. We are a nonprofit organization that fosters sustainability by promoting recycling and eliminating waste.  Connect with us on facebook at www.facebook.com/massrecycle or visit our website at www.massrecycle.org.
results.name: MassRecycle: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle in Massachusetts

results.description: The mission of this group is to provide networking and learning opportunities for PostgreSQL users located in the Boston area. We will have a series of speakers presenting on all facets of PostgreSQL.
results.name: Boston PostgreSQL Users Group (BPUG)

results.description:
While there are plenty of groups around for specific languages (PHP, Ruby, Javascript) there's no group around the hub dedicated to the discussion of experience-based best-practices on the ridiculous number of things front-end web developers need to master to be at the top of their game:

  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Cross-browser Support
  • Grids, Design basic
  • CMS's
  • Mobile support
  • JavaScript
  • jQuery
  • Performance Optimization
  • Conversion Tracking
  • A/B Testing

...AJAX, JSON, OpenGraph, RDF, and on and on and on...

Join up and let's learn and stay ahead of the Web curve together!

Note: this a group aimed more at experienced front-end developers who want to learn about the technical details and best practices of current and next generation technologies, it's not necessarily aimed at beginners to the web (though all are welcome)
results.name: Boston Front End Developers

results.description:
This is a group for anyone who loves nature photography. We will visit various locations throughout the year. All skill levels are welcome from beginner to professional.

This is a great opportunity to explore, take pictures and have fun. Our subject matter will include landscapes wildlife, insects, flowers, night photography, etc. We also will be offering a Lightroom classes in the future.

Some events are free and others cost a fee.

All events are lead by John Slonina a professional nature photographers who work is nationally recognized. He teaches photography across the US at photo conventions. trade shows. lectures, classrooms and I lead photo tours and workshops.

Find out how to create award winning images and shoot like a pro. Develop your own personal vision and take your photography to the next level while having fun.

All skill levels are welcome from absolute beginner to pro.

New England has some incredible locations from the mountains to the sea. We will visit a wide variety of locations and photograph several different subjects.

We also will visit several other top locations throughout the US.

John Slonina is a professional nature photographer who has been photographing the nature for over 25 years. He estimates he has taken over 700,000 photos. He has a love of natural history as well. Meetup group members also get a discount on all photo workshops and tours.

Please visit http://www.sphotography.com
results.name: Nature and Wildlife Photographers of New England and Beyond

results.description:
This group is geared towards those who are looking to grow spiritually and become more in touch with their healing & intuitive gifts! Through joining "Angels of Light Meetup Group" you will have a chance to meet like minded Intuitives, Healers, holistically minded and heart-centered individuals. At "Angels of Light Healing & Intuitive Center" we offer an array of spiritual gatherings and offerings including Angel Certifications, Soul Journey Certifications, Reiki Certifications, monthly meditations, healer shares, monthly mediumship circles, angel shares, yoga, monthly psychic fairs, intuitive/healing classes and much more!

About Us:

For over 17 years Rev.Cathi Burke, Angel Minister/Messenger/Healer and Soul Coach, has been teaching and offering Angel Connections and Spiritual Counseling Sessions as well as Holistic Nutrition,Emotional Freedom Technique, Touch for Health Muscle Testing and Healing Modalities to her clients. She has helped those who have crossed her path to connect with their Angels, Guides and the Divine Energies that surround us as she empowers each client to experience their Soul's mission and life purpose. Her extensive training in Holistic Nutrition and Healing Modalities has helped many to heal body, mind and spirit, and she is committed to working with all of those who are ready to open the doors to Higher Spiritual Knowledge, Growth and Transformation. Rev. Burke is a Certified Holistic Nutritionist and Angel Practitioner, Marriage Officiant as well as the Author of Americo Michael "Surrounded by Angels" and The Butterfly Awakened and the Healing Angels CD. Rev. Burke continues to study and share her gifts with the world at her Healing and Holistic Center in Norwell, Ma.

Rev. Cathi offers a wonderful InterFaith Angel Service at the Center Bi-Weekly, and is the Channel for the 8 Angels of Light, as well as a gifted Spirit Medium.

Cristina Burke of Geminess Photograpy is a graduate of Pine Manor College and holds a degree in Visual Arts. Cristina also holds a Degree in Early Childhood education, and for the past 10 years Cristina has been offering her many services to the public. Cristina is very passionate about her healing work and is a Magnified Healer and Reiki Master/Healer/IET and Lighterian Reiki Practitioner, Angel Messenger and Spirit Medium offering Healing Sessions, Selenite and Crytal Wand Classes, Reiki for Children, and as As an Angel Messenger and Spirit Medium she blends her Intuition with her Healing Gifts and she is committed to helping those who cross her path. Watch for her upcoming Workshops and Events.
results.name: Angels of Light Meetup Group

results.description:
This is the Meetup group for kayakers of all levels whether you're a beginner/novice or you have been kayaking for many years. Rooted on the North Shore with members from all over Northeastern Massachusetts, Southeastern New Hampshire and beyond, this group is for those who enjoy their kayaking adventures at a laid back leisurely pace.

If your idea of kayaking means sharing the sights and beauty of flat water lakes and rivers as you paddle along with friends, then this group is for you. Some of the places we may journey to include The Essex River, The Charles River, Plum Island, Lakes Quannapowitt and Pawtuckaway , just to name a few.

If you don't have a kayak but still like to spend some time on the water don't worry, we often go to destinations where kayak rentals are available for those who do not have one of their own. Everyone is welcome to help suggest and plan adventure destinations for future activities, as this is what makes a fun and successful group.

 

Carpooling is a good idea if you want to save money on parking and share fuel costs. Please share gas & parking expenses with your driver.

 

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  As organizers we make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour.  In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol before or during any Casual Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.
results.name: Casual Kayakers

results.description:
Whether you're running GNU/Linux as your desktop operating system or interested in doing so, this Meetup is for you. Our goal is to create an environment that's welcoming, fun, and educational.

A paradox...

  • The argument for open source ("free" as in speech) software is stronger than ever.
  • GNU/Linux has been wildly successful in the server market.
  • Desktop GNU/Linux operating systems like Ubuntu Linux provide a rich end-user experience on par or better than commercial rivals in many respects.

...Yet the uptake of using GNU/Linux as an end-user (desktop/laptop) operating system still lags. This Meetup aims to end that by:

1. Creating a community of GNU/Linux on the desktop enthusiasts.

2. Providing a venue where GNU/Linux questions can get asked by users of all levels.

3. Fostering GNU/Linux on the desktop evangelism. Let's spread the word!

We welcome long time GNU/Linux enthusiasts, those who've heard of GNU/Linux but aren't even sure what it is, and everyone in between. Join us!

We're part of BLU! BLU is the Boston Linux & Unix User Group and has been meeting actively since 1994.  BLU does a fantastic job of covering topics across the broad spectrum of GNU/Linux, from technical topics to end-user topics.  I'm excited that BLU has invited our group to become a sub- group of theirs.  This gives us tremendous support from more experienced users and allows us to coordinate events.  As a sub- group, we aim to focus on using GNU/Linux on the desktop and attracting new and less technical users to the platform.  To learn more about BLU, please visit http://www. blu.org.
results.name: LibrePlanet Boston Desktop GNU/Linux Users Group

results.description: A group dedicated to Node.JS, the server side framework for Google's V8 JavaScript engine.
results.name: Node.JS Boston

results.description:
This group was initiated to encourage more folks to explore responsible travel opportunities, connect with like-minded members, and ultimately get out on the road to their next adventure! Absolutely anyone is welcome to join, especially if they have a desire to make a difference in our world by traveling with a purpose.  Volunteer-travel can happen in Guatemala, Kenya, Fiji, Mexico or countless other countries and involve eco-efficient stove-building, orphanage work, wildlife conservation or SCUBA diving.  The best place to start and learn all about the different programs is by joining the Boston International Volunteers Meetup group!

 

As a group we will host workshops on proper conservation and international development practices, host local speakers and special events, celebrate achievements abroad, and simply educate each other on how we can make the world a safer, cleaner, happier place to share.  We have no religious affiliations and operate as a non-government group, and we're happy to host anyone interested in exploring the world under an adventurous lens.  We have decided the best way to describe our group is through a mission statement:

 

Boston International Volunteers is dedicated to creating an inclusive space for all people who are interested in volunteer opportunities, abroad and at home, by providing a supportive network which aims to improve socially and environmentally responsible travel.

 

See you at the next meeting!
results.name: Boston International Volunteers

results.description:
This group is about learning and sharing skills and techniques to thrive and build resilience through the challenges presented by climate change, peak oil, environmental degradation and cultural shifts.

Gather with likeminded folks for fun, sharing, and learning. There is a place for you here to respond positively to these challenges through edible landscapes, gardening, food forests, farming, renewable energy, green building, local currency, rainwater harvesting, composting, soil regeneration, mushroom cultivation, local food, herbalism, simple living, food preservation, time exchanges, conservation, community-building, relocalization transition towns, and so on.
results.name: Greater Boston Permaculture Guild

results.description: This is group of comic book lovers who want to get together and talk about comics. There will be monthly get togethers that will range from going to local conventions to just having dinner and getting to know members.
results.name: The Boston Comic Meetup

results.description:
New England Night Photographers (NENP) is a community of people who love night photography (NPy) -- shooting after the sun goes down and before it rises in the morning. Our photographers shoot in a wide range of locations from the New England mountains to our coastlines, islands, city streets, and abandoned properties in out of the way places. Many members also shoot in exotic places around the world.

In 2013, our name changed from South Shore Night Photographers and Mass Bay Last Minute Meetup, and we expanded our focus to include a members exhibit in a brick and mortar gallery. It was met with great enthusiasm by members, the public and the press. In August, we opened our second annual night photography show at Laura's Center for the Arts in Hanover, Massachusetts with 45 framed pieces by members. It runs through September 21. In the year ahead, watch for new group shoots, workshop offerings, social gatherings, field trips and online competitions judged by professionals. (Please note: while we try to make our locations physically accessible for all, sometimes that is not possible.)

NPy isn't for everyone, but for those of us mesmerized by the world after dark, we discovered it's a magical time to be out with a camera in the company of friends.  

To begin finding your way in the dark, we recommend reading Jennifer Wu's book, "Night Sky Photography: A Field Guide for Shooting After Dark." Load it onto your iPad as it makes a great field reference when you are out shooting. It is available on Amazon, here.

NENP on Meetup.com is a place to learn about and participate in our group shoots, then sharing the results with one another in the photo albums attached to each meetup. We also post photography news such as where members are exhibiting work or places where you can submit photos in competitions.

Night photo shoots can be difficult -- from needing to be aware of the terrain to watching out for people who would do you harm -- and that's why we encourage shooting with groups or photo partners.

Thank you for helping NENP keep fine art Npy alive in New England. Together we are sure to creatively find our way in the dark.

Cheers,

Kate Hannon, Founder & Co-Organizer

Linda Szabo, Co-Organizer

P.S. If you don't already belong to them, there are other night meetup groups in New England that still organize group shoots. Each group has its own distinct personality, and you'll find they go to different locations at different times and dates. Please feel free to join up and go on some of their shoots, too. It's all good.

Photo Credit: Stata Center ©Connie Pooler 2014, Used with permission.
results.name: New England Night Photographers

topics.name: How to get Pre-Qualified for a Mortgage Loan
Marketalks and Education on Home Buying
Classes on buying and selling homes

results.description: This workshop is created to educate homebuyers and sellers about the home buying process and what to expect with your purchase or sale. This is an informative class covering topics such as: How to Avoid 10 Costly mistakes when buying or selling a home How much house do I qualify for to purchase? What do I need to qualify for a loan? The application process Down Payment Options What loan products are available in today's market? Closing costs, do I have to pay them? What is your credit score? Why working with a realtor is a good thing What is a buyer’s agent? Tips on selecting a home Do I need a home inspection? Is my home insurance included in my mortgage? Do I need an attorney? What is the closing process? Each workshop will include a guest speaker in their expertise field. Seating is limited, so please reserve so that you aren't left out
results.name: Home Buyer & Seller Workshops

results.description: Everyone needs a "me" time after hours of giving, giving, giving (at work, at home, to the community). It is time to "recharge". Time to dedicate sometime to "me"! We meet once a week, in a relaxed setting and let our creative juices flow. Even if you think you are not creative, it is contagious. Glass is a beautiful and seductive material, mysterious, full of surprises and contradictions. Come and enjoy the evening over wine, chocolate and music. Disconnect from the world for a few hours and learn how to be creative with glass.
results.name: Hands on Glass Classes

results.description: Welcome! You have made the important first step in meeting a group of people who share many of the same feelings that you are experiencing right now. This group has been in existence for a number of years on Boston's North Shore, however, our members come from all over New England. The group is very unique in that members have diverse backgrounds. This includes a wide range of professions, trades, economic and religious backgrounds. Over time, feedback from the people that join our group has been that they find comfort in meeting others who know what the divorce/separated experience is all about. Each meeting, the group is facilitated by nonprofessionals. It is important that you know that we are simply a group of concerned people helping people. Tremendous bonds of friendship have been forged and continue beyond the scope of the group. The comfort that you will find in this group has helped hundreds of people over the years and is a testimony to the longevity of the group. You be the judge...we invite you to attend our next meeting. The meetings start at 7:00 p.m. on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of every month. Everyone that attends our meetings, understands what is said in the meeting, stays in the meeting. Confidentiality is respected and you are encouraged to speak on your own terms and when you are ready. Meetings generally last approximately two hours. There are social opportunities that take place in addition to our meetings, if you choose to participate. The comment is often made that people wish they had found this group sooner. Several members who at one time were going through the divorce process continue to stay active in the group because they feel that they have something to share with others who are going through this phase in their life. We hope you will join us.
results.name: North Shore Separated and Divorced Support Group

Emotional safety helps us get emotionally, physically and spiritually grounded so we can access and work with the power of our hearts.

The heart thrives on coherence, a sense that life is purposeful, manageable and meaningful.  This group will support heartful healing and the realization of soul deep vision for ourselves and others.

results.description: This is a newly formed teaching chapter of the Science of Mind Principles founded by Dr. Ernest Holmes. Mission Statement: The Center for Spiritual Living Boston Teaching Chapter  is a gathering place where heightened consciousness, expanded knowledge, and personal enlightment are revealed through guiding, inspiring, and teaching the Principles and Practices of the Science of Mind philosophy. Vision Statement: The Center for Spiritual Living Boston Teaching Chapter  is a warm, safe, diverse, open and inviting community. Through the teaching and living the principles of the Science of Mind philosophy, we draw together as "ONE" unfolding and expanding in consciousness with ease, joy, humor and infinite love. We have been guided by the Inner Voice of the Universe to begin this conscious unfoldment in this area. Anyone on a spiritual journey or anyone seeking a deeper understanding of themselves in relationship to their responses to the Universe would benefit from joining  this group.  For more information, please call  (617) 947-2743

results.description:
May you be happy and warm  :)

Since 1989, Boston Old Path Sangha has been practicing meditation and mindfulness in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

We have regular meetings several times a week at different locations. These are our regular "sittings"-- meetings in which we practice sitting and walking meditation, read a short passage on the dharma (Buddhist teachings), and share our insights into the teachings and trying to bring mindfulness practice into daily life. You can come to any of these sittings without RSVPing.

We also have occasional days of mindfulness, when we gather for a more extended period (usually only half a day, despite the name) to practice together a bit more intensively. These days of mindfulness often focus on some particular theme.

New people who want to learn more about meditation and mindfulness are always welcome at any of our regular sittings or days of mindfulness. One of our experienced members will be happy to introduce you to the basics of the practice and answer and questions you have.

 

For More Information

Our website: http://bostonoldpath.org

Our Facebook page: http://facebook.com/BostonOldPath
results.name: Boston Old Path Sangha

results.description:
Our new CPA Group @chess.com

Chess is awesome, learn it, play it!

Chess is an incredible game...but with all the smartphones, Xboxes, iPads, and iPods out there, it sometimes gets lost in the shuffle. In fact, games don't have to be played in high def or with high-tech controllers to be fully engaging. Chess is one of those games.

With a simple board and 32 pieces, chess continues to captivate amateurs and grandmasters alike. All you need is a basic knowledge of how the pieces move, a fair amount of concentration and insight and you have become a viable chess player.

CPA is about reenergizing our passion for chess and having lots of fun in the process.

CPA is meant to be an aggregation of chess players throughout the Boston area who probably do many other things but still maintain a passion for chess.

On a bi-weekly basis, members will come together to challenge each other to friendly chess matches and conversation. Tournaments will be organized as membership allows.
results.name: Chess Players Anonymous (CPA)
